My son loves this, he has actually been drawing much better since we received the write and learn creative center.Your child can learn how to spell their name and it will teach them how to write in uppercase and lowercase letters.I like that it actually shows up top on the small screen how to write each word and draw out the lines, the shape program is great too!Very educational and it has been great for my little preschooler.I received this product to test out and write an honest review.ProsAge Appropriate, Fun, Educational, Good For On The Go, Fun With Kids, Grows with Child, Interactive, Engaging

This is cute! My daughter loves the Hippo, she is only 18 months and can already count to 5, so no doubt this toy will work in her favor!The lights and sounds make it more than learning, it's about fun too which I think is great for younger children as it keeps them engaged in the whole learning process.My son who is 4 likes this too, he is still learning the alphabet but toys like this help him out a lot!It will also be good for road trips or plane rides, it's not too big.I received this product to test out and to leave my honest opinion.

This is an absolutely stunning watch!  The quality is amazing, It comes packaged in a box, then inside is another box and inside that box is another box that holds the watch.  The watch comes wrapped around a small pillow, even the case for the watch is gorgeous.There is also a gift bag inside the package, so if you are planning on gifting this watch then it has a very nice modern looking bag inside.  There is also an envelope with the instructions included.  Everything you need to learn about this watch is included and set up instructions.The leather straps are made out of great quality calf skin leather, it's stunning, durable and has lots of slots for different size wrists.  My husband has a small wrist and this fits him great.The case is made of great quality stainless steel and the dial window resists scratches.  The watch doesn't track months and years so you will need to reset it at the end of each month before 31 days.The dials are easy to use but also easy to maintain so they won't turn by mistake.  This is a great watch and I thought about keeping it for myself but my husband loves it!I did receive this watch to test out, all opinions are my own.

This is so much fun for both adults and children.  It comes packaged up neatly in a box, and everything is organized into sections.The light is already installed so you don't have to charge it or fiddle around with it.  It's by no means complicated, the light set up part, it comes with a USB and you can plug it into a USB charger or your computer, it makes a fun night light for when I am working late at nights.The blocks are also easy to use and there is literally hundreds of ways to build your own light.  Overall this is a great product for both young and old.

This is a really nice shower curtain, the product arrived sealed and includes the loops to wrap around your shower bar.  The pattern matches pretty much any color, my ceilings are about 9 foot tall and this fits perfectly in my bathroom.  The hoops that are included seem to fit most shower liners, the pattern is very art deco and I am very impressed with the overall quality.Sample Provided.

My son, daughter and husband all love this toy! It took a while to set up as you have to put all the pieces together but my husband likes doing that sort of stuff.Once it's set up there is a cool remote control that my son and daughter have been having fun with, it makes the car go around the track.There are lots of different obstacles and features, it's a super fun toy for both boys and girls.It's bright, colorful and if you have more than one track you can join all the peices together to make a huge one. Overall a very fun toy!I did receive this toy to test out and post my honest opinion.
Gives lots of light and hasn't broke on us yet.*Sample provided for testing

It does it's job and lights up good, I have to say the design is a little flimsy but for the price it's worth it.  It's also pretty small!Discosure: I received a sample to try out, test and leave an unbiased review.
Looks nice on my car, still sticking well after a week.. it's also very clear with a white background so people can see it.

This speaker is pretty powerful and LOUD for such a small object.  It's very easy to use, there are no complicated buttons, just turn it on, connect it and turn the volume up or down.  It's a solid little thing and connected to my Iphone 6 Plus easily.The battery lasted just under 6 hours before it needed charged again, it doesn't take long to charge, it comes with the USB that you can just insert into your laptop or wall.*I received this product to test out and leave an honest review.

This is a really fun toy, my 18 month old daughter loves it! She is very bright and loves toys that stimulate her senses. This is really bright and colorful, she loves the noises and the little animal pictures, my 4 year old even thinks this is fun!Set up was really easy, just clicking a few bits and pieces together, it's a sturdy toy too and hasn't fallen apart yet, my kids aren't gentle with things.It only took my 18 month old a few minutes to figure this and provides hours of fun!The songs and counting and learning about numbers is also great for educational purposes, my daughter can count to about 5 already and toys like this help her!I was provided with this product from VTech to test out and review. All opinions are my own and based solely on my experience with the product.

This is a lovely little box of tea, There are quite a few flavors to choose from, i especially love the night time teas before bed, great and relaxing, everything shipped quickly and was packaged well.

This is so, so much fun!  It has a ton of little parts to put together so I asked my husband to do it, they are really easy though, just clip them in and follow the instructions, it took him all of 10 minutes to put together.  My son is pretty rough with things, he was trying to rock it back and forth and it barely moved.  It's really sturdy and lots of fun for little ones!  There is also a fun app you can use with this!When my son climbs and swings around on the Jungle Gym it gives a little so he can be more flexible which is great, he is 4 and a half years old and absolutely loves his new Monkey Gym.*Sample provided for honest review

Very nice glasses!  They make wine pouring easy, they are great in the dishwasher and since they aren't made out of glass you can't smash them.Disclosure: I received a product in exchange for my unbiased review.

Nice speakers, they are easy to connect to Bluetooth and my phone. The volume isn't very loud and the button is either defective or doesn't allow it to go very loud. If you are looking for a loud speaker then this isn't for you.  *sample received for review

I personally love this product, it's great for my son who is hyper pretty much all the time, he loves to wear the boxing gloves and release his kid frustrations on this punch bag.The base is very stable and we just filled it up with water, it stays put and gives the stick a great reflex.  This is a super great quality product, easy to set up and lots of fun!*Sample provided for testing
I love these batteries, they last a long time after they are charged, they arrived in mint condition and work just as expected.Disclosure: Sample provided for testing.

I have to admit, I had no idea how to play chess, my husband had to show me some of the ropes and explain a few things, but once I got the hang of it I found this game to be a lot of fun and good for thinking!I still have no idea how to play proper chess but this was a good start and I know my son will love it once he is a little older too!Everything arrived in perfect condition, the box and pieces were all in places, one thing I love about this company is that they take great pride in their products.Disclosure: Sample provided for testing.

his works great on my skin, it can be sensitive at times and has no side effects that make my skin break out, shake the bottle a couple of times before use to mix the ingredients together.It has a slight citrus scent that is rather pleasant and not overwhelming.It blends into my skin easily and quickly, doesn't leave it oily or greasy.I haven't noticed my facial area brightening up yet but around my eyes and dark circles are starting to look better.*Sample Provided for testing.

This didn't work for my husband but what works for one may not work for another.  On a plus note the pills were easy to swallow with no side effects.  Everything came sealed in the original packaging.*Sample Provided for my honest review and testing

I tried the brush with a wooden handle from this company and I like it very much, but this back scrubber is not made as well.  I have only used it three times and though it works on my back, some of the fibers are getting so loose already.  It is really hard to wash the soap off the fabric part - maybe because I use a bar soap instead of liquid?? So it takes me quite a bit to rinse it off and squeeze the excess water.  The scrubber is quite long and I am not a very tall person so I have to hold the scrubber from the fabric rather than the handles.  I don't know, it just didn't work so great for me even, maybe I'm doing something wrong.Product provided for reviewing purposes.

My teen daughter has eczema but she also has mild acne especially on her back.  I got this brush for her to do some dry brushing.  Dry brushing is very helpful for people with eczema because the dead cells get removed (gently) and moisturizers absorb better.  Also, dry brushing is good for cases of mild acne and clean the pores a little deeper.We have tried brushing with plastic brushes and though they have worked ok, they seem to be too rough on her skin.  A more gentle brush is what we needed and this brush seems to be working.The bristles are made from natural fiber though I don't know for sure what kind.  The handle detaches which we really like.  Just now, my daughter is struggling with some eczema around her wrists and she uses the brush without the handle, much easier to maneuver.Pleased with the results of the brush.  Don't know how it compares to the regular wooden brush that you can get at the store for less than five bucks, all I know it's that this brush works for my daughter, I hope it lasts a while - we've only seen a couple of bristles come off.Product provided for testing purposes.

I am very impressed with the quality of these goggles.  During the day, snow looks slightly greenish/blue-ish, and when it's a little darker, the snow looks more like a blue-ish color - note: we don't snowboard when it's too dark.They are a perfect fit for either my teen daughter or even an adult like me.  My daughter wears glasses so these are even better for her.  We have a pair of goggles that we like a lot (made in Germany) and these goggles seem to have as good quality, very impressive.One thing I really focus on, is the foam/cushion inside.  Some goggles have very light cushion or it crumbles so easily over time.  This set seem to have good cushion that would last for a while - we haven't found a way to fix goggles which cushion is partially gone.  Also, this is our first set that comes with a super cool case, so handy.Overall, a great addition to our snow gear, can't wait for snow!*Product provided at a discount for reviewing purposes.

These tongs are so easy to use and they adapt to my small hands better than what I normally use - aka cheap tongs.  I like to use tongs a lot when cooking and baking, even with some indoor grilling with my cast iron grill.  My regular tongs are just too awkward to use, these tongs are just easy, simply push the ring (which I do on the counter) and they open, then pull the ring and they lock in perfectly.  I have a couple of pictures to illustrate a little bit of what I have been dealing with - in case you have a similar issue.The first picture shows how nice and tight the tongs are when they close up.  The way they come together is just perfect - when the tip of the tongs are off, food easily falls.  You can also see how these tongs (compared to my cheap tongs which are now in the trash can) don't open too much.  This is great for me with small hands.  The largest of the two tongs opens up to 5 inches vs the 9 inches of opening of the cheap tongs (I was always dropping the large tongs, almost never used them)The second picture shows a couple of angles of the tongs lifting up turkey sausage.  Sausage can be a little slippery so I had to give it a good grip while flipping when I was grilling them.I am very pleased with the results of these tongs - finally retired the clumsy ones.  The Roybens tongs are easy to clean (I do it by hand), and easy to use.  Price is competitive at the time of this review (~ 12 dlls), highly recommended.*Product provided for reviewing purposes.

I ordered a size larger for my daughter and glad I did.  The fabric is almost as thin as the fabric used for slips except that this fabric is not soft and wrinkles very easily.  The dress has elastic around the waist area.  There are no pleats on the top so if you are a little busty it might look a little odd.  My daughter tried it on with a light jacket and it was ok.  The dress itself is not very well made, the stitching is very poor.  It might last a few times, but I am afraid it is going to come apart in the washer and have told my daughter to only wash it by hand.  Not exactly what I was expecting unfortunately, no way this product is worth the price tag.  Low quality.I received this dress with a promotional discount in exchange for an honest review.

I really wanted to like this product - I like DBPOWER products in general.  We have a 7" tablet and though I knew this case would be bigger and not quite fit perfectly, I wasn't too much concerned about it - what I really needed was the keyboard.  We currently use a 10" Bluetooth keyboard that works well with our Android devices.  I figured that having something smaller would be a better choice for my teen daughter and her tablet.The size of the keyboard is great, just perfect for small hands and practical.  You can easily take it everywhere and not worry about carrying anything bigger.  The Bluetooth connection is easy to pair, only a code and you're ready.  It is comes with its standard charging cord (USB-micro USB), no problems.  The light indicator does not show when it's fully charged so that's kind of a guess but not a big deal for me.They keypad on the other hand is terrible.  The cover is all one piece of silicone.  It's like those 99c silicone calculators that don't last.  Under each key you can feel a small button switch that is so small you need to press it just right to see the key appear on the screen of your tablet.  It's almost impossible to try to type while you have the keyboard on your lap (non hard surface) AND using more than two fingers while typing.  So...if you only use your index fingers to type, this works - but don't type too fast.  Not what I was expecting, but might work for some on a tight budget.Product provided for testing purposes.

I have mixed thoughts about this set.  The brushes I received are really nice.  Very well made and tight - no loose hairs, perfect! I have sensitive skin and brushes are something that it's hard for me to use, especially synthetic.  These brushes are so soft and gentle.  I had no problem with using them and my skin just liked them.  My daughter has eczema and she tried some of the brushes as well - we ended up dividing all of them.The PU leather case is another matter - and I'm not talking about the smell.  I received the set when we had 45 degree weather.  The scent was almost gone by the time it got here and it didn't bother me at all - probably a huge difference have I received it in the middle of summer.  My biggest issue is the poor quality of the case.  The stitching is terrible.  One of the compartments that held a large brush was half way unsewn with no easy way to fix it - since the compartment stitching does not show on the other side of the case.  There are also loose threads on the other compartments which it's a matter of time when they come apart.  I really like the brushes, but if I had gone to the store and looked at the stitching of the case, very likely wouldn't have purchased the set and miss on some really good brushes for my sensitive skin.  So....3.5 stars.Product provided at a discount for reviewing purposes

I use a microplane (grater) very often when cooking or baking.  I tried this zester hoping that it would be my to go tool from citrus, to cheese, to spices.  It worked in almost all my uses except spices.  The zester is very light weight.  It is extremely sharp which makes my job easy.  When washing, be sure to wipe towards you - if you want to keep your sponge and fingers.  It is ergonomic and has bent edges underneath.  I think they are meant to aid food flow, which works most of the time unless the food is too wet, like citrus zest, garlic, or onion - more on that later.  It is long and has 8 inches of grating area.  The green color is neat and it also comes with a protective cover that stays put.TestsChocolate:  Really nice curls, no residue underneath.  Only a few passes and I had all the shavings necessary to top my dessert.Cheese: I tried Asiago and Parmesan.  The zester made good looking ribbons and I had no problem cleaning the zester afterwards.Citrus zest: I worked with orange (pictured), lemon, and lime.  They all worked really well except that I had residue under the zester inside the bent edges.  I had to constantly shake or hit the grater against the counter to get the zest.  The more I used it, the more residue underneath.Garlic, onion: We often use grated garlic and onion in our cooking.  This zester grates both perfectly well using a large (elephant type) garlic clove and onion but they release so much juice that both of them stick too much to the grater.  I think I'd continue to use a garlic press and a regular grater for the onion.Spices: I tried cinnamon and nutmeg.  They didn't work.  There were coarse pieces that were too hard to bite.  I'll stick to my spice grater that gives me powdered cinnamon and nutmeg every time.Overall it's a good zester.  It really depends on what your needs are.  I like that it fits in my drawer and it's easy to spot.  Competitive price at the moment of this review (8-9 dlls), good to try.Product provided for testing purposes.

This is a really nice charging station.  I like multiple USB charges they are so practical, but some of them can be a little disorganized.  As we continue to include more electronics in our home, our needs for organizing them (plus all cables) have increased.This charging station is a space saver.  It comes with an adapter (shown in pictures) that can sit hidden behind a desk.  There is about 45 inches of cord between the charging station and the adapter - that's almost four feet of length, meaning the adapter won't be dangling in mid air when the charging station sits on a desk.  There is another 44 inches of cord between the adapter and the plug that goes to the wall.  So there are neat ways to set this up.I have included a few pictures of my temporary setting - planning on taking this to a different area later.  As you can see, I have several long cords, I used some of the Velcro ties included (comes with a total of 5) and the cords kept in one place.  The last picture shows how my station would look if I only use short cables, which is probably what I am going to get for all of them, besides, the devices charge faster with shorter cables.We only have Android devices so it's easy to keep the same kind of cords for all USB ports.  One last note, the first dock is wider than the rest, if you can see in the pictures, I have a battery charger at the very front, that's the only place it fit.  Overall, very good charger, quick to set and quick to charge.  It does not come with cables but I highly recommend purchasing them.  It will be much easier to use and would look better especially if using at an office setting.Product provided for testing purposes.

The sprayThis spray is much more effective than other harmful aerosols that don't work.  This spray simply works.  Spray about 5 times directly to toilet water - the water should look cloudy.  The oils in the product would create a thin barrier in the water so when you drop number two, the "two" gets encapsulated preventing the release of stinky smell.  All you get is the scent of this spray.  It works, IT-JUST-WORKS! and if you are like us and only have one working bathroom, this becomes an awesome necessity.The scentI really like the way this smells.  It is a clean scent.  Like "I just cleaned the bathroom" scent.  It is not overpowering it's just right.  This is probably one of my favorite scents (in addition to baby powder scent), because it just smells clean without a chemical after scent.InnovationI really like the new way of dealing with bathroom sprays.  Natural and not harmful to the environment.  It is a new thing so I hope the price comes down a bit.  Even though it might last longer than your regular aerosol spray, the amount of these new sprays is quite small for the price.  It's only 2 ounces - 1/4 cup.  Yes, you only need a few sprays so you get a lot of sprays, but it's still a bit high.  Like I said, it's a new product, hopefully it would become a bit more affordable - that's because I want to give one to each one of my friends and my wallet is small!!OverallWorth the try.  Highly recommended to those who want something natural, have allergies, or just need something that truly works!++Product provided for testing purposes.

I was really looking forward to trying this treatment.  I have done different oil treatments and they've all been really good for my hair.  This oil treatment smells really good but unfortunately it has too much Paraffinum Liquidum - which I didn't know it is a refined mineral oil.My skin gets irritated with any kind of mineral oil product, so I was sure to only use this oil on the last two inches of my hair before washing.  I warmed up the oil, applied it on the ends of my hair, let it sit for about half an hour and then washed it.  I was hoping that the other wonderful oils in this product would bring up their great benefits and maybe outweigh the heaviness of the mineral oil but it didn't work well for me.  My hair didn't show much improvement - maybe because I washed it too soon?  I only tried this treatment three times.On the other hand, my friend who has coarse hair (and no allergic reactions to mineral oil) tried a few drops on her short hair and it looked really pretty.  She had a nice shine without looking too greasy at least for the day she used it.  If you don't have mineral oil allergies you might like this product.  It smells quite nice, I was hoping for more macadamia oil though.**Product provided for testing purposes.

I've been using this product for three weeks now.  I have two teeth that are very sensitive due receding gum lines.  I didn't know I'd been brushing too hard but when I found out that this was the problem, I changed my technique.  Still, the gum lines were taking a little to long to come back and the gum around these two teeth was becoming sensitive as well.I began to use this solution by simply applying a few drops directly to the base of those two teeth and a little more on the gum.  It was very sensitive at first and I wasn't sure I liked it.  But with time and consistency, the area became less and less sensitive.  At this point, I thought that maybe it was just healing on its own and this product was not helping so I quit using it for two days and the sensitivity came back - those two teeth are showing some dentine at the base.  I started again and it helped.Another thing I noticed was some quick healing after hurting my gum with popcorn hulls.  I flossed but my gum was still irritated.  Normally it takes several days for my gum to heal on its own especially since I keep on hurting myself when I eat.  I used this solution and in two days my gum was back to normal.  I was very pleased with that.Overall, the product is natural and works but takes very long and the price is a bit high at the moment.  It could REALLY help some people in serious need of healing or people that just want to go back to natural remedies that work.  I know everybody is different and the seriousness of the issue matters.  So far, I am glad I had the opportunity to review this product, it came at the right time.**Product provided for testing purposes.

I have a Samsung Xpress SL-M2070FW monochrome printer.  It has been very beneficial to our projects.  This is the first time I have had to replace the toner cartridge since we use the Eco mode for printing.  The toner is very similar to the original.  They have the same length and width except for a small tab that sits on the front while installing the toner - the tab does not affect installation nor performance.The compatible toner comes very well sealed, very pleased with that.  There is a paper that needs to be removed (with instructions to remove) and a covering on the side of the roller.At first, the printer did not want to recognize the chip that comes with this toner.  The printer immediately displayed the not compatible legend but this legend went away as soon as I started printing.  The first few pages were a little smeared on the top, but by page 5 I saw a complete clean page with nice color on the letters - no smudging.  My system then seems like it did a self reset or something because I was able to see the new ink levels, as if the toner was an original.I am attaching a few pictures to show the comparison of the original Samsung cartridge vs GT cartridge.  And a picture to show the first few prints (sorry I accidentally tore the page before taking the pic) plus the system at now 98 percent.*Product provided for testing purposes.

My 16 year old daughter was interested in reading this book.  As she prepares to head out and look for an opportunity to getting in the working field, she thought a few tips would be helpful.Some of the things she read, we had already discussed in the last few years.  The part that she liked best was how to act in an interview - I think this had her a little nervous.  She is a little more confident now after reading the book.  The author makes some comments about easing stress in a teen's life suggesting yoga and meditation.  Not everybody has embraced middle eastern practices so it's just something to note, and talk about.Overall it has good and simple advice,  something that can be practiced everyday with the people around you.  Trying to keep connected in the real world with real people while being genuine.Product provided for reviewing purposes.

This hub has been very beneficial for my husband's office setting.  As he expands his capacity with a laptop, the need for USB ports has increased.  The files are transferred fast and the speed for a duplicate monitor and a nano mouse shows no delay or drag.The hub is very light, slightly less than four ounces - without the power cord.  It is very easy to use and our laptops had no difficulty recognizing the ports right away.  I think we like the fact that it has enough space to charge other electronics while working on the laptop.  No need to unplug a device to charge the other one, this is great.  It looks neat and classy, blends well with the whole setting, pleased with the results so far.Product provided for reviewing purposes.

Most eye gels or serums come in small amounts, bottles, dispensers.  This gel is definitely an exception.  The bottle is quite large and the price is affordable (at the time of this review ~15-16 dlls) for the quality and quantity of product.I am a fan of Hyaluronic Acid and Vit C serums - I take both of these supplements orally.  I have seen really good results with other products but I have to admit, this is the first product I have tried that the results have been noticeable very quickly.The product feels sticky, so you only need a very small amount.  I use as much as what a couple of grains of quinoa would look like, really, that's all I need.  Since it has aloe vera and some glycerin, the product can create a thick layer if you use a lot, so in this case, less is better.I have very sensitive skin and yet, I am able to use this gel everyday without any issues.  My eyes feel smooth and they don't look too puffy in the morning.  I definitely recommend to test a small amount around the jaw (or neck) before applying it to your eyes, just in case you have a reaction to an ingredient.  There have been few people that have had a small irritation after using Hyaluronic acid (for example), so please test it somewhere other than your eye, just in case.Overall this is a wonderful product to try at an affordable price.  I am very pleased with the results so far and that's only after about 5 days of using the product.  Definitely one of my favorite eye gels.Product provided for testing purposes, my words are my own honest opinion.

If you have dry hair like me, this is a wonderful shampoo and conditioner.  And if you REALLY like the scent of coconut like me, this is a super amazing shampoo and conditioner!  If you are not crazy about coconut scent, please don't order, the smell is really strong.The shampoo leaves your hair feeling clean and feeling fresh.  The conditioner moisturizes very well without making your hair too heavy or weighed down.  My hair is so soft and still bouncy.  I like how it brings a nice delicate shine to my hair.  My biggest problem is the last couple of inches of my hair where my hair looks the driest - especially as the winter weather arrives, so I really focused on conditioning this area.  I had great results with just a few times of conditioning.  I am very excited about this product, I know it must be the coconut craze, but I love it!**Product provided for testing purposes.

This is exactly what we needed.  A very simple solar light that doesn't look ostentatious, it's bright, and it's so simple to install.  It literally comes with two screws and everything else is put together.  Simply find the spot, mark where the screws go and your ready to place it.We have it installed outside our shop where there is no lighting.  The sun is direct so we have no trouble with it being charged - since it doesn't need batteries....got to love that!!  We have had a couple of super cloudy days but somehow it is enough to keep the panel charged.  No trouble at night, the light is still pretty bright.  Very pleased with the results, no problems whatsoever.Product provided for testing purposes.

What a great quality gym bag! Not only it looks really nice but it is strongly made.  The stitching is very secure and uniform, something I really look into when purchasing bags.  It is breathable and comfortable to carry.  I like the extra compartment for a laptop or tablet.  It is not very thin, it has some padding to it but it is definitely not bulky.  It comes with a simple bag for your mat that seems to fit any standard mats.  The purple bag is really neat, goes with the gym clothes we have.  Very pleased with the bag, it's about 20 inches in length (or a little less).  Good competitive price - at the time of this review, for the quality.**Product provided for testing purposes.

These files are very gentle.  As the cold weather approaches, my heels tend to dry out a lot and can easily crack if I don't pay attention to them.  The files are easy to use and leave my heels so smooth.  They are not very coarse and in reality is like getting 4 for a decent price.  The fact that each one has two usable surfaces, helps with ergonomics and how you like to use them around your feet - no awkwardness while handling them.The files are true to measurements, 8 inches in height and about 1.5 inches at the widest point.  They are lightweight and easy to store in a drawer or a small basket.**Product provided for testing purposes.

We don't have Apple products here but my family often comes to visit and it has been a problem when they forget a charging cord or anything like that.  This adapter worked on my sister's MacBook.  She used it for charging and also with a regular thumb drive.  Very helpful and glad to have had the opportunity to review this product.

I once read: "Bamboo is to cotton what cashmere is to wool", I can see why now.  The cloths are so soft and gentle.  The cloths have a natural sheen almost like silk or cashmere and it drapes like that type of fabric as well.  I like that the cloths are perfect for delicate skin and it's good for my daughter with eczema.These cloths are perfect to wipe off the sweat of my face when working out, they seem to absorb well.  I also have noticed that there is really not a bad odor on the cloth even afterwards.  I quickly wash the cloth with a gentle bar soap and hang it to dry (it's just easier at the moment)Good quality product, very pleased to have had the opportunity to review this product.  Highly recommended.Product provided for testing purposes.

I really enjoy the feel of fresh clean sheets and pillows.  I sleep better when there is a coolness in my sheets rather than too warm - even in the winter.  This silk pillowcase gives me that sensation of coolness and freshness that I like, as a result, I sleep more comfortably.The pillowcase is a nice size, I could possibly fit a larger pillow than what I have right now - a rather small standard pillow.  I also realized that my hair wasn't as tangle in the morning as it normally is which sort of surprised me.As for washing, I use cold water and I have a dryer with a rack in the middle for drying delicates like silk.  If you can, simply hang it dry rather than placing it in the dryer - it could shrink a lot.Good quality, a bit on the high end $$ at the moment.  Product provided for reviewing purposes.

We make pizza every Friday since it is our family night.  Most of the time I make a 16 inch pizza so this peel is a bit small for it.  Once the pizza is baked, I could remove it from the pan easily with the peel - to place it on a wooden board to cut.  I still think that the pizza peel should only handle smaller sizes, it would feel more comfortable.  It seemed that my 16 inch pizza was too heavy for the peel, it just felt like it was bending a little.The cutting blade comes with a protective (rubber) sleeve.  The one I received was not very sharp so I was sure to run my knife sharpener several times before I used it.  Even though I made a larger pizza, I was able to cut it with a couple of rocking motions on each end.  It worked great.  For me, just the cutting blade is worth the money.  I can sharpen cutting blades, I cannot sharpen cutting wheels (at least, not very well)Overall is a good set for my needs.  It is too large to store but I am finding ways near my pizza stone.  I received a set from the manufacturer for testing and reviewing purposes.

I have been taking this product for over a week and it seems to be helping with my knees.  I take about 1/4 tsp and sprinkle it in 1/4 cup of orange juice.  To me, this powder taste somewhat salty with a smidge of bitterness.  It mixes well with the orange juice and I seem to absorb it better this way than in a capsule.  I used to take many capsules of Glucosamine (with and without Chondroitin) but prefer this simple way to take it.  So far so good, hope it just gets better.

After purchasing another product from bulk supplements, I had the opportunity to receive a small bag of stevia to try it out.  I have use stevia from different brands, most of them have a sugar alcohol in them, but not this one.I really like the sweetness of this product is definitely extreme.  I have to be so very careful when sprinkling this in my coffee because just a pinch can be too much.  I don't like my coffee very sweet (I take it without sugar most of the time) so really, just a tiny sprinkle is necessary.I use about one teaspoon of stevia in a gallon of Ice tea.  My family has never been crazy about the stevia aftertaste but with this particular brand, they like it.  I think the secret is just to have the right amount or your drink can be easily overwhelmed by 'sweetness' that could have an 'off' taste.  I'm glad I was able to try it, now I know what to buy.

I received the WH-B05 model for reviewing purposes.  I'm an avid baker and use a kitchen scale a lot.  I currently have a scale that has only one decimal for ounces so this scale is actually better for me.  We bake dozens and dozens of dinner rolls that need to be perfectly divided for even baking and selling.  Each roll is around 1.25 ounces and this scale has helped with accuracy.The scale itself is very light, it weighs just below 6 ounces (with batteries)  The surface on top has a diameter of 4.25 inches which if you need to place a large bowl, plate, or any object on top, it could be difficult to read the display.  Also, the display is a bit sensitive and everytime I press the buttons to either change from grams to ounces or use the tare function, the display reacts - like when pressing hard on the display of a calculator.The scale does not have an on/off switch, it turns off automatically after a couple of minutes of idling.  Overall it seems to be a good and accurate scale but it's not a heavy duty scale.  It is simple and compact, and could be useful when traveling.

These bags work well with soft items.  I am showing step by step pictures of the compression of two small pillows.  I used the ~17x27 inch bag.  The system works but the quality of the bag is not as what I necessarily expected.  The plastic feels more like cellophane, not quite as thin but very similar.  I am concerned the bags will puncture easily but I also know that simple tape would fix a small hole.The vacuum hole is about an inch in diameter without the valve cap.  The hand vacuum I used was slightly over an inch in diameter so I had to press firmly to keep a good seal while vacuuming - it worked well though.  The bag won't inflate when you take the vacuum off the valve, it is sealed.  The cap is to ensure the sealing but you don't have to rush to put the cap on, there is no hissing sound ;)All in all, the bags are good and they are functional.  Not sure about the longevity of the product but so far they work.  Price is about 15 dlls for all three bags at the moment of this review.  Might be a little on the above average price.Product provided for testing purposes

What a great experience with the Peak Reserve opener.  It is so easy to use and the entire job goes so smooth.  First of all, the foil cutter makes the most precise and level cutting edge on the foil.  It is just perfect all the way around no matter how clumsy I am.  The cutter sits at a certain height and it cuts all the way around uniformly and perfectly clean.The wine opener itself goes down very smoothly.  I thought I was going to need full force to go through the cork but the worm went in so effortlessly.  This was the first time I'd tried an opener this style, but it happened that a few days ago, I went to a wedding where the bottle opener happened to be a similar model -happened to find out it was a $$$ model.  I had to try it and find out if it was any different than $$ Peak Reserve.  No difference.  They were both as easy and neat to handle, they both look classy and elegant, the only difference was the price.  It also comes in a super neat box, definitely an elegant gift for the wine lover.Very pleased with the results, glad to have the opportunity to review this opener as provided from the manufacturer.

This kindle book is very simple and easy to follow.  I have a couple of friends who got married this year and I recommended this book to them (especially since they have kindle unlimited, which makes the book free)I tried a few of the recipes and they are tasty.  They are all for beef.  So if you eat a lot of beef, this is a good book to give some variety.  I think my favorite is the citrus marinade because it is simple, I have all the ingredients (all the time) and it enhances the flavor of even the most simple (cough, cheap, cough) piece of steak.Most of the recipes are basic and not very extreme -which for a new cook, makes it affordable and tasty.  There are other more expensive marinades like one that includes bourbon, or whiskey, or wines.  I think I rather drink those alcohols than put them in my meat to marinate, BUT, they give a delicious flavor to the meat (we often use Port wine on lamb, for example)The book is only for beef recipes, but if you are a little bit more experienced in the kitchen, you'll see that some of the marinades will work well on other meats like lamb, veal, and even pork.  The proportions seem to be balanced as far as we have tried them.Our favorites so far:- Orange juice (or what I call 'citrus')- Spicy jalapeno- Scrumptious garlic (gotta be a garlic lover for this one, yum)- Pineapple- Red pepper balsamicWe have tried a combination of others with what we have in hand.  I have had the opportunity to review this book for a month and this is what we've done.  So far so good, best for people who are beginning to get creative and definitely eat lots of meat!

This is a nice organizer.  The looks are classy and the entire product is well made.  The Velcro is good quality and the stitches seem well reinforced.  It can be used on a stroller or a bike, both work really well.  You can place a couple of bottles and other essential items like wipes and a diaper or two but don't expect to fill it up the way it is shown in the pictures, your items will be definitely on the floor as soon as you start picking up speed.  It is a good organizer for the essentials.  Product provided for reviewing purposes.

My teen daughter is preparing her pirate custom that includes a wig of color.  So when I was offered the opportunity to review one of this wigs, I chose the purple one for her.  It fits her nicely but she needs to secure it with pins underneath.  We brushed the wig with a short bristles hairbrush and there was some strands that came off but not as bad as I thought.  It is definitely a fun wig and cool for an outfit.  I've been tempted to purchase a wig for myself but for everyday purposes, still on the looks, these are fun wigs only.

I accepted to review this set with the hopes of improving the circulation in my legs.  I bruise very easily so I thought that a good massage will help.  Well, it sort of does but not much.  The round massager was not very good for me, it has very stiff rubber teeth that just feel very rough.  I tried using oil or a moisturizer and it helped but it still felt too rough.  So I opted for the angled massager.  It works better except that I need to be very careful how much I press.  The first time I ended up with tiny little bruises all over the inside of my thighs - which is where I normally bruise the most.  So I released the pressure while massaging and that helped a little.I have been using the angled massager for almost two weeks and I have noticed just a little less bruising when I hit myself with the corner of a table - for example.  So I know it will take more time.  I am not using this for the purpose of eliminating cellulite but to improve circulation.  Product provided.

This is a great item.  We have successfully plugged into an MP3 and a CD player and then paired it to a pair of Bluetooth headphones and speaker.  Very easy to pair (no codes required) and fast.  The device is so small, it's 2 inches long by 1 inch wide.  It is less than half an inch thick.  It doesn't disturb any of the settings we had, it looks nice an classy.  Definitely a great device when you still have items around your house that are in 'transition' mode, ha! Now we can enjoy our Bluetooth earbuds with any device around the house without disturbing the rest of the household.  Price is not bad at around 25 dlls if you have several items that can use this TX-RX or one that you really like.  It is discrete enough to fit in a shirt pocket with corded earbuds if necessary.  Range was about 25-30 feet for us - also depends on how straight the path is between your device and your receiver.  Product provided for testing purposes.

I have tried other products from Joyal Beauty and they have all been of good quality.  When I was offered this eye cream for review I was happy to try it.  I have used this gel for 24 days, twice a day without a miss.  I am very diligent with products like this because I know how important it is to see how long they take to begin seeing results.This gel smells delicious, like fresh cucumbers.  It takes about 30 seconds to absorb and it goes really well under your regular moisturizer.  I use a pump and that's enough for both eyes and even a little extra that ends up on my forehead.  After 5 applications, I was able to notice a change on the puffiness of my eyes.  Let me tell you, I look like a raccoon with puffy eyes in the summer.  Our days are pretty long here at our small farm and I don't get enough sleep.At two weeks I was able to feel softer skin.  And at three weeks I noticed the skin around my eyes was brighter.  Vitamin C serums brighten up the skin but they can be too strong for your eyes and cause irritation.  This gel is gentle.  Doesn't have a huge amount of Vitamin C but for that reason, it takes a bit longer to work.Now, 47 applications later, my eyes look much better - even though I still don't get enough sleep.  But I have to say that the gel surprised me when I began to see some fine lines look smoother, not quite disappeared but wow...just wow.I was also curious to know how long this bottle would last.  The container is not transparent so it is difficult to guess.  I opened the bottle and I seem to have around 3/4 of gel left.  I also weighed the amount of gel that comes with one pump (very consistent amount) to see if I could get an average.  I think that at this rate, the gel would last me approximate 2 months - give or take a week.  This is with two applications everyday.In conclusion, natural, fairly balanced gel, good for even delicate skin, and good price for it - a bit less than 18 dlls at the moment.  I definitely recommend you give it a try.

This is a very pretty pair of earrings.  I like to wear them myself.  They sparkle but don't look too cheap.  Only issue is that I have delicate ears so I have to soak the earrings in alcohol for 5 minutes before wearing them.  Then I can only wear them for a few hours.  They are super cute.  Product provided for testing purposes.

Nice pair of earrings, looking shiny but not gaudy.  They look beautiful on my teen daughter.  I have delicate ears so I can only wear them for a very short period of time before my earlobes start itching - that's about an hour tops.  They look neat on natural light, hope they last a while.  Product provided for reviewing purposes.

This is a very cute bohemian chain but unfortunately is not practical to wear as an anklet.  I tried but ended up getting caught in the chain and one of the links opened and the anklet came apart.  I was able to fix it but I won't be able to wear it as an anklet again.  On the arm looks ok but it has to be a little tight.  Product provided for testing purposes.

This anklet is quite simple.  Just pearls and tassels going through an elastic band - it doesn't have a clasp.  The anklet I received has tassels only on half of the whole anklet. It looks cute except that the last tassel is next to the knot where chain begins/ends.  The tassels are not spaced evenly either, but it doesn't show too much.  It looks cute and it's almost perfect.  Product provided for testing purposes.

This set of anklets are so gorgeous! My teen daughter received so many compliments when attending a party.  They are just the right size for he and combine very well with her clothes and style.  They shine but don't look gaudy at all.  The price is average at the moment of this review (around 8dlls for the set) but the looks are much nicer than that.  Product provided for reviewing purposes.

Bought this after deciding I needed a bit more carry on room than my normal tote, but didn't want to get something that might get turned away at the gate as I often times carry my camera, lenses, laptop, etc... in my carry on.  To be safe, I wanted it to fit within the carry-on dimensions even including wheels and handle - something most 22" uprights don't.  This fits perfectly, and is easy to maneuver.  Unlike one of the other reviewers, I have not had any issue with the wheels, even on slightly uneven pavement.  If you go over a bump, just lift a tiny bit on the handle - or if the ground is particularly uneven, roll it behind you on two wheels like a normal case.  The integrated lock is a nice plus, and the bag is also well organized.  That said, I do have two complaints with the bag - neither one major, but the reason for subtracting a star.First, I was hoping the hardside spinner would be a bit more... well... hard sided.  These sides might provide a bit more protection against sharp objects, but are still limited protection against crushing.  I suppose they were also trying to keep the weight of the bag reasonable, but I'm not sure I would have made quite the same trade-off.Second, the zipper can be a little bit of a pain to get started.  It's a nuisance at the most, but not an issue I have with my other bags.

Great investment - far superior to an Omni-Bounce or other portable alternatives.  I got one of these to keep with my flash instead of the Omni-Bounce I used previously.  I trimmed a small amount off each edge of the reflector panel so that the overall width was the same as my flash and it could be easily slid into its pouch along with it.  Then I stuck a bit of velcro on the back of it and ordered Demb's Mega-Flip It diffuser panel (you can purchase it separately from Demb).  With those two minor modifications I now had a diffuser that was portable to carry with the flash, and if I needed a bit more surface area, I could simply attach the Mega-Flip It.Even without the Mega-Flip It modification, it provides great light control.  Angled a bit towards the subject it provides solid lighting with much softer shadows than a direct flash.  Pointed more toward the ceiling it produces a catch light while the ceiling bounce provides soft lighting.  It also feels less clumsy to attach than the fold-up soft boxes and doesn't require you stick any velcro on your flash.For what it's worth, my wedding photographer also used a Demb Flip-It and I was quiet happy with the photos.

They work, and the heat shrink makes them feel marginally better made than most other similar adapters. However, the reality is that the inner socket is barely connected to the outer. Like others, if you tighten the bulb too far, it will still break. There may be some argument that this protects the actual light socket or the bulb, but mostly it is annoying. Why can't someone make a socket adapter like this which is a more solid piece?

Bought two packs of these for the kids to play with at an outdoor wedding reception, and my wife put out a bucket of ice water for them to fill them from.  It ended up 90 and humid, so they're probably the best thing we did.  The kids had a blast (some of the adults got in on it too), and at less than a dollar per squirt gun we didn't have to worry about people taking them or losing them, and they didn't break the bank.  Obviously understand what you're getting though - these are inexpensive, cheap plastic squirt guns.  You shouldn't expect them to compare to a Super Soaker - clearly the larger, name branded squirt guns are superior, but these get 5 stars for being a great value and excellent for the price.

Bought this to encourage my cats to drink more.  Wanted a fountain that I could run through the dishwasher and also would look attractive.  The stoneware fits both requirements - the top and base can go through the dishwasher, and it looks so much better than the plastic fountains.  My only complaint is with the filters.  The charcoal filter seems to plug up more often than it should really be replaced.  When this happens the water flow slows to a trickle, I have to take it apart, rinse out and shake the filter, put it back together, and hope it starts flowing again without needing to replace the filter right away.  Still, my cats love it - I now almost never see them drinking from their regular bowls anymore.

I use these around my litter boxes since I have a cat that routinely manages to spray over the edge of the box (even with high sided boxes she'll manage to spray out of the opening where she climbs in).  I used to use those plastic mats that are designed to catch litter, but urine would tend to pool in them and catch litter, which was disgusting and hard to clean.  These I just fold them in half, dump the excess litter back into the box, and then throw them in the wash.

Fantastic little supports.  Squeezing the handle spreads the ends apart almost like a jack.  Another lever frees the rod to either collapse the support or quickly extend it to the approximate length you need (and then a squeeze or two of the handle will tighten things up).  The ends click onto balls at either end of the support so you can use the support to hold things at an angle as well.  Great for things like cabinets.  I've used these and their big brother (same thing but longer) to hold pieces in place while I screw them down (last thing was overhead paneling in a shed), that would have otherwise needed an extra pair of hands to help out.  No more trying to wedge things in place with my head or other odds and ends.

They work, and the heat shrink makes them feel marginally better made than most other similar adapters.  However, the reality is that the inner socket is barely connected to the outer.  Like others, if you tighten the bulb too far, it will still break.  There may be some argument that this protects the actual light socket or the bulb, but mostly it is annoying.  Why can't someone make a socket adapter like this which is a more solid piece?

This is a cheap knock off of the Peak Design Camera Capture Clip.  I own one of the Peak Design clips and several of their straps, and could not be happier with their system.  The system is modular, and makes it easy to switch from different carry styles for the camera - sling, neck, wrist cuff, hand strap, etc...  I also attached their anchor links to the tripod mount of my longer lens so that I can carry it by the lens (vs a traditional strap where the weight of the lens hangs from the camera).The clip - which this is a knock off of - acts like a camera holster, providing another way to carry the camera at ready.  The camera with attached plate slides down into the clip and clicks into place.  Depending which model you get, the plate is also Arca compatible, so you can still use it with an Arca clamp.  Since my camera has an L bracket on it, I actually attached the plate to an Arca clamp, so I can easily remove it to use the L bracket when I want to shoot from a tripod.Couldn't say enough positive things about Peak Design - they're clearly well thought out and engineered by people that love photography.  Don't take a risk on your camera with a cheap knock off.If you want to reward some company overseas for ripping off an American designed product in a way that would likely be illegal if it were done here, then go for it.  But don't complain if it breaks and drops your camera.  Also don't complain if domestic firms have to close their doors, jobs move overseas, people stop innovating (because someone else will just steal it), quality goes downhill, or companies who do innovate need to charge more.

As was pointed out in another review, this is a cheap knock off of the Peak Design Camera Capture Clip. Also don't complain if domestic firms have to close their doors, jobs move overseas, people stop innovating (because someone else will just steal it), quality goes downhill, or companies who do innovate need to charge more.

This is as much a review on Samsung's support as it is their Gear series of devices.  I don't make a habit of cross-posting reviews, but the experience I've had with Samsung is bad enough I think it warrants sharing, even between different devices in the same line.  Device failures I can tolerate, but a manufacturer refusing to stand behind their product I can't.Short of it though is this - after just 7 months, there are multiple things wrong with my watch (dead Bluetooth, delaminating glass, won't boot, and won't charge), and Samsung won't repair any of them under warranty.  While there are no cracks in the glass or other signs of physical damage, they're calling the delaminating glass "physical damage" and are demanding $149 to repair it.  Further, unless I pay them to fix the glass (which isn't even a major issue yet), they refuse to repair any of the other issues.  Here's the general timeline though:~ 3 months: Bluetooth starts getting flaky. Have to periodically disconnect it and reconnect it from my phone or reboot it for it to find it again.~ 5 months: The glass starts to delaminate from the LCD with no clear damage or cause - it isn't chipped, cracked, or scratched. It began in one corner and started working its way around the edges.~ 7 months: The Bluetooth dies completely and will not turn back on. When I'd try to turn it back on in settings, it would pop up a "Processing" message, then turn back off. So I factory reset the watch back to original settings. After factory reset, the watch booted to an "Unknown error" screen and would boot no further.~ 8 months: Watch stops charging, so now I can't even boot it back to the "Unknown error" screen to show anybody. Fortunately I took a picture first.~ 10 months: Finally get around to opening a ticket with Samsung and send the watch in for warranty service. After they get it, I get an email telling me the repair price has changed from $0 to $149, with no explanation. When I call in (since their website wasn't working), I'm told the "certified engineer" categorized the screen as physically damaged. In addition, they refuse to fix any of the other issues with the watch unless I also pay them to fix the screen.Samsung has just sold me on either Motorola or Apple (the latter of which I never envisioned as possible, but since I regularly hear of awesome experiences with Apple support...).... As for the watch itself, and bearing in mind the Gear S watches should be more refined than my Gear 2 Neo...  On the whole, until it broke, my Gear 2 Neo was functional, but clearly still a bit rough around the edges given wearable technology was (and is) still new. In particular, the heart rate monitoring function never worked well. It was finicky when I was sitting still, and absolutely untrustworthy if I was exercising. While going up stairs it told me my pulse was in the 50's (I am usually closer to 75 when I'm resting...) and that was hardly an isolated incident.  Some software functions were also a bit flaky (like sync'ng exercise data with S Health - it used to be erratic at times), though I expect that should be getting better.  Honestly, for the Gear S specifically, refer to the reviews of that hardware.  My review is primarily to serve as warning about issues with Samsung support.

I bought this to support my lens when shooting macro photos with lens extension tubes.  The tubes, especially when stacked, tend to allow the lens to sag a bit, so this helps support it in the proper position.  It screws on securely to the end of my rail and serves that purpose well.  However, some of the other options out there feature a Velcro strap that goes over the top of the lens (not present on this design), which I'm subtracting 1 star for.  Originally I also was disappointed that the rings which the lens rested on are hard - I had been hoping for something more akin to rubber O-rings - but in retrospect that may not be a bad thing (for example, on zoom lenses the lens can slide smoothly on these as you zoom in and out).I've included a photo of it on my macro setup while I was fit-testing everything.  Obviously in the picture with the camera pointed straight downward, the lens support isn't serving much function.  However, it gives you an idea what to expect.

Bought this to expand my storage a bit.  I already owned a Craftsman top chest and bottom cabinet in dark grey.  Unfortunately, Craftsman no longer offers dark grey, and at the time of my purchase they only offered this deep version intermediate chest in red.  As near I can tell though, Waterloo makes the chests for Craftsman, and Waterloo had this option in black.The shelf is sturdy and spacious, with deep drawers (vs the normal 12" depth on a lot of middle chests).  They open and close smoothly on their ball bearing slides.  They don't feel like they close as firmly as my existing chest and cabinet (which has a nice satisfying thunk into the full closed position), but that's nitpicking a bit.All that said, I did have one issue with my chest though.  The retaining nut or clip that should be on the back of the lock to keep it firmly installed in the front panel of the chest wasn't installed or present in the packaging.  As a result, the lock falls out of mine.  When it falls out, the bar that connects to it falls down and gets in the way of the operation of the top drawer.  I will need to write Waterloo to get the right parts sent out to me.UPDATE: I emailed Waterloo, and less than a day later they responded, apologizing for the missing part, and they promptly shipped it out, no questions asked.  Great customer service!

Love these mugs.  There are just a couple caveats to be aware of though:First, the plain stainless steel versions can be run through the dishwasher on the top rack, but the colored ones need to have the metal body of them hand washed.  While I like the colored ones better, this resulted in me returning my colored ones and ordering plain stainless ones to replace them - I prefer ease vs aesthetics in this case.Second, these 20oz versions are fairly tall, and they won't fit under many coffee makers.  For example, I can't place them under my Keurig.  I have to either brew into another cup and pour into these, or hold them at an angle under it.  Still, I wanted something that would hold two full cups of coffee with a bit of creamer and a few ice cubes, and the smaller size wouldn't hold that.

The transformer I received puts out 24V instead of 12V.  It's labeled as 12V.  I ordered 12V.  But the multi-meter shows closer to 24V.  Somehow this even passed their "quality control" - it has a QC passed sticker on it.  Glad I didn't hook it up to anything important.

I'm not using these for canning, but had bought a few of these jars in different colors and sizes to use as countertop storage canisters for things like sugar and Splenda. They're well made, attractive, and latch down quite securely. In my case, I also stuck a couple of chalkboard labels on them. The metal hardware can be taken off to put them through the dishwasher if desired. I've included a photo so you can also see the scale of them (the two in the photo are both 6-3/4 oz).

Bought this as a replacement lamp for a Honeywell UV air cleaner (which takes Honeywell part RUVBULB1/C).  The bulb fit my air cleaner perfectly out of the box.  Unlike some other reviewers, I did not have to trim any tabs out of my air cleaner for the bulb to fit it (perhaps it depends when the air cleaner was manufactured?).  Also, I took a look at my old Honeywell OEM bulb, and it very clearly has the same markings as the Philips bulbs, so it appears Philips makes them for Honeywell - you're getting the same thing at a fraction of the price.  That said... Be conscious of where you order it from and check the seller's ratings.  Make sure you're actually getting the Philips bulb and not some knock off.  If you purchase direct from Amazon.com you should be safe though.

I formerly used Giotto's clamps and plates, but recently changed plates on my camera to an L plate from Kirk.  Like many other Arca plates, the Kirk plate features stop screws to keep it from sliding out of the clamp.  Unfortunately, those stop screws were not compatible with my Giotto's plates, which led me to search for a reasonably priced Arca clamp that mated well with the Kirk plates.From my research, it seemed like SunwayFoto might be the best compromise between price and quality, and I have not been disappointed with the real world results of these clamps.  They tighten up quite securely on my plates, the knurled knob is easy to grip, they're lightweight, and feel like they're machined well.  The slot on the bottom is fairly standard among several brands, but you'll still want to take a look to see how it will pair with your gear (in my case it worked well with one head, but I had to mill it out wider for one of my other heads).My first DDC-60i was a Christmas present, but I was happy enough with it that I bought a second to use with another head.  If you want a decent Arca clamp without spending a fortune, they're worth checking out.

I'm not using these for canning, but had bought a few of these jars in different colors and sizes to use as countertop storage canisters for things like sugar and Splenda.  They're well made, attractive, and latch down quite securely.  In my case, I also stuck a couple of chalkboard labels on them.  The metal hardware can be taken off to put them through the dishwasher if desired.  I've included a photo so you can also see the scale of them (the two in the photo are both 6-3/4 oz).

Bought the FB-28 to use on my travel tripod.  The tripod (a 3 Legged Thing Punks Vyv) already came with a very solid head, but the clamp on the head didn't tighten down as well on my camera's Arca plate as I wanted (it was secure, but took less than a full turn to go from tightened all the way to being able to lift the camera straight out of it).  Unfortunately, while the FB-28's clamp worked great with my Kirk plate (all the SunwayFoto clamps have worked well for me in that regard), the ball on it doesn't tighten up quite as much as the head that came on the 3LT tripod.  To be clear, it does tighten up quite well (hence the 4 stars) - just not quite as good as the head I already had.  That made it hard for me to justify removing the existing head (in the end I just bought another clamp and milled the bottom out to mate with the stem on the 3LT ball head).I also considered the FB-28 for use on my table-top tripod, and in that regard it would have been more solid than the mini ball head I already had paired with the table-top tripod.  It was also larger though - just enough so that I didn't want it for table-top use.All that said... If you own a travel tripod which didn't come with a head (or which didn't come with a good head) and you want a solid mini head with an Arca clamp on it, the FB-28 might be a great fit for you.  It is solid, the base diameter is small, the clamp is wide enough to be secure but narrow enough to be compact, and it is light weight.  Under other circumstances I would have kept mine.  With a decent pro-sumer SLR this should tighten up sufficiently, even with a 70-200 f/2.8 lens on it (though with a large lens like that it will likely sag slightly after tightening and there might be some unusual angles it won't lock down at well).  I would have no qualms recommending this to a friend with that need, and in general I've been happy with the quality of SunwayFoto for the price.

I was torn on how to rate this clamp.  Like all SunwayFoto gear I've purchased, it is well machined.  It also clamps securely, and the knurled knob is easy to operate.  The 37mm width and its light weight make it perfect for mating with a mini ball head on a tabletop or small travel tripod.  Unfortunately, SunwayFoto designed the DDC-37 to mate specifically with their FB-28, and designed both to use a non-standard clamp screw (it's neither 1/4"-20 nor 3/8"-16).  I understand they're compact pieces of gear, but the screw isn't so much smaller than 1/4"-20 that they couldn't have chosen to go with the standard screw even thought it is slightly larger.  As a result, this clamp really isn't that useful without extra work.In my case, I drilled the center hole out slightly larger, than tapped the hole to accept a 1/4"-20 screw.  While I couldn't be happier with it now, I shouldn't have had to do that in the first place, and I think departing from accepted standards is enough to warrant the loss of 2 stars.

Like all Sunwayfoto gear, the DDH-03 is well machined.  It feels well put together and pans smoothly for a fraction of the price of RRS or Kirk.  However, the markings on mine are off by a considerable margin.  The center marks on either side of the top half of the clamp are about a degree off of being straight.  When mounted, if I align the marks with 0, 90, 180, or 270 on the base, it is visibly not straight.  For that matter, it has center lines on either side of the clamp, and not only are neither truly aligned as they should be, they don't quite match with each other either, with about a quarter degree difference.  Given the low cost, I don't expect the markings to be accurate within a mil of where they're supposed to be, but they should be close enough that the clamp is visibly straight to the eye when the center marks are aligned with one of the cardinal angles.  Considering the otherwise good experiences I've had with Sunwayfoto, this was disappointing.
