But this is so minor, it's really a non-issue.-128 mb memory. Get with it VTech. That's only enough for 6 one minute videos. In this day and age 128 mb of memory is a joke.-On/off button is too tinyOverall this is a nifty little watch tht is just right for kids that are too young for a phone.

This is based on the Chuggington Tentpole episode from Chuggington, which is a British animated series that is much like Thomas the Tank Engine. The playset is very cool and easy for little hands to put together. It doesn't come apart easiy (I'm looking at you Thomas the Tank Engine wooden playsets) and there are no batteries to have to replace. It is all kid run.What I like:-Easy to snap together pieces (putting it together can be confusing for younger children, but this is perfect for family time)-The train stays easily on the tracks-Elevator/Crane and escalator are run with a crank and by raising and lowering a platform-Crane rotates 360 degrees--Collapsing bridge has on off switch, so it doesn't have to collapse if you don't want it to-There are 4 different track layouts-All the playsets are compatible for expanded building-Comes with 2 trainsWhat I don't like:-Nothing. It's all good.Overall my niece and nephew gave it a 45-minutes-of-constant-play thumbs up. After the first time of putting it together, the kids studied the other layouts and began redoing the tracks themselves. They needed a little help now and again, but overall they were very sucessful at completing new layouts. Now they want other sets for Christmas. Sucess.

What happened, Belkin? This charger seems to go in and out on working. It looks nice when it's plugged in. The little ring of blue light shows you it's properly inserted into the socket. At first it seemed to work well, charging my and my son's iPods in the car. After a week, it didn't seem to be working for one of the iPods. We figured out it was the cable. We were previously using an older cable for one of the iPods, and the one that came with the charger for the other iPod. It worked after that. I hope the charger itself works longer than the cable did.

This is such a big hit, even with adults. The object of the game is easy. You play off the the top card. The first person who finds the matching picture on their card calls out the match and puts their card on the  top. The next is played the same until someone uses their last card and they are the winner. It reminds me of UNO, so easy to learn, and everyone seems to enjoy the game.There are different ways to play and they are all entertaining. This is a great game for a classrooms.

This is an updated version of Rock Em Sock Em Robots. Unfortunatly it doesn't live up to the fun factor.What I like:-they are TransformersWhat I don't like:-holding them up (makes your arm tired pretty quickly)-making the robots move by pulling a duel trigger (hands got sore quickly)-difficult to tell when the head has popped off-takes FOREVER to win a roundHasbro should have taken their cue from the sucess of the Robot toy and put their Transformers on a platform with easy to handle push button mechanisms. It's too cumbersome to manipulate the pulling mechanism with one hand, so I used two. Even then my hands quickly got tired, especially since it took sooo long for one of the heads to get knocked off. And when that did finally happened, we didn't realize it because you can't really tell since it doesn't pop off much. The fun factor lasted about 5 min. and then our hands got so tired, it was no longer enjoyable.

This makes taking your blood pressure so easy. I use this to monitor my daughter who has low blood pressure due to heart medications. We compared the reading from the Omron to the reading my daughter received earlier that day at her cardiologist appointment. The reading was was different by a negligible amount, so it seems to be very accurate.Highlights:-uses 4 AA batteries (included)-records date and time-holds up to 50 readings-can hold the data for two different users-will give you an average of your given readings-able to use an AC adapter (not included)-cuff is a standard size (fits most people, a bit big for my 100 pound daughter)-quick and accurate-no carrying case (boo)Overall this is a highly recommended blood pressure monitor. The only thing it lacks is a case and AC adapter.

My son LOVES Transformers. When he pulled  this out of the box there was a definite wow factor.  No, it's not your typical transformer toy that takes an engineer to transform the thing and back again. What you do get is a huge bad-a dinosaur whose eyes light up, makes awesome sounds, carries a smaller Optimus Prime on it's back and pops up into a fierce-looking Transformer with the push of a lever. But wait, there's more! His tail pops off and becomes a sword. A sword!And  the Stomp and Chomp Grimlock figure recognizes whether the figure on its back is an Autobot or Decepticon character and will activate different lights, sounds, and weapons depending on which side you choose. But seriously, who would choose to be a Decepticon? You can also choose the more boring, yet inexpensive method of activating lights and sounds by pushing down on the handle, or press the button hidden in the dino's jaws. But that doesn't stop you from wanting to run out and get more figures to try the other way.  Well played, Transformer Toy maker, well played.Overall my son was well pleased with this toy. The giant Lego  replica of The Pirates of the Caribbean Black Pearl was rudely pushed aside to make way for Grimlock who is now proudly displayed in a prominent area of his room. And now gridlock watches over my son at night as he sleeps. Good thing it's an Autobot or my son would get creeped out and shove it in the closet at night.

I bought this for my son to replace his lumpy old mattress. It arrived quickly, popped out of the bag with no problems, expanded as expected and the smell faded after a few days. It was a strong chemical smell, but not horrible or overwhelming. With that said, if you are looking fo a sink-into-the-mattress-like-a-sleeping-on-a-cloud, keep looking. This mattress is firm. It doesn't bother my son, but it's not the plush experience I was expecting. I would have been happier with a mattress topper like the one one we bought from  Dream Sleep, but oh well, my son isn't complaining and even seems to like the firmness of this mattress.7/9 update: I bought a king-sized Dreamfoam mattress. Ah, such soft luxury. Now my son is complaining that he wants a softer bed. As firm as his bed is, it should last forever. So I'm going to buy a topper to soften it for him.
My son loved this poster the minute he opened the package. It's your standard-sized poster made of regular poster paper. We unrolled it nd put it right on the wall. No complaints.

These are really handy, especially for people with limited hand strength.What I like:-easy twist top (good for small children or older adults)-no leakage when filled with water and turned on its side-little area on the top to write the date of food for freshness-cup serving marks on the side (up to 3 cups)-holds a bit over three cups-different sizes available that uses the same sized lid-microwave, dishwasher and freezer safeWhat I don't like:-a little thin-only 2 in the 32 fl ounce packOverall I am very pleased with how well these perform and the twist lid is a brilliant.

This was a big hit, not only in size (my three-year-old nephew actually sat on it to ride), but in playability.  The sturdy plastic casing took rolling done a rocky hill, having a small child sit on it to ride, carrying various stuffed animals and a reluctant cat (the cat took off immediately much to my nephew's disappointment) and being washed several times in a pretend car wash. I'm happy to say the mud hosed right off. This was combined with other mega blocks besides the ones the dump truck comes with (25 pieces) to make cool caves to roll the truck through and create other buildings. The wheels roll freely and the dump part tilts easily.  The little operator is removable and really cute. I only wish it came with more blocks, but you can't have everything. Excellent toy all around.

After a near death experience, Paige was thought to be suffering from PSD and was treated for it. In fact, Paige was actually seing ghosts. This brings me to the main story--Paige has an unknown talent for opening portals to the Dark World, making her very attractive to demons who would use her like a magic key in their fight against the real rulerrs of the Dark World, the Warlockls. Caught in this struggle is Paige's love interest, Logan, her best friend, Dotty and Logan's friend, Ajax (my favorite character. He's a hoot).I really like Cara Shultz's writing style. She has a great world building talent and fleshes out her character's well. Paige is tough, but with a vurnerable side and Logan is a real gentleman. They complement each other well and the romance doesn't seemed forced. There is plenty of demon fighting adventures and good amount suspense. What I really liked, was Paige's snarkiness and all around run attitude even in the face of danger. I particualry the two friends of the main characters, Dottie and Ajax. The interactions with these two put demons and ghosts in a whole new light.The ending is satisfying, leaving room for the next book, which I am anxiously waiting for.

I used this for a small residential pond. Initially after pouring the enzymes in, the water stunk to high heaven. I suppose the algea ws being eaten away. The water appeared clearer a few days laer, but there is still a slight brown murkiness.This may be my fault since I wasn't 100% sure on the math. I'm going to add more to see if the murkiness disappears. There is no green algea, so in that respect ths is a fine product. Warning: the container is very heavy and in liquid form. Be careful when poring it out. As I was pouring it out, a small bit splashed up into my eyes. It didn't sting, but I flushed my eye out immediatly. There is a 1-800 number on the side in case of chemical emergancies. Luckily there was no damage. You might want to wear saftey goggles until the container is light enough to handle with control.

Iams Healthy Naturals Weight Management boasts lower fat in order to keep your dog's weight down. However, it also has lower amounts meat, a dog food's main usable food ingredient. Instead of chicken, the main ingredient is sorghum. Sorghum is a starchy cereal grain with a nutrient profile similar to corn. Iams could keep the fat lower by simply leaving out some of added fat, which is added to all dog foods. Instead they make it appear fat is lowered by putting in less meat. Considering the meat is already dehydrated before it is cooked into the kibble, thus rendering most of the fat out, all they are doing is compromising the quality of the kibble. My dogs ate this without any problem, but a good quality kibble with meat as your number one ingredient and less corn and sorghum will provide more nutrients and less junk food, keeping your dog's weight down without a compromise to health.

This is a great set of tools with the best channel-lock pliers on the market.  The tool assortment is perfect for a great assortment of jobs, and the case makes it very convenient to be sure that you have all the needed tools with you.  The grips on the tools are very comfortable and the fit of the tools in general is very nice.If I could change anything about this set, I would change the case to include a flap to fold over the top of the tools.  As it stands, the tools will fall out of the case if you carry it with the open end down.  I accidentally did that just tonight, in fact.  I have other multi-sets of things such as files and things of that nature that have a flexible case like this, but there is a flap that folds over the top to keep items from falling out.  This would be a good change to this set.With that minor concern noted, I will still give this set a five-star rating and a HIGHLY RECOMMENDED notation.

This is a great idea that could have been executed better.  I understand the need to make the product affordable, but the fact remains that making something less expensive also (often times) makes them less durable.  The plastic construction of the chopping handle (for lack of a better word) allows it to flex and thus puts extra stress on some areas.  My wife and I chopped an onion on the device and it worked well.  You have to cut the onion in half and you have to use a decent amount of force to push the onion through the blades, but it works.  While it works, the handle will flex, thus putting extra strain on part of the hinge.  With the hinge and the handle both made of plastic, it is only a matter of time before this breaks.The grater attachment works for small jobs, but I will stick to our food processor for grating cheese, or for grating much of anything.  The mandoline slicer works nicely as well, and it has a constantly-variable depth adjustment that allows you to get very thin slices if you choose.  I really like the mandoline part of this unit, but it won't replace our better mandoline.  With this said, you will be very satisfied with this if you don't already have a slicer.In addition to chopping onions and trying to grate cheese, we tried to dice a tomato.  Strangely enough, it worked quite well.  The only problem is that it shot juice out the front.  We put a paper towel around the front and chopped tomatoes very successfully.  It would work better for this if the blades were sharper, but it does work.If I could change anything about this unit I would make the top out of metal instead of plastic.  I do not feel that this will last very well.

11:37 Mins I have tried to get a good result with this scanner and have been unsuccessful.  The unit does work, but it is just a real pain to get a good result.  You can scan in a side-to-side and back-and-forth manner and the software will tell you if you need to reposition the scanner.  All you do is put it over previously-scanned areas of the document and it figures out where it is.  This works, but not that well.  The software needs a lot of work.  My wife and I have tried scanning a lot of things and we are just not satisfied with the performance, as it does NOT perform like it does in the videos the manufacturer puts up for view.  Perhaps they are using a dedicated computer that is only running the scanner, but that is not the situation people will have when using this.The software is sluggish and will not launch automatically when you press the scan button.  I have to go to the applications folder and launch the application, then it will respond.  There seems to be no resident program that makes it launch.  The software download was 501 MB, so it is not a small program.  The stitching function works at times, but fails a lot.  The text will get crooked, or pictures will be offset (this can be seen in the video I uploaded).  The software stutters, even when scanning very slowly.  I attempted to scan at higher speeds and the image gets choppy, so you need to scan at a slow-to-medium speed.The unit is slightly larger than a business card, and it is about 1" thick, so women can keep this in their purse quite easily.I would recommend waiting for a major software update before buying this.  The idea is great, but the execution is poor.

This player works fine for my intended use.  This player works okay for playing movies in bed, but I wouldn't recommend it for your living room.  The picture is Blu-ray quality at times, and falters at other times.  The audio is the biggest concern, however, as it actually doesn't feed a good signal and will distort the audio at times.  This is with the audio set to bitstream to the receiver.This doesn't make a huge difference to me in the bedroom, as I just set it to repeat and watch until I go to sleep, but it would be a deal breaker anywhere else.  This player DOES have a title repeat function, unlike some others out there, so you can set it to repeat a movie over and over.  This is good for those of us who are incapable of sleeping without noise, or for those who need a player to loop movies in a business environment.The player is extremely small and the remote is even smaller.  You will lose this remote VERY easily if you are not careful, as it is tiny.

This is an attractive little microphone with a very good sound.  The microphone sounds excellent on vocals (at least for my voice), and it does a great job recording guitars.  I have a bunch of microphones and I am definitely in love with this one and would put it up against my AKGC414 without hesitation.  The AKG has multiple patterns, so it is not an apples-to-apples comparison, but the Baby Bottle sounds better to me.  I like it so much that I bought another one that should be arriving in a few days.  The AKG was my go-to microphone until I tried this one.When comparing to the Blue Bluebird, the Baby Bottle is better for my vocals, as it doesn't have the bump in the top end.  The Bluebird is nice for a lot of things, but the Baby Bottle works better for me when recording vocals and guitars.  From what I have been told by others, some prefer the Bluebird because it is more forgiving and it has a bump in the high end, so keep this in mind too, as the Bluebird is $100 less.The Blue Baby Bottle absolutely destroys my CAD Equitek E200.  The sensitivity is much better on the Blue, the sound has more character, and there is more warmth.  As with the AKG, the CAD is a multi-pattern microphone, so it is a different animal, but I greatly prefer the Blue.The Blue is a lot better than the MXL V67G, but it is also a lot higher level of microphone.  I don't hate the MXL, by the way, but the Blue is in a different class.  If you can afford the extra money, get the Bluebird or the Baby Bottle over any of the MXL microphones in the lower range.The Baby Bottle has a similar sound to the Blue e300 microphones I have, but it bests them easily.  To be fair, the e300 is a live and studio microphone, so it is far more versatile for people who want to use a microphone for live and recording.  The e300 is definitely a capable microphone, so I am not knocking it.THE BAD:The Baby Bottle is VERY prone to pops from "P" sounds and the pop filter does not help.  In fact, the pop filter is not very useful at all and I would recommend buying a separate pop screen, or, if you are so inclined, you can make your own with panty hose and a needlepoint hoop.  I like to get a bit closer to the microphone in order to get a better capture of the low-end spectrum of my voice, but the pop screen with the Baby Bottle doesn't work well enough to allow this.  The shock mount is good, but, once again, the "P" sounds can cause a resonance in the shock mount if you are close to the mic.  I have simply ditched the Blue pop screen, good looking though it is, in favor of my old standby.BOTTOM LINE: 4.5 stars.  HIGHLY recommended.  Keep in mind that many people might be happier with the Bluebird for $100 less, as it has a brighter sound.  I prefer the warmer sound of the Baby Bottle, but your mileage may vary.

0:26 Mins This cup is absolutely amazing!  I filled the cup with ice, put the lid on it, and then left it on the counter, checking on it every hour or so.  I put together a video that shows the fact that the ice did not even melt at all over the course of 4.5 hours. The outside of the cup does not sweat, or even get very cold.  The insulation is great. I have no doubt that the cup will keep drinks cold for a very long time.  If the hot performance is anything like the cold, this cup is easily the best on the market.I cannot recommend these highly enough!

I am pleased with the performance of this hub.  I have other hubs that claim to provide quick-charge capabilities to devices that do not work properly.  When plugged in, these other devices provide low power.  For instance, plugging an 8.9" Kindle Fire HDX into the high-speed port on the AmazonBasics 7 Port USB 3.0 Hub with 12V/3A power adapter and the Kindle invariably says that it is connected to a low-power source.  The same goes for Samsung Galaxy S5 phones, although they just charge extremely slowly.  I connected devices to this hub and they charge quickly, as they should, and the Kindle does not give me the message about a low-power source.The throughput on this device is also greater than the Amazon Basics hub, so it is a win for me, although it doesn't have many ports.  The small number of ports is likely the reason it can supply enough current to devices on the quick-charge ports, as it doesn't have to provide as much power to other devices.I definitely recommend this little hub if you don't need many ports.

Another great release from Goatsnake!  There are some questionable lyrics here and there, but the riffs are amazing.  It has been WAY too long since Goatsnake put something out, so this came as a VERY welcome surprise.  If you already like Goatsnake, there are no surprises here; just heavy riffs with a unique vocal style on top of them.  All the elements of the other releases are still there, so this is classic Goatsnake.You won't regret buying this if you like metal  BUY THIS NOW!

The price is right, and the game is a lot of fun.  This is basically a tower-defense game with iconic cartoon characters.  You set up various kinds of defenses around the board (and there are a number of different boards), then try to keep waves of enemies from destroying your toy box.  You can take control of any of your emplacements at any time, and you can use heroes to do serious damage to enemies.  The overall concept is fresh, as it is not simply a tower-defense game, but something more.The one thing that keeps this from being a five-star game for me is the pay-to-upgrade option.  You can buy tokens to upgrade your soldiers, emplacements, etc.  I know that this makes extra money for developers, but I am not a fan of pay-to-win gaming.  Your mileage may vary and you might well find that this is a point that you like about the game, so this is simply my opinion.This edition comes with all the characters available, unlike the downloadable version where you have to buy a separate pack of characters.  The character pack is included as a code inside the box.

I will preface this by saying that I am not a professional electrician and I don't have a use for 3000 amp testing, nor could I test this unit with a 3000 amp source.  With this said, this tool allows you to use a standard meter to test 30, 300, and 3000 amp sources without blowing the fuse in your tester unit.  This is a great idea for electricians who already have a professional multimeter that doesn't accommodate higher amperages.  This probe definitely did what it is advertised to do, as I was able to use a 10 amp multimeter to test a 30 amp circuit (this is the highest amperage I had access to) without blowing the meter fuse.  The design of the probe is great, as you simply unscrew the right side of the probe, snake it around the cable run you are testing, then screw it back in.  You need to set the amperage on the unit to the expected amperage in order to measure properly.  The results are displayed on your meter.  There is also a work light on the front of the unit, allowing you to illuminate dark spaces when you are snaking the cable.The design is great and it definitely makes your standard multimeter work in more situations.

I put some iced tea in this cup and left it setting for a couple of hours.  There was not sweat on the cup and the tea stayed cold for a good long time.  I was impressed with the performance of the cup, but it is definitely expensive.  I would, however, recommend it if you want your drink to stay cold and to NOT leave sweat rings on furniture.  It really does what it is supposed to do.

This is a decent-sounding headset, and the illumination is pretty neat for gamers who like the "mod" looks, or people who modify their electronics.  The glow can be turned off to save battery, or left going.  The sound quality is pretty good and the battery life is likewise decent.The microphone is the problem with the headset though, as it can suffer from static and low volume.  This is a bit of a disappointment if you are into playing online, but won't matter for solo play.  The microphone retracts when not in use, so it stays out of the way.  This is a nice feature and it should help keep the mic safe.The battery seems to last about 12 - 13 hours, which is pretty decent.  You will likely be charging the unit each night, so the battery life is just fine, as most people won't be playing games for 13 hours a day.The build quality is good and the fit is comfortable.  The headset feels very solid and it is not at all flimsy.  The fact that they are truly wireless makes them even more comfortable, as you don't have that extra cable hanging in your way.

This is a nice laminator at a nice price.  The retail price might be a bit steep, but it always sells for under half the retail, so it is worth it.  The warm-up time is quick, and the size of the housing is small enough to be easy to store.  The overall design of this laminator is better than the other laminator I have (Scotch Thermal Laminator 2 Roller System (TL901)), as it is more compact and performs the same.  You can select between 3 and 5mm on the top of the unit, so it will handle most stock without issue.The this model will do just about anything most people will ever want to laminate, but there are versions that support up to 13" stock if you need that size.

The night vision works very well on this camera.  I have uploaded a picture that was taken with the camera in my music room in the dark so you can see how well it works.  The color performance is even better than the night vision, so you will get great images of anything that crosses the camera's path.The setup of the camera can be done in the dark because the camera illuminates the controls when you put it in setup mode.  This will be very helpful for people in the woods, as you don't have to use another hand to hold a flashlight to see what you are doing.  The settings allow you to take still pictures along with video if you choose, or just video, or just pictures.  There are a lot of variations in the setup, so you should be able to tailor it to your specific use pretty easily.The case of the camera is fairly small and it is camouflage painted, so it will not stand out in the woods.  The case closes securely and it water-tight, so you won't have to worry about the weather.  The unit comes with a very long connecting strap, so it can easily accommodate larger trees.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

These can't be beat for the price.  I do a lot of work on cars in my driveway, and my driveway slopes downhill.  I have had great luck with these, as they have never even moved at all once the car was rolled back onto them and the parking brake was applied.  The price for these is great, and there is absolutely NO reason not to have a set of these if you do any work on your car at all.

This sledge will make short work of stuck ball joints, etc.  I was able to remove a completely and totally stuck ball joint with this thing... I can usually use a plain hammer and a Pitman tool to do the job, but I came across one that would not move no matter what.  I got this hammer and two shots later it was done!The grip feels nice and comfortable and the handle absorbs a great deal of shock, making the hammer more comfortable to use.HIGHLY recommended.

I don't want to give anything away or put out any spoilers, so I will be very general.This is a great picture of disenfranchised, drug-addled, uncaring youth.  The kids in this movie are, unfortunately, a pretty good representation of a good number of kids in society and the message remains powerful all these years later.Dennis Hopper and Crispin Glover absolutely steal the show in this movie.  Crispin Glover's speed-freak character is played with an absolutely perfect technique.  He REALLY sells the character and disappears into the role.  Dennis Hopper does his usual incredible job as Feck, the drugged-out, insane murderer who supplies the kids with "the Feck weed."  His character actually manages to be sympathetic and full of sorrow.  Keanu Reeves, who I normally find to be a terrible actor, does a really excellent job, and, like Crispin Glover, he just melts into the role.  This is the role for him, as he was also enjoyable in "Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure."

These are easily the best wire strippers I have ever had the pleasure of using.  I even used these on tiny 24-gauge wire without any problem at all.  I used to have problems stripping tiny wires, but not anymore.  I also like the strip depth gauge that allows you to set a length for stripping to keep all wires uniform.  I have found that the strippers gripped every wire I have tried to strip without any issue.I cannot recommend these strippers highly enough.  Five hundred stars!

A great mixture of H.P. Lovecraft, the CIA's MK ULTRA mind-control experiments, the mysterious unknown numbers stations, and Hunter S. Thompson.  I watched this movie for free on Netflix and enjoyed it so much that I bought the DVD.  Ted Levine, of "Silence of the Lambs" fame, does a fabulous job of portraying the Hunter S. Thompson-inspired character and he steals the show.  The interweaving of H.P. Lovecraft's "From Beyond" with the MK ULTRA experiments was perfect and it worked great.For a low-budget movie, this one delivered more than major motion pictures.By the way, the "Lonely Traveler" station that is featured in the movie is an actual unknown number station called "Swedish Rhapsody" in the community.  You can find actual recordings of that station on the internet if you search for "Swedish Rhapsody Station" or "Conet Project."

It is hard to go wrong with this disc if you like Grim Reaper.  The first two albums fit perfectly on one disc, and you WANT both of the first discs or you wouldn't be looking at this.  The audio quality is good, and the discs have not been remastered (also known as compressed to death) in order to make them louder.  This is a good thing as far as I am concerned, as the loudness war has done more to destroy the integrity of recordings than anything.If I have any complaint at all (which I really don't), I would have made the cover where it had the full cover of "See You in Hell" on one side and the entire cover of "Fear No Evil" on the other so you had full artwork for both albums.

0:48 MinsUPDATED: 08-17-2015:I think I am about done with this vacuum.  The navigation is working now, but it cannot figure out NOT to try to climb on top of things.  I have just been running it upstairs in my music room and it has climbed on top of a microphone stand and a keyboard stand no less than 10 times.  I have picked the unit up and moved it away from the stand and it will turn around, drive back to the stand and immediately try to climb it again, getting stuck.  This thing pays NO attention to its surroundings and it will frustrate you greatly if you have things around that it can attempt to climb.  I love this vacuum when it works and actually avoids things, but I hate it when it doesn't.  You would think that it would sense that it was climbing something and reverse, but no... it doesn't.UPDATED 07-24-2015:I tried cleaning the sensors according to the directions (with a dry Q-tip) multiple times and the navigation did not get better.  I finally used a damp Q-tip and was able to actually remove all the dust in the sensors (there was not much dust there) and the navigation improved drastically.  This tells me that it doesn't take much dust to make the navigation fail.  I would recommend NOT following the directions and to use a damp Q-tip instead, as that is the only way I was able to get the navigation to start working.  The dry Q-tip just moves the dust around on the sensor and doesn't fix the problem.UPDATED 07-21-2015:I have reduced the rating to three stars.  The navigation on this vacuum is really not good at all.  I have been testing it every day since I first reviewed it and I can now say that it does a very poor job of covering area.  The navigation is scattershot and the unit constantly gets stuck on top of things or in corners.  It actually climbed up the legs of two different microphone stands in my recording studio.  It couldn't figure out that it was trying to climb the base of two microphone stands.  The navigation also covers the SAME EXACT area over and over and skips a ton of other area.  I am currently watching it go over an area that it has vacuumed at least ten times, while there is a ton of space in the middle of the room that it hasn't even touched.I cannot recommend this unit over the more-expensive Roomba vacuums, as they navigate a LOT better.ORIGINAL REVIEW FOLLOWS:The suction on this vacuum is really excellent and it does a very good job on carpets.  The bin is a bit small and it will fill up pretty quickly if you have pets or messy kids.  This wouldn't be an issue, but the vacuum does not stop when the bin gets full.  It just continues trying to vacuum when the bin is full, but it displays a message saying "bin full" or something of that nature.  The problem with this is that it is a robotic vacuum, so you wouldn't expect to have to follow it around to check and see if it needs to have the bin emptied.  There should be an alert sound when the bin fills and it should stop and rest until you clean the bin.The navigation of the vacuum when it is on carpet under a table is extremely good.  I have tested many different robotic vacuums and this one does the very best of any when it comes to navigating around chairs.  It gets between the legs and gets very close to all legs when cleaning.  It does absolutely great at this task.The navigation of the unit when on hardwood floors is not perfect.  We have about 2500 square feet of hardwood, so this makes a difference to us.  The unit seems to get confused and doesn't follow any logical pattern when cleaning.  It might go over a small area over and over and over, and then move out of that area for a couple of minutes before returning back to the small area it was doing before.  I had to pick the unit up and move it from area to area to get it to clean larger spaces.  The Mint Automatic Hard Floor Cleaner, 4200 is the best we have ever used for hardwood floors, but it is not a vacuum and only dusts the floor.The video I uploaded show this vacuum panicking in a corner and having a lot of trouble figuring out what to do.  This has happened more than once, so it is something that happens with this unit.The Neato will stop when it comes to stairs, but it (like all other robotic vacuums I have tested) will drop off the hardwood when coming into a tiled room.  The drop is only 1.5" for the 3/4" hardwood and the 3/4" underlayment, so the sensor apparently doesn't have enough distance to stop it from going forward.  This means that you must either close doors to tiled rooms (our bathrooms, laundry room, fireplace, and an accessory room are tiled), or use the stop strip to block the unit from falling into an area it cannot get out of without help.The unit seems to have a hard time finding the base station to charge if it gets too far away, and we have had to take it back and put it on the charger manually.  The iRobot Roomba 880 Vacuum Cleaning Robot For Pets and Allergies was able to find the base without issue.BOTTOM LINE: 3 out of 5 stars.  The unit is okay on carpet, but questionable on hardwood.  The vacuum suction is great, and it does a great job on pet hair.RECOMMENDED

I can't say much negative about this product for what it is and what it is supposed to be.  If you are looking for an air purifier for a low price to use in a very small room, this should do the trick.  Holmes recommends that you use it in a room of approximately 100 - 109 square feet.  This can be deceiving, as rooms with higher ceilings have more cubic air footage, and will require a larger purifier to turn the air.  With this said, this purifier will work fine in a small bedroom, but not much else.  The fan is not terribly loud, but you will definitely notice it on the higher settings and it will be even more noticeable in a small space, such as a bathroom or something.  The filters are super easy to change and they should be readily available for some time to come.BOTTOM LINE: 3.5 stars - it is an inexpensive unit and it is only good for very small spaces, but it will work if that is what you require.

There are certainly better and worse tools out there.  These will do the job, but the adjustable wrench is of lower quality than the cheapest adjustable wrench I had before this kit.  The moveable jaw moves around quite a bit more than others that I have used and it does not inspire confidence.  The finish on the adjustable wrench is also problematic, as it is just paint.  The paint was already coming off when I first tested the wrench.  I don't care about the paint, but some might.  The better move would have been to just leave it as bare metal, to acid etch it, or to have a rubber grip on it.I would have liked for the locking pliers and the adjustable wrench to have had rubber grips on them, as there are certainly times when the grip can make a difference.As far as the three pliers included in the set go, they are all pretty good quality, and each has a solid fit and finish.  There is no play in the hinge on any of them and they feel fine and tight.  I have no complaints about these at all.Overall, I would give the set a 3.5 star rating.  I can't say how good the deal is on these, as Amazon currently doesn't have a price on them, but I wouldn't pay more than $25 for the set, as you can get tools of at least this quality at your local hardware chain for that amount.

The 829LM works straight away with any garage door opener with native MyQ technology.  It also works with all Liftmaster openers manufactured after 1998 as long as you have the Liftmaster 828LM Garage Door Opener Internet Gateway and the LiftMaster 888LM Security+ 2.0 MyQ Wall Control Upgrades Previous Models 1998+ connected.My opener is a Liftmaster Professional that was made in 2010, and it does not have MyQ built into the unit.The 829LM will definitely work with the 888LM and the 828LM. I just set this up in my house and it works fine. The instructions that come with the 829LM do NOT cover the setup for this, so here's how it is done:Ensure that your 828LM is functioning and connected to your 888LM.Plug the 829LM into a wall outlet and ensure that the lights on the front are blinking.Press the learn button on the back of the 829LM. You will hear a beep.Press the learn button on the face of the 888LM.The 829LM will beep and the lights will go solid.That's it. You are now set up.There have been no problems since I figured out how to get the device connected.  Read the instructions above for any older openers, or just press the learn buttons on the newer units.

I am comparing these to other hearing protection I have in my range bag.  The Howard Leight by Honeywell R-01902 Impact Pro Electronic Shooting Earmuffs are the closest to these that I have, but these have similar performance, while being more comfortable on my head.  You can talk with others at the range with these on and still protect your hearing, as the electronics immediately stop the microphone when a shot is fired.  This works as well as the Howard Leight that I have, and they do a great job overall.  The Howard Leight have a -30db rating, while these only have a -21db rating, so the Leight are better overall as far as protecting your hearing goes.There is a noticeable difference in the noise reduction between the units, but both make it comfortable to shoot for long periods without any ringing in your ears.  The 3M protectors are more comfortable to me and I think that they have a great design for storage.  The Leight do not fold up like the 3M, thus taking more room in the range bag.Right now, it is a toss up as far as which one I like best goes.  I love them both.  I like the additional noise reduction of the Leight, but I love the feel and storage of the 3M.Take your pick... both are excellent.BOTTOM LINE: You cannot go wrong with these hearing protectors.  If you need more reduction, go with the Howard Leight, otherwise, these are absolutely great.

The Echo is a pretty cool device and I really like it for what it is.  The sound quality from the tower is considerably better than expected and it will definitely fill up a room without a problem.  My wife uses ours downstairs in the library and she loves to be able to access our personal cloud library and play our own playlists.  The Echo will connect with your Amazon Music library, Prime playlists, Pandora, etc.  The voice recognition is quite good and doesn't fail to understand what you are asking for very often, although it doesn't know everything.One example is playing music from Roky Erickson.  In order to get the Echo to play Roky Erickson (pronounced ROCKY), you have to pronounce Roky like Row-Key.  The Echo will find the library and play it if you mispronounce the name.  I would say that this is down to the phonics engine, as Amazon can't program every possible pronunciation in the software.The list function is pretty cool, as it allows you to tell the Echo to make a note about something you need to remember and then it stores it so you can look at your note on your cellular phone or tablet with the Echo application.  This makes it easy to make grocery lists or notes to retrieve remotely.You can ask questions and the Echo will try to answer them.  You can't get too out there with the questions, but it will do your basic measurement translations, etc. for cooking, or you can look up general trivia stuff.  The Echo doesn't replace a computer for searching, as it isn't meant to fill that role; it is just for quick questions that you might need answers to, not research.  I like to ask it the weather instead of looking on the internet.  That's the kind of thing it is great at doing.The great thing about the Echo is that Amazon is continually updating it and adding or tweaking features.  I expect great things from this device in the future.

I have now tried steel and nickel strings from Elixir and I can say that they are both great strings and that they last a LONG time compared to other strings on the market.  The nickel strings don't have quite the brightness of the steel, so they are a good choice when you want a rounder sound, while the steel are great for a more biting sound.  The feel of the strings is great and the coating doesn't change the way your fingers feel on them.  The light-guage strings won't be my go-to, but they are still good... I prefer a heavier string, but that's just personal preference.  As far as the strings themselves go, I have no complaints at all.

Our dog absolutely loves Beggin' Strips Bacon - 3lbs (48 oz), but she loves these even more.  The Beggin' Strips have been her go-to snack for a couple of years now, but she is completely crazy for these chicken treats!  She has a routine where she runs downstairs to go out before bedtime, when she gets her nighttime treat.  I fed her the chicken treat earlier in the day to see if she liked it... she loved it.  So, we went to bed last night and she sprinted downstairs as usual, but instead of going to the back door, she ran directly to the bedroom for her chicken treat!  My wife and I had to convince her to go outside for her bathroom activity... she sprinted back in and into the bedroom for her treat.  We also have a routine in the morning where she gets up, goes outside to the bathroom, then runs upstairs for her treat... this morning she ran straight upstairs, just like last night.She loves these things!Now for the details: These are NOT made in China.  YAY!  These are an American product, so you can be much more confident that your dog will be safe eating them.  They include no artificial ingredients or fillers, just chicken.BOTTOM LINE: HIGHLY recommended!

I have been using Elixir strings on my guitars for a while now and I decided to give these a shot for the bass... I couldn't be more pleased. The sound of these strings is very full, very sharp without being harsh, and quite comfortable on the fingers. I put these on one of my Fender Jazz basses and the sound just came alive. The feel is perfect and the sound is everything you could hope for in a set of strings.  I have another set of these on another five-string bass of mine and they have a great sound as well.  The other strings are nickel instead of steel and have a slightly warmer and more mellow sound.  I like both and they will both be good for different things.If these last anything like their guitar strings, you will not want to use anything else. I am definitely sold on this company and I would absolutely recommend their strings for guitar and bass.

0:55 Mins This grater is absolutely wonderful and I would definitely recommend it.  Please watch the video I have uploaded and you will see the function and features of this grater.  I am going to buy a couple of the other versions of this, as I really love it.BOTTOM LINE: HIGHLY recommended

0:37 Mins This is a really excellent circular-saw guide and it works better than the Kreg KMA2675 Kreg Rip-Cut.  The ability to use a standard Clamp Guide to create a track saw is a great thing.The saw plate can be used with right-bladed or left-bladed circular saws by changing the position of the clamps on the sled, so you don't need to worry about it working with your saw.  The setup is pretty straightforward, but the instructions don't really cover things well.  I uploaded a video to show how to set everything up quickly and easily without hassle.This saw plate will work great as long as you get your clamp guide square.  I am extremely pleased with this guide and it will definitely become a mainstay when I need a quick way to cut something without using my panel saw or table saw.BOTTOM LINE: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

I have been using Elixir strings on my guitars for a while now and I decided to give these a shot for the bass... I couldn't be more pleased. The sound of these strings is very full, not quite as bright as the steel strings, and quite comfortable on the fingers. I put these on a five-string Fender Jazz bass and the sound is great. The feel is perfect and the sound is everything you could hope for in a set of strings.  I think that the steel strings are better for things where you want a brighter sound, but these nickel sound every bit as good as the strings you are used to and will last a LOT longer.  The coating on Elixir products astounds me.  I have had the same set of strings on an acoustic guitar of mine for four months and they still sound new!If these last anything like their guitar strings, you will not want to use anything else. I am definitely sold on this company and I would absolutely recommend their strings for guitar and bass.

These knives have the look of more expensive knives made of solid steel, without the feel of those more expensive knives.  I am not terribly fond of the feel of these, as they are quite light and I prefer a bit more heft out of my knives that have steel handles.  This is just a personal preference and it does not cause the knives to perform poorly.The knives came fairly sharp, which is a good thing because they did not come with a sharpening stick.  I have honing tools at home, but I would have liked to have a sharpening tool with the knife set.  A knife is only as good as the edge on it, so it would have been advisable to include a sharpening device.The steak knives are housed in a separate knife block, allowing you to take them to the dinner table in the block.  While this is a neat presentation, I don't think that most people will use the block, as most will set places with the knife, fork, etc.  Still, it is nice that you can store it in a different location instead of on your counter, allowing you to keep just the cooking knives out for cooking.You will be happy with these unless you are really in need of the best steel. Sure, these are not Wusthof or Henckles, but the price is much lower. The steel is nice and you can get a great edge on these. I have a ton of knife sets and these still see use, even though I have Wusthof, Henckels, and Mercer knives.Good, but not great... worth a look if you don't need a lot of cooking knives.

I have been using Elixir strings on my guitars for a while now and I decided to give these a shot for the bass... I couldn't be more pleased.  The sound of these strings is very full, very sharp without being harsh, and quite comfortable on the fingers.  I put these on a 1962 Fender Jazz bass and the sound just came alive.  The feel is perfect and the sound is everything you could hope for in a set of strings.If these last anything like their guitar strings, you will not want to use anything else.  I am definitely sold on this company and I would absolutely recommend their strings for guitar and bass.

Another great set of songs from the boys from down under.  King Parrot's sophomore release, produced by Phil Anselmo (DOWN, Superjoint Ritual, Pantera, etc.) hits the mark on every track.  The grindcore foundation of the band is in full effect, mixed with the slower elements I loved from the first release.  The production is crisp without being over-produced and sterile.  The new drummer, the stellar Todd Hansen (The Berzerker, and too many other bands to list), fits in perfectly and provides an extremely-solid foundation for the band.There is not as much overt comedy on this release, but the boys will definitely bring that element in their videos and live shows.  I did, however, miss the Slatts commentary from the first album on this one.  I would have liked it if he had another little snippet, as he has the best delivery going.  Still, the video for "Like a Rat" sees our hero provide his trademark comedy stylings, so I will eagerly await new video releases and interviews.BOTTOM LINE: The aggression, speed, slowness, and delivery of the first album are here in full effect.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.BUY THIS NOW.  DON'T THINK ABOUT IT, DO IT!

1:27 Mins The vice works, but the design, while clever, has a fundamental flaw that makes the unit less reliable.  The quick-release mechanism that allows you to move the carriage forward or backwards quickly also causes the screw mechanism to bind frequently.  You will want to snug the carriage to your workpiece before you attempt to rotate the handle to move it, otherwise you will encounter binding on a consistent basis.  The video I uploaded demonstrates this failing.I would give this unit a 3-star rating at this point. If the mechanism worked as it should, this would be a five-star unit.  The fact is that there are MANY times that I need to clamp something down in order to drill it and this vice WILL provide that capability.  I have been using self-made jigs to do this so far and this is MUCH more convenient, so it is definitely a recommended product, but be aware of the shortcoming of the design and work around it.BOTTOM LINE: 3 stars - recommended with caveats

I like the wrenches and I feel that the ratcheting mechanism works very well, but I am concerned about how they will hold up under high-strain applications.  I have an absolute need for a ratcheting wrench that will fit into tight spaces, but, as any mechanic knows, there are many times when a bolt is stuck/corroded on, etc. so bad that you need penetrating fluid and you still need a hammer to break the thing loose (even worse cases need a torch to heat the bolt).  I am not sure that these will hold up to being hit with a hammer without breaking the ratcheting mechanism, but they will be amazing for anything where the bolt is not stuck.I was able to loosen a number of different bolts without issue and the wrenches performed as they should.  I would like to see a larger set of these that covered more sizes and combined both metric and SAE.

I have multiple socket sets, as I do a lot of mechanic work for my family and friends.  I have pass-through sets from Bostitch, Crescent, and Husky.  I would rank the quality in that order as well.  The Bostitch have a more solid feel overall, but they do not feature the multi-surface sockets that will work with hex, spline, external Torx, and various other head types.  This feature alone makes this set a valuable addition to your tool kit.  I tested the fit on various heads and I can say that the performance and feel is top notch.  The grip on the head is really great and it even did a good job on slightly-rounded hex heads.I searched Amazon and Crescent's website and was unable to find a larger kit, and I think that this is a shame.  My go-to set is the BOSTITCH BTMT72287 Pass Through Socket Set, 65-Piece, as it contains the vast majority of all sizes I need to work on cars from multiple manufacturers.  I hope that Crescent comes up with a larger kit to cover more head sizes.Now for the problem with the kit.  There is no extension for the sockets, so you will NOT be able to access recessed bolts.  There is no way you can use this set in a tune-up situation on a car, nor can you use it to remove most bolts associated with removing heads or anything of that nature, as the missing extensions make it impossible to access the recessed bolts.  There are also many situations where you will not be able to use the pass-through sockets to work, as the ratchet will need clearance.  This problem is resolved by the addition of a 3/8" insert that allows you to use standard 3/8" sockets and extensions with the tool, but this also eliminates the pass-through ability.I would definitely recommend the Crescent version of the pass-through socket set, as long as you already know that the socket sizes and depths are appropriate for your applications.  This kit is good for basic work, but it will definitely not replace your larger kits if you do mechanic work.  This is recommended for basic home use.BOTTOM LINE: 3.5 stars (rounded to 4)

This is a decent little set that will be okay for some tasks but keep in mind that you have a very limited selection of sockets.  You have a 3/8" ratchet, an extension and the following sockets:3/8"7/16"1/2"9/16"5/8"11/16"3/4"13/16"7/8"The connection between the ratchet and the socket is not perfect, and the socket will rock side to side when attached.  This won't stop you from being able to use the tool, but the connection is not as solid as any other socket sets I have (and I have four others from various manufacturers).  The quick-release mechanism works very well and allows you to change sockets easily.The set comes in a nice case that keeps things organized and secure.  The case is small enough that it will be easy to store in any tool kit or in your car.BOTTOM LINE: RECOMMENDED for people who don't need a full selection of socket sizes.  I would recommend a larger kit for most people, but this will work well if you know that the sockets in the kit will do what you need.

I have another Hitachi cordless drill (Hitachi DS18DBL 18-Volt 3.0-Ah Lithium-Ion Cordless Brushless Driver Drill) that I am extremely pleased with, so I had high expectations for these and they didn't disappoint. These have the strong motors that I expect from Hitachi, although they are not quite as strong as the 3 amp DS18DBL. Although these are 2.5 amps instead of 3 like the DS19DBL, I don't think that anyone will have an issue with this unless you are a contractor who needs to drill large screws and lots of them. Both of these drills are somewhat compact and fairly lightweight, so you will be able to control them better than heavier units.Each drill has an LED light that shines from that base up toward the tip of the drill, allowing you to see your mark much better when drilling pilot holes. The light can be turned on without the drill operating, so you can line up and get ready before starting the motor. The only problem is that this is a touchy operation that often results in the drill motor engaging when you don't want it to start.The torque of the driver drill is good, but it does not compare to the torque of the contractor-grade DS18DBL. The DS18DGL has 400 in/pounds of torque, while the DS18DBL has 600 in/pounds. The WH18DGL, however, has an incredible 1,280 in/pounds of torque! The combination of the DS18DGL and the WH18DGL is a formidable package that will handle pretty much any job you can come up with. You will NOT be disappointed in the performance of these.The warranty on these units is among the best in the industry, with a lifetime tool warranty, a two-year battery warranty, and a one-year charger warranty. The lifetime tool warranty is the big deal here, as you are covered against defects for life.The only thing I would change would be the case for the drills. There has been a trend over the past few years where manufacturers put their tools in nylon doctor's bag-style cases instead of hard cases. I do not like the nylon bags at all, as they are not very protective and cannot be stacked on shelves. In the case of this set, you have both drills, batteries, and the charger in a case where they can bang into each other and are not protected from outside forces. I would pay extra just to have the manufacturer include hard cases for the units again. Hitachi is not the only one doing this, so it is not a knock solely on them. I have a new Porter Cable circular saw, a Bosch reciprocating saw, a DeWalt combo kit, etc., all with the nylon bags. I don't really fault Hitachi, but I wish that they had a solid case like the DS18DBL.Bottom line: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Setup on this unit couldn't be any easier.  I unboxed the device, plugged it into the power outlet and into my router with ethernet, then powered it on.  The device light blinked for about a minute and then "Personal Cloud" showed up in the "Shared" section of the Finder on my Mac.  There is an internet shortcut in the root directory of the drive.  I clicked the link and the drive opened in Safari and it immediately started a firmware update.  This was an automatic process that took a few minutes, but will not cause anyone any issues, as it is completely automatic and requires no action on the part of the user.After the firmware update completed, the screen changed to the Seagate Personal Cloud setup wizard.  The setup lets you register the device as part of the owner settings, so your product will be registered immediately (if you choose).  You will receive an email with a confirmation code that you use to confirm that you are setting up the device properly.  You will then be presented with a screen that who's your device username and your Seagate access ID.  You will use the password you set during the setup process to access the device from the internet or your computer.You can use the Seagate Media application for direct playback on your Roku device, Kindle Fire, or Samsung Smart Hub devices.  The XBOX One, XBOX 360, PS3, or other DLNA devices can access the Seagate device via DLNA.  This allows you to stream music, movies, etc. to your DLNA-enabled device.  NOTE: The PS4 does not currently support DLNA.I connected my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" tablet to the cloud by downloading the Seagate Media application.  The application scans your network and locates your drive immediately.  I was able to stream videos and audio immediately without even the slightest hiccup.  The setup was equally easy on my Samsung Galaxy S5 phone.  It was immediate and flawless.The biggest disappointment to me is the fact that there is no application for the Amazon Fire TV.  I would like a good DLNA service for the Fire TV and the application would have served that purpose if it existed.The Backup Manager tells you how to set up Time Machine (Mac) to use the Seagate device as the backup drive.  Additionally, you can set up Time Machine to work with multiple drives to keep multiple backups.  There is also an App Manager that allows you to install server-side applications to your device that can be used for varying tasks.  At this point there are not a lot of applications available for installation, but we can hope that a good set of applications come to reality.  This is similar to the way my Synology DiskStation 5-Bay 15TB (5 x 3TB) Network Attached Storage (NAS) with iSCSI (DS1513+ 5300) works, but the Synology device has a considerable set of applications for installation.I would prefer a RAID setup to the single-drive configuration of the item being reviewed, but I feel that this device is very solid.  The software works well and all my devices (barring the Amazon Fire TV) connected to it immediately and work as they should.BOTTOM LINE: Highly Recommended, but I would still recommend the Synology product over this one, as you can use quickconnect.to in order to access it from any device.

This is a pretty unique design and I find it helpful to be able to push the handle to open the door.  If you are coming in the back door with packages, groceries, etc, you can just bump the handle with your leg and open the door.  What's not to like?The installation is simple, but it does require a door with a deadbolt hole, and you will need a drill to put a third hole at the appropriate place at the bottom of the handle, as it secures on the bottom as well.  This is very simple to do and you should have no issue doing it at all, especially if you are replacing a front door handle that had the long handle already, as the hole is in a standard location.  If you are installing elsewhere, just drill a quick hole and you are good to go.TIP: when drilling the hole, you can put a level on top of your drill to ensure that you are drilling a hole through the door that is level.  This is also the proper way to install a keyhole in a door if you ever do that.  A miniature level is all it takes to ensure that your hole is nice and clean.The finish is clean and nice and the build quality is very high.  I would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone.

The oven works great and has excellent features.  I gave it a five-star review for multiple reasons:It looks great, it performs great, and it has a glass touchpad instead of pressure-sensitive buttons.  The cooking temperature is displayed on the front of the oven as it heats, showing you how close you are to cooking temperature, and the unit beeps when the temperature is hit.  The bottom heating element is enclosed and is not exposed to the oven interior.  This makes the oven much easier to clean and to keep nice.  It comes with three shelves and multiple rails for adjustments.  It has a full Sabbath setting menu for Jewish users who observe Shabbat.The convection fan is not very loud and works exactly as it should.  The oven allows for convection roasting as well as convection baking and the instruction manual tells how you should set the oven to prepare various food items.  The cooking temperature (actual temperature) is user adjustable to plus-or-minus 35 degrees, allowing you to correct any disparity in the actual temperature and the cooking temperature displayed.The oven makes clicking noises very often, but this is normal operation.  The manual states that the oven has very strict tolerances for heat and the clicking is the oven adjusting to maintain a perfect temperature.  You will also hear a fan when the oven is on, even when you are not using convection, this is because the oven has a fan that helps keep the internal electronics cool when it is operating.  The fan will remain on for some time after you are finished cooking as it cools the unit off.One thing to note is that this oven is quite deep and it might not fit in your opening if you have a gas line in the recess.  Our gas line is in the opening and the oven would not fit.  I had to make an extension to my cabinet in order to accommodate the deeper oven.  This is something that the average homeowner will likely not be able to do, but I have a wood shop and was able to build the extension to make the oven fit.  This is something to think about, so be sure to measure carefully (which I didn't) before buying the oven.I installed it along with a KitchenAid gas stovetop (KCGS550ESS) and the mounting brackets for the stovetop went down too far and the oven hit them, so I had to modify the brackets in order to get the oven to install as well.  This included remaking the brackets so that they were nearly flush to the bottom of the stovetop.Please measure better than I did before purchasing anything, as it is not a trivial matter to modify mounting hardware and to build cabinet extensions to accommodate a larger oven if the depth is restricted because of a gas pipe.Bottom line: Highly Recommended

These are excellent safety glasses for working outdoors.  The smoked lenses are great for bright environments and the padding around the eyepieces keep airborne contaminants out of your eyes.  These form a pretty good seal around your eyes, but there are some gaps here and there, as is to be expected.  The glasses are quite comfortable and feel nice for long jobs.I am ordering a pair of the clear version for working in my wood shop.  These are just about perfect glasses.  The only thing that I would change would be adding a nose adjustment.  A set of adjustable pads for the nose would ensure a more comfortable and secure fit.Jackson Safety 25672 V50 Calico Polycarbonate Anti Fog Safety Eyewear, ClearThere are multiple versions of these glasses that will be great for different needs, including smoke, amber, clear, and half shade.  I am seriously considering buying a pair of the amber glasses for the shooting range, as they will help block blue-spectrum light.Jackson Safety 25674 V50 Calico Polycarbonate Anti Fog Safety Eyewear, AmberBottom line: Highly recommended

Excellent pump for potable water - quiet - easy to install.Although it is not noted in the description, this pump is suitable for potable water. This means that it can be used for drinking water. DO NOT use a pump that is not certified for potable water for ANY installation where the water will be used for consumption or food preparation.I was able to wire the pump to a heavy cord and heat shrink it to keep the elements out of the line, ensuring safe operation and portability. The pump works exactly as it should and is very quiet. I mounted the pump and a tank to a framework made of 2x4s for a friend's concession trailer and it works like a charm. This is a potable water pump, so you can use it for drinking water or commercial purposes where the water is used for consumption. It is VERY important to ensure that you use a potable water pump for ANY application that will be used for consumption.The self-priming functionality is perfect, as I was able to simply drop a hose into the water tank and turn the pump on and water began to flow quickly. I let the pump run the container dry and it worked as it should. The pump has a pressure sensor to turn itself off when it encounters enough resistance. The instructions recommend NOT attempting to pump water more than six feet above the pump level.Features:Potable water pump3 gallons per minuteSelf-priming55 PSIInternal bypass-low cyclingQuiet operationRuns dry – thermally protectedBuilt-in check valve115 volt

I debated on 3 or 4 stars for these and I ended up at 3.5, and rounded up to 4.  The sound is better than you might expect for an inexpensive set of headphones and the battery seems to last a while, as they have been going for a while without going dead... without charging them.  I have read that they will last 12 hours or so with a full charge and I am not finding that hard to believe.The biggest problem I have with these headphones is the fact that the earpieces do not move.  You cannot adjust the angle of the earpieces, so you can't get a perfect fit on your ears and it allows external sounds to get in.  On top of this, there is more pressure at the bottom of your ears than the top, so they can get uncomfortable after a long session of listening.What I have found nice is that they connect easily to your Bluetooth device or phone and work as a hands-free device for cellular phones.  There is a button on the side of the headphones to answer calls, pause music, etc.  You can use NFC with Samsung Galaxy phones or anything else that uses NFC. The convenience is definitely there.If I could make a change in the design, I would put a swivel/hinge mechanism above the earpieces so that they would be able to fit more comfortably.Bottom Line: Recommended.

You will be happy with these unless you are really in need of the best steel. Sure, these are not Wusthof or Henckles, but the price is much lower. The steel is nice and you can get a great edge on these. I have a ton of knife sets and these still see use, even though I have Wusthof, Henckels, and Mercer knives.The only real problem I have with these knives is the black coating.  I don't really see a need for the coating, as it simply begs to be scratched up when sharpening the knives or if they are scraped against something.  I like my knives to look nice and these definitely look nice when new, but only time will tell how the black coating holds up with repeated use.The knives came pretty sharp from the factory, but they could use a bit more honing to get a great edge.  Still, they are easily sharp enough for most kitchen work right out of the box.  They won't cut through thick meat like a scalpel out of the box, but you can do good work right away.  The handles have a different kind of grip that has a texture that leads your thumb to a grip by the blade.  The handles don't feel as nice as more expensive knives I have, but I will put these into rotation to get a good feel for them.  I will update the review if I decide that there is some problem with them, but they get a 4-star review at the moment.I think that you will like these if you are not absolutely in need of Wusthof or whatever.  I can say that these will do the job for sure and for a lower price than the "elite" chef's knives out there.  Put a great edge on them and cook!  :D

Very nice knife set for a good price.  You will be happy with these unless you are really in need of the best steel.  Sure, these are not Wusthof or Henckles, but the price is much lower.  The steel is nice and you can get a great edge on these.  I have a ton of knife sets and these still see use, even though I have Wusthof, Henckels, and Mercer knives.Are these as good as the more expensive knives?  That really depends.  The steel is not as good and the fit is not as good, but they will definitely take a good edge and they will cut just as well when you get them edged properly.  The handles are not as nice as the more expensive knives, and they don't have the same hefty feel, but I really feel that most people will be very pleased with these knives.

Great price and great quality.  I use these to burn discs for my photography customers and I have yet to have a failure to burn or verify.  The clean top allows me to label discs and present a very professional product to my customers without them being able to see branding information through the label that I apply.I have been very pleased with these discs and I think you will have good results.

You can't beat these for the price.  I would not hesitate to recommend these for any photographer who works with stands in the field, as they will help keep your tripods isolated from shake and they will help keep your diffuser umbrella stands from blowing over as easily in breezy conditions.Highly recommended... just supply your own sand or pebbles.

I would give these towels one star if they didn't note that they are aiming to be the same quality as the "value brand from your local grocery store."  These are not really quite as good as the cheap towels my wife buys for her cleanup with her wax business.  These towels are thin, weak, and they won't hold much liquid.  I tested these towels against the cheap store brand from Kroger's my wife has in her wax room.  These towels were unable to absorb the exact same amount of liquid that the other store brand did.  The store brand is not nearly as good as Bounty, and these are not nearly as good as the store brand.  These towels are also very loosely rolled on the tube, apparently in order to make the roll look larger.  This strategic decision allows the towels to shift up and down the roll.  I was able to make a basic funnel shape.Since these are sold in cases of 30 for $30, I cannot recommend them, as the better towels my wife uses cost her .89c per roll.  These perform worse and cost .10c more per roll.Bottom line: You can get better cheap towels for less at your local store.

I don't know that this is really a necessary accessory. I installed it (i.e. put it on top of my console and plugged it in) and it went to work. The temperature was measured at 115 degrees as the fan started working. The fan has been running for about 30 minutes and the system temperature now shows 104 degrees. The reduction in temperature is certainly not 30% as is claimed in the advertising, as that would bring the temperature of the console down to 80 degrees, which would be virtually impossible without the unit being an air conditioner. What I have experienced is approximately a 10% change in temperature instead of 30%.The device itself is designed smartly enough. There are rubber pads on the front and back to keep the unit in place and to keep it from scratching your console. The USB passthrough allows you to use the unit without losing a USB port on the Xbox. The fan is very quiet and does the job it is meant to do, if not as well as is claimed by the manufacturer. It is unobtrusive on top of your console, as it blends right in with it. I would have preferred it if they would have had the temperature display on the front of the unit instead of the top, but that's a minor concern. Having the display on the top allows the unit to be less obtrusive, as it is just black and doesn't stick out, so that is probably why it is on the top.The vent comes out the back and blows fairly strongly. This moves a decent amount of air, so you are getting a good pull through of air into your console. This device will not really do anything for you if your system is in an enclosed rack or entertainment center, as all it will do is draw warm/hot air back into your console. I would not recommend this for anyone with their system in a closed area, as it should do no good at all.Bottom Line: it is inexpensive and worth buying if you believe that you need a system cooling device and you have your console in an exposed area instead of an enclosed cabinet of some nature.

These are THE BEST measuring spoons I have ever used... by far.  My wife and I have a spice company and I am a chef, so the quality of your utensils matters.  These are easily worth the money and highly recommended.The heavyweight construction will see them lasting years, and the coated lettering/numbering will also last.  The handles do not flex like some other lightweight metal spoons I have used and they don't break like the plastic ones.Do yourself a favor and buy these immediately if you need the best quality you can get.

This is a very good vacuum for the price.  The suction is not quite as strong as the Dyson vacuums I have, but the price is much better.  I think that this would be a VERY good alternative to Dyson and that it works almost as good, so you can't go wrong with it.  The ball-type base (not exactly like the Dyson - I don't know what to call this... it is a swiveling ball between the wheels that allows the handle to lean side to side) works as it should and it allows you to turn easily, like any other ball-type vacuum.  The hand tools are okay, but they suffer the same problems as Dyson vacuums.  The handle is not very comfortable to use when using the attachment.  This is NOT a knock on the Samsung, as it works the same as the vacuum I am comparing it with in this review.I greatly prefer the beater mechanism on this vacuum to the Dyson vacuums I have, as you don't have to bend over and rotate the bare-floor selector switch.  The Samsung has a button on the left-hand side of the unit by the handle that lets you turn the brush on or off.  This is a far superior design to the Dyson.The large wheels on this vacuum make it roll easily and smoothly, so it is not difficult to cover area.  The weight of the vacuum is also slightly less than the Dyson vacuums I am comparing it with.  I have absolutely no problems recommending this vacuum.BOTTOM LINE: I rate this unit exactly the same as the more-expensive Dyson vacuum cleaners I have.  This one does the job very well and does it for a lower price than Dyson.  A more maneuverable wand for attachments would make this a five-star cleaner.

2:04 Mins The video I have uploaded demonstrates the remarkable non-stick quality of this pan.  I cooked an egg and burned some cheese in the pan with no oil in the pan at any point.  Nothing will stick to the surface of this pan.  I found the pan to be incredibly easy to clean and of very sturdy construction.  The handle is nice and is stiffer than Kitchen Aid pans that I have, so I was definitely happy about that.  The surface is supposedly able to handle metal utensils, so long as they are not pointy, so this should be nice for some people.  I will continue using non-metal utensils, as I just prefer it that way.  The manufacturer states that the pan should always be hand washed (which we do with all our pans anyway), so please be mindful of that and do not put it in a dishwasher.Bottom line: I am going to order a set of these pans and I would HIGHLY recommend them to anyone who is in the market for new pans.

This is an excellent laminator for a good price.  The lamination sheets are easy to use and with the 12 1/2" width, you can laminate multiple items in one sheet without much issue.  The sheet feed is nice and smooth and I have had no problem getting things to feed properly.  The machine heats up very quickly, so you don't have to wait more than a minute to get started.  Another excellent feature is the automatic shut off function, making the unit safe to use and very unlikely to cause a problem due to overheating.Note: my wife attempted to laminate a traffic ticket that one of our kids got and it turned out to be a bad idea.  Since the laminator uses heat, you will need to be sure that the item you are laminating does not react negatively to heat, as the ticket just turned completely black.Bottom line: this is an excellent laminator that I would not hesitate to recommend if you are in need of one.

Hooded Menace did it again!  A great slab of heavy, doomy death metal.  The tracks here are compiled from various splits and EPs that you likely don't own, so BUY THIS NOW if you are a fan of Hooded Menace.  The tracks are all what you would expect from Hooded Menace; heavy.The tracks and their sources follow:1. Fulfill the Curse (from "The Eyeless Horde" 7"EP)2. The Eyeless Horde (from "The Eyeless Horde" 7"EP)3. A Decay of Mind and Flesh (Anima Morte cover) (from split with Anima Morte 7"EP)4. The Haunted Ossuary (from split with Coffins 7"EP)5. I, Devil Master (from "Live Evil Volume One" comp. DLP)6. Catacombs of the Graceless (from split with Ilsa 12"EP)7. Abode of the Grotesque (from split with Asphyx 7"EP)8. Instruments of Eternal Damnation (from split with Horse Latitudes 12"EP)9. Chasm of the Wraith (from "Labyrinth of Carrion Breeze" 12"EP)10. The Creeping Flesh (from "Labyrinth of Carrion Breeze" 12"EP)11. Monuments of Misery (from split with Loss 12"EP)The total length of this compilation is about 1:15:35.
