This is a lot of great stuff for a fan.

This is a very nice vacuum and it is easy to use and get around and under furniture.  The arm is extendable to allow you to reach under deeper furniture without issue, so you will get a cleaning that is much harder to get with a Dyson or other upright canister vacuum.  There are multiple power levels, including a power level that is meant to be very quiet and works very well for times when you don't want a lot of noise.  Multiple heads are included with the unit, including a bare-floor attachment, a beater brush head, and a couple of attachments for furniture and curtains.  The unit is small and lightweight enough to use comfortably in almost any situation.  It was not super easy to do the stairwell, but it was certainly easier and more comfortable than working with the Dysons we have, so it wins in this race.The problem with this vacuum is the bags.  I looked the bags up on the site here and they are about $5 per bag.  This adds up very quickly when you have pets, as the hair will fill the bag pretty fast.  If this was a bagless design, I would be in love with it, but the expense of constantly buying bags makes this a vacuum that you need to think about.  The purchase price of the cleaner is not low and the continual need to buy bags on top of it make it a pricey option, but a good and powerful unit.Bottom line: Very good vacuum if you don't mind buying bags.

Great sound: The sound is really quite good for a small package. There is more than adequate bass response and good high-end response as well. I didn't expect the sound to be as good as it is and I think that everyone with reasonable expectations will find the sound pleasing.High-quality construction: This thing is built like a tank. There is not even a tiny deviation in the lines around the unit and the fit is completely even all the way around. No loose-fit parts can be found on the unit anywhere. The fit and finish are about as good as you could hope for in a product.Multiple-format power adapter: The speaker comes with a switching power supply and tips for multiple power formats from various countries. This is an international-power-ready speaker right out of the box.Weight: This is a fairly heavy speaker, likely because of the batteries. You can use this without connecting it to power and you can even use it to power your cellular phone to charge the battery.Bluetooth: Go completely wireless with Bluetooth and even use it as a speaker phone with your cellular phone.BOTTOM LINE: Highly recommended for anyone in the market for a portable speaker system that does a LOT more.

Excellent table if you know what you are getting.  This is NOT a deep table and you will NOT be able to use it as a picnic table or something of that nature.  It is a great utility table that is extremely sturdy and well made.  The depth of the table is a about 18", so it is not going to have room for chairs at the ends if you want to use it as a table for eating.  We are using this as a utility table and it is fantastic.  The latches are very solid and the legs are absolutely straight and level without any adjusting.  This is not a light-weight table and it weighs in at about 35 pounds.  This is a good thing, as the weight keeps it sturdy.I would definitely recommend this table, but you need to be aware of the weight and size before purchasing.

I really searched to find a boot for my delivery guys to wear in our Florida rain storms.  They LOVE these!  When the road is full of water and splashing up, their feet and pants stay dry.  My guys are average build and they are able to tuck their pants in just into the top of these. It works for them. The price is great!  I would suggest using a liner for extra comfort to wear more than a few hours and thicker liners to adjust for narrow feet.

I have only used this a few times and I was hoping it would help me sleep well as well as be a good supplement , since I had read it was a positive result for other reviewers.  I did sleep just a tad better, but what I did notice is that I was calmer during the day.  I have a very stressful job and work long hours, so this was a surprise for me.

A picture is sometimes not worth a thousand words.  In this case - it is.  So many of these "look" the same, but it's in the feel you know if you'll like using it and if it will last.  I am quite pleased with the feel of this.  I am very sensitive to the way things feel.  I don't like cheap plastic or sharp edges.  The pages in the book have a soft satiny feel.  The grommets in the spin I have no doubt will make this stay together once full of cards. The book arrived in a gift box that was taped shut. So not so great in appearances for gift giving.  I did buy this as a gift - so I cut thru the tape for them.  The recipient didn't have to fight to open it and they really liked it.  I think I will now order one for myself.  This is not a luxury item by any means - but it does the trick and hold a lot of cards!
Extremely well made top of the line construction.  Looks sharp, holds up to wear and cleans up easily.  Great for taking the water off shoes before entering an office area.

These boots have a lot to like!  Nub on back of the heal for easy off.  Tab on back of ankle to help pull on. Bright pretty look made from  printed fabric behind clear shell. Quality materials and sealed seams - this is a step up from your average rain boots.  Sadly I will be returning because I do not like the angled toe box.  If you have worn pointy shoes and your foot already has taken that shape - well these are cute and will work fine.  I have worn European style healthy box toe shoes all my life and it's very uncomfortable to have my big toe pushed in.  I only recently wore similar shoes for a few months and noticed that the shape of my foot was changing and I am very upset.  It's a shame to have great looking healthy feet, only to have them changed by a poor shoe choice.

I believe in healthy feet.  Shoes must have a nice arch and a wide toe box.  These do not.  They also forced my big toe to lean in.  I already had another pair of shoes that did that and it cause my toe to permanently lean in.  If your toes are already like that from wearing pointy shoes maybe may not a problem, but I consider it essencial to toe stability when walking and running.  I am very upset to see this trend and I always look for a straight edge going from the heal (skipping the arch) and going on to the top of the big toe. The foot should be held back by the top of the shoe over the arch, not the toes being jammed.  And these shoes are not to short - just too pointy.

I opened this and immediately saw the permissions "Allows sending in-app billing requests and managing in-app billing transactions".  WTH???  I am sick of games being written with the express purpose of stealing from me.  You may think of this as a phone app but it's your computer and your wallet too.  Don't be fool.  Delete this and never buy it!
Great Book, with Quick Read Chapters.  Written in a meaningful way - no fluff.  I keep it on my desk as even the cover is a constant reminder to Lead Positive.

Required by OSHA in many work environments.  Good price on the bottle. The green wall piece with info is a cheap thin plastic - could be any cheaper.  But it's the bottle you need.  This size bottle is much better than having two smaller ones.  Think about it - if it is truly an emergency, you don't want to stop and open a 2nd bottle half way thru treating someone.  Don't be cheap and think two smaller is better.  We are talking about the possible loss of vision.

This is my 2nd purchase of a Hot Drink Press and this one is much better made and easier to use.  First - no more using two containers or a water heater to get the water hot, I just pop it in the microwave.  Second, the smaller shape I think keeps the water hotter for a longer steeping time.  Third, the press inside is very well made and I see much less debris accumulating in it.

Got one for everyone in the office.  Got tired of always running around to see who had the one tape measure.  We wrote names on them and we all make sure we keep them handy.  I carry mine in my purse for shopping.
Hubby was thrilled when he saw this.  Can't wait to put his autographed UK basketball in it in his office for bragging rights.
Not just for styling. Not just for fly away hair.  I also use these to keep hair back and to fit under tiny shower caps.  These are really fun to style with, so many possibilities.

Every business needs this at their back and front door.  We get heavy daily rains in Florida and this really saves us from mopping up.  VERY Heavy mat. Won't slip. Edges won't curl.  Finger nubs very solid and strong.  Should last a LONG time.

Two Problems were evident as soon as my 4 tapes arrived.  Three of them were very badly scratched up - as if they were shipped in a large wooden crate and these were the ones on the bottom. Deep and dirty scratches that made me wonder if they might crack easily.  I returned the 3 damaged onesSo I opened the one good one after a LOT of struggling to the point it was dangerous! Between the overly strong and sharp plastic edges and the scissors in my hand - I am lucky blood was not drawn.This item would have been much better packed in a cardboard box to protect it.  The only thing covered by the ridiculous packaging is the small belt clip in back - which is too small to actually use./

Our office is remodeling and we got rid of all the plastic organizer trays.  I was really torn between this one and the Safco Products Onyx Mesh Desk Organizer, Triple Tray, Black.  Becuase of free shipping and the great price we chose this.  I feel it is a little unstable since the trays are not attached.  I also choose to use these on a bookshelf due to the bottom slipping around.  On a desk I would definitely want to add little rubber spots to keep it from sliding off - but there is no place to put them.  Since we have ordered sit stand desks and stability is an issue, plus I prefer the look of the Safco Mesh - I will not be reordering these unless I plan to use them in the bookcase.  The others probably slip also since they are metal - but they are flat on the bottom and will accept rubber disks (I think).  The only thing touching the bottom on these is the tip of the two arms in front and the long wire in back.

Oh My !!!!!  This is the Mother of all Rubber Mats!!!  I needed help lifting it out of the box and carrying to it's place just inside a warehouse exterior door that has a rain spout close by.  I am almost proud of the quality put into this mat. It makes a statement both visually and how it feels when you step on it. I have no doubt it will last us 10 years.  After ordering and getting several poor quality mats - I really researched and found this.  I used weight as well as close up images to decide.  The grippers on top of this are substantial and strong even though they are deep.  I measured them at just over 1/4" tall. There actually are quarter sized suction cups on the back to keep it in place however I don't know what forces it would take to actually move this - maybe hurricane winds???  I know I made the right decision.
Put these on every door in our business. Great for security when you can't watch all of the doors. Loud enough but not unpleasant. Has a nice Dong sound.easy to install
Very pleased.  Soundd great, very low distortion. Just a bit large.

We have cream colored carpet that is 18 years old and still looks great even though it has only been shampood twice.  How?  No pets no shoes and this stuff that comes to the rescue to lift any spill.  Shoot it at an angle from the side and it foams up and lifts dirt and stain and leaves no residue.  Just get it youwill use it.
Good looking, easy to fill, does not slip, cuts tape easily.
Finally a cap big enough to cover my long thick hair.
Best way to air and drain soap or dish washing sponges out of sight.  No dishes to clean out.

I have purchased 5 matts for our business and  kept searching for the best.  This is it. Much higher denser pile than expected. I expect this will last and look great for a long time.  Heavy and bottom side has finger grips to hold in place on carpet.  A plus quality!

Looks poor quality, looks nappy instead of any carpet pile definition on the ribs.  The rubber edge is thin and waves due to lack of thickness.I bought this for use in our business and will only put this at a back door where it will not be seen.  I actually ordered two of these back in April of 2014.  I was told the second would come in when they were in stock again.  Today is June 2015, and the other one just came in!!!!!!  For the ONE YEAR LATE shipping and poor quality I can not give this more than one star.

I purchased several of these for work and would like to return them.  What I liked is that like previous similar ones, they stand up, are easy to grab and leave more desk top space.  But these seem to be a bit more cheaply made.  You have to squeeze really hard to get even  2 or 3 pages to staple.  It seems to catch and you have to press really hard to get it to completely staple.  After just two uses my hands are sore!  Really???I also purchased this one PaperPro Desktop EcoStapler, Moss, (1710)  for a manager who staples large batches at once.  He came to tell me it was amazing.  Almost as good as the electric we have.  If you need a stapler for regular use, why save a few bucks just to have an annoying cheap and hard to use one.  Get a quality easy to use one.  I don't want to get upset every time I need to staple!

Truthful reveal of the repressive treatment students experience in the higher public education system.  Inspires hope and action. A positive movie, one to be shared with family and teens followed by a discussion of holding fast to your faith.

These are wonderful and work just as described.  I ran it overnight in my garage to let it gass out.  Brought it in no problem.  I have a very sensitive nose and I can tell if these are NOT turned on now.  Really appreciate the cleaner air!!!
Got these for work and people were fighting over them.  They look and feel that good and they are precision scissors that have a nice cutting surface.

Very handy to use just as pictured on either inside or outside of bathroom cabinets.A lot less things fall off now due to cords pushing them off the edge.Metal allow flat iron to cool with no danger of burning things
Just as pictured, flexible, works.
Makes long days at work bearable!  I have very picky ears that get annoys with distortion.  These are wonderful for me.
VERY well made - but won;t work.  Made for home doors not commercial doors.  But the part that goes over the door is so thick that you can't close the door.  Had to return.
Works great on my glass, just not on my pebbled dash surface.  It really stick to the window very well and is easy to pop off and move if necessary.

These are very thin and nice, but probably won't last long.  They also do not come up as high as the image shows.  When I sit down, and my pants go up, you can see a bit of leg, which I do not like.  They just don't make quality socks any more.
Very nice product for dry skin.  Not to be used if oily skin or in the summer because sweat will make it slide off.

These are just what  have been looking for!!!  Fit very comfortably and stay up on larger 18" calves.  Very strong fabric and less likely to snag.  Very nice looking under slacks and long skirts.  Wash well by hand or in machine.  These should last a few years.  The wide elastic band is very comfortable, does not roll or let slide down.  Would fit regular to large sizes and I bet would even fit skinnier legs.

Got this for work where we staple a lot!!!!  We get sore hands and even bruises some times.  Bought this little guy based on reviews.  Thought something this powerful would have been larger and heavier.  It is taller than a standard stapler but not a larger footprint.  Oh My, just the slightest tap and this things staples with power!!!  It almost seems like it is electric.  I highly recommend this unit.  Life is too short to deal with run of the mil staplers.  Just get this one!!!!

Perfect fit to phone. This actually replaces the back of your phone. Very solid construction and adds protection too.  We did notice a slightly weaker signal strength and this may be due to the thicker battery back causing interference.  It arrived charged at 30% and we put it on right away. After an over-night charge and all day light usage it was 30% by the end of the day. This is disappointing - but I will see how long it can actually go before dying.  Becareful to follow the instructions as they are different from other replacement batteries.

This product goes easily and is gentle on my extremely sensitive rosacea skin. I have older dry skin that is still prone to pimples.  I can wer this in the dry winter months - but never warm months.  I purchased mine from Decorstock and received it with an expiration date of JN/12.  Not sure if that is January or June. I also purchased both the 310 & 315 shades because I like to blend.  It had a date of SE/12.  I am happy to report these smell fresh and there is no separation.

I purchased four different AirFree models.  This is the basic model and its the same size as the rest.  I think if you want to sink some money into cleaner air and you are willing to have a unit this size, you should go with the biggest highest model number you can afford.  The only reason one might prefer this one is that it gets less hot - so it would be safer to have in a child's room?  There is no way to reach into these units so I am not sure that is a valid reason.  I know that the best one you can clearly feel more of a warm draft coming up from the internal heater which is what sanitizes the air as it is passively pulled up as the heated air rises.

EDIT:  I originally gave this 5 stars, see OLD review below.  But I started getting static and what I thought was connection problems.  I kept fiddling with the chords, and I was shorted the chord upon delivery of the original purchase - so I had to wait for that to arrive.  By the time I figured out that it was my speakers not the cords - the amazon return window had closed.  I am so mad that I purchased 2 of these based on reviews.  I WISH I could return them!!  Just Junk!  The STATIC is LOUDER than the SOUND!!!Just plugged it in and LOVE it!!!!!  Originally set it up using some old but Longer wires than were included.  (What you get are two really short 21" wires)  Was disappointed with the distortion.  Replaced them with what comes with the HYDRA speakers and wow - what a difference quality wires make.  These are really LOUD and really clear sounding for the size and price.  There is NO VOLUME CONTROL om the unit - but you can do that thru the computer.  I am glad I got two pairs.

I have owned several pair of UV protection gloves and these are longer version of them.  I use these for driving in Florida.  Who wants wrinkled hand with age spots?  These also protect from a hot steering wheel.  With fingers exposed you can use your cell phone.  I have average length fingers and the tips of mine just barely stick out of the gloves - not like in the picture.  I have heavy arms and these pulled up fin over them.I got a pair for my mother because she has thin skin that is easily bruised and cut - these make a great protection.  I keep these on when I go shopping because it protects me from touching the dirty cart handle and I tend to scratch myself up and since I don;t wear long sleeves these protect and also keep me cool.
I love these funky magnifiers.  Comfortable and really do a great job.  Now old age eyes are no longer a problem for up close work, reading fine print, pulling splinters, sewing, etc.

I purchased this for the bathroom and a few Onyx AirFree air purifiers for larger areas.  I have to say that this little guy is "almost" up to par with the lower levels of the AirFree at a fraction of the price!  We just got off a cruise and I took it with me!!! ( had to use an extension cord and lay it on it's side)  It's great for health and a MUST have for people with Asthma or low immune systems.

I use this diluted (it's just as effective) 3 parts water to one part solution in these spray bottles:  Soft 'n Style 8 oz. Spray Bottle Set / 3 Piece Set (B28SET)  I use it at home and at work on every surface when someone gets sick.  I also bath with it - its better than deodorant.  I keep some in a much smaller 2 oz spray bottle for when traveling and spray on my hands for protection from germs for up to 6 hours.  This stuff should be EVERYWHERE - I don't know why it is a secret.  Stop using dangerous chemicals and just get this!!!!

Well made and stable little bottles.  Great for homemade cleaning supplies and replacing other bottle which always seem to give out before you have finished using all of it.  Putting a little bottle anywhere that's handy without taking much space.I use it for diluting and spraying  Chlorhexidine/Hibiclens which I dilute with 3 parts water to one part solution.  I clean my home, I bath with it, I clean my business, I use on ALL surfaces that anyone touches when someone gets sick.

I have purchased these to use mainly in the kitchen for when something burns.  My last tub was smaller and literally lasted me30 years!!!  It was only half empty but lost pressure  ha ha.  This one will last till I die.  We have done a bath remodel and there was a mold problem.  I used this to clean the air from that exposure.  This is a great thing for people with asthma - but care must be taken not to over use it as it too can irritate the lungs.

I did my research. I have purchased many styles of disposable, half face mask before.  For our first full face mask I wanted to invest in the BEST. These are for my family in case of serious epidemic.  After purchasing one and deciding these were the BEST option available I purchased one for every member of my family.  These are lighter weight, more comfortable, have a better seal, and the only drawback is I do not see how you can use these with glasses unless you purchase special lens adapters.  So for those needing that to be able to use these on a regular basis - these are perfect.

OK,  these look extremely  strange on, and they are a bit cheaply made.  I also purchased the MagEyes Magnifier and prefer it.  Less weight on the nose - but mainly because the MagEyes main focus area is larger, the distance from the lens is further too about 5 inches vs 2 inches.The little lights on this do work, but might be help to some.  But I don't plan to use these for magnification any more - probably going into the dress up for Halloween box.

These are the most amazing and time saving little pads.  No more tearing foil and pulling cotton balls apart, PLUS, once formed, you can use these Over & Over!!!I put my Acetone Remover into a Spray Bottle, then 1 - 2 sprays into each formed nail cover and they are ready to go again.  Since the gel polish only softens and does not really come off onto the pad, you could really use these for a REALLY long time.Well worth the price.  Only wish these were just a tiny bit larger to really lock on better.

Stuff is just what you need to remove gel nail polish.  You can put pieces of cotton in pieces of foil and wait a full 10 minutes (after scoring the surface for better penetration), or you can just use " Vip Beauty Shop 200 Pieces Nail Polish Gel Remover Foil Wraps " which are much easier.I also removed the top on this bottle and replaced it with a sprayer head that fits - which was genius.  Now I just spray once or twice onto the pad in the VIP foils that I reuse over and over.  No more messy spilling and wasted product.  You could easily pick up a little travel spray bottle for the same purpose.

The first time I used this I had only had my nails done twice at a salon with soak off polishes.  I had my doubts it was working the first time since it still seemed not dry after each Light session.  You need to wait until the last step when you wipe off with the cleanser for the hardened polish to be evident.I am able to do BOTH hands at the same time!  I simply apply to both hands and then stack and spread my fingers.  It works great because there is a wide opening.I only have two concerns:1: Skin damage long term from the lights - so I will wear my fingerless sun protection gloves with this in the future.2: Light does come out of the wide opening and this light can damage your eyes.  I plan to take a folded piece of aluminum foil and tape to the top over the opening, making a flap like the top of the line Gelish until that costs much more.I really enjoy the convenience and saving of doing my nails at home!!!  I have VERY thin nails that never help regular polish even one day.  This has been wonderful to have such a lasting beautiful gel polish and the bonus is it lasts longer than you need.  I generally redo every week and a half because the regrowth starts showing by then.An product I ordered and enjoy to work with this are: VIP Beauty Shop 200 Pieces Nail Polish Foils with the cotton attached,  I have reused them 3 times and will do so until they fall apart.I Also took the remover  Super Nail Pure Acetone Polish Remover 235 Ml  and put it in a spray bottle as it is easy to spill.  Now I just give 1 -2 sprays onto the above foils that are preformed do to being reused.  I pop my fingers in and find I SAVE A LOT OF TIME as well as $$ by reusing them.

I like the concept.  I wanted something that would be stable in my hand.  The rings are such a thin width that I thought they would  not add as much stability as I needed.  They don't slip out of your hand and they won't wobble. They have a good sharp cutting edge.  I highly recommend these.

I purchased several brands to compare.  This was initially my favorite.  It is comfortable, the valve works great,  the mesh helps the mask hold it's shape.But, the  straps break and the liner that goes all around the inside edge of the mask to create a close fit on the face.....fell off the mask!  Perhaps the ones I purchased were old ( I did not buy them on Amazon, I got them on Ebay)
These are the perfect markers to use on large Jenga pieces for wedding reception messages.

I bought this for a playroom for my daughters wedding.  I wanted kids of all ages to be able to interact and have fun.  They preferred playing with this than watching the movie we had set up so that says a lot.  Little kids love holding the circles and dropping them in even if they don't understand the game.  Everyone else has fun too.  So few games are really great like this for all ages.  It is so sturdy and stable.  It is actually a Beast in it's construction.  It's plastic but it would take a lot to break it so that is why I think it costs so much, still I'd like to see it sell for about $50 less.  I plan to keep this at home, but already have friends wanting to borrow it for use in classrooms.  She said if the class gets answers right they would earn putting a disc in.  Sounds like a great Homeschooling toy then as well.

I have mature skin and am sensitive to ingredients and occasionally have rosacea.  Due to a bad reaction with a product with SPF ingredient Oxybenzone, my face was having a bad Contact Dermatitis reaction.  I came to Amazon to read reviews and pick a safe product to use while I was so irritated.  I settled on this item and on Carapex Natural Anti-aging Night Cream with Elastin & Collagen, for Dry to Combination Skin, Fragrance Free, Perfect for Sensitive Skin, 2oz 60mlSebamed has a very faint floral scent.  It has a very silky texture and is easy to apply and rub in if you wish.  Since I was trying to protect my skin while not making my skin reaction worse, I applied the CARAPEX first with no serum r other products to be sure I was only evaluating one product at a time.  In the middle of the night my eye area was feeling very dry.  I was not able to apply the Carapex there due to it's thickness and now I also see the label says not to use on the eyes.But I saw no such warning on this product, so I applied a very thin layer most delicately to my eye area.  During the rest of the night my eyes swelled up.  I could feel it but did not want to get up again.  To my shock, by morning one was completely swollen shut and the other was very swollen.While I may LOVE this product after my dermatitis reaction is gone - I feel I need to warn others that this item WILL AGGRAVATE AN ALREADY UPSET SENSITIVE SKIN.In a month or two I will come back and do a patch test, and then full face if I can.  If this reaction does no repeat _ I will raise my stars.  But I feel I must warn others with very sensitive skin.  I will try to post a picture - I do not like leaving negatives unless they are earned.  I would like to point out that I did NOT get his cream In my eye, only in the eye area.

I have sensitive skin and had a very bad reaction to CARAPEX Night Cream. CARAPEX has no smell and I researched extensively hoping I had found a great moisturizer that would not give me a bad reaction.  I previously reported that this item caused me no problems, thinking that the MAJOR case of Contact Dermatitis I got was due to another product. After a trip to the dermatologist and a round of steroids and RX creams and waiting SEVERAL Weeks to begin introducing items back one at a time - I CLEARLY had a bad reaction to this.I applied it in the morning and once again my face started to feel bumpy, then burn and turn red.  I did not wait and immediately washed my skin and applied the RX cream again.I have mature dry sensitive skin that needs moisture.  I am so sorry this item did not work.  I must also point out that I was not shipped what appears in the picture.  The wording is the same, and maybe there has been a packaging update since my order in late May 2014.For those still interested:  I found this Elastin and Collagen product to be thicker than I would like because it required quite a bit of rubbing and thus stretching of my skin to get it to spread. Perhaps it is because I am used to products with "slip" that spread easier and I just am not familiar with this type of cream - but it grabs like nothing I have seen in 30 years.  It dries mid-stroke and then grabs where it is and won't move.  I did not try it over a facial serum due to wanting to avoid all of my own products and wanting to test this out.  I did not dare use it near my eyes due to the spreading problem.I posted a picture of the different looking jar I got.

Benefits include Sorbitol , Aloe Juice, Xylitol and White Tea ALL which have healthy benefits with out the side effects of traditional ingredients.No Bad Stuff;  Sulfate Free, Fouride Free, Paraben Free, SLS Free, No artificial Colors - Flavors - Sweeteners.  And No animal testing.Foams nicely. But waters down quickly in the mouth.We have had two tubes and both had the same problem,  the toothpaste, which is actually a very thick gel. was TOO THICK TO SQUEEZE OUT!!!  Even my husband said it was too much work.I wish it was a bad tube, but after two of them I can only recommend this for body builders - no one else will be able to get the product out!!!

I received the new 70 lumen light, not the old 50 lumen.  Instructions:  You tap the tail switch until you get the desired mode and then you lock in that mode by pressing the tail switch all of the way in (click).  My light is (1) bright mode, 70 lumen rated at 2 hours run time, (2) strobe, rated at 4 hours run time, and (3) low brightness, 5 lumen rated at 32 hours run time.  It's perfect for 24x7x365 carry.  No complaints other than there's no reason for this light not to change modes through normal clicking of the tail switch.  The "programmable" switch doesn't add anything but complexity to a light with only three modes.  Also, the pocket clip comes off rather easily.  I would use metal glue/epoxy if that clip was critical to me.

The "new" camera I got from AMZ had been opened and then sealed with Scotch tape and was greasy.  The USB connection to the camera was weak and "iffy".  I had to use an extension cord to mount the camera anywhere useful because the provided USB cord is only about 9.5 feet and my ceilings are 10 feet+ and my electrical outlets are not near any entrances to the house (eg, hallway, landing, foyer, etc). I never got it to work. If it worked properly, I would have given it an extra star, at three stars.  I would suggest people measure 10 feet from the AC outlet in order to determine if that works for them.  I expected more at this price.The real gem is Dropcam's Cloud Video Recording services (CVR), which I would rate 5++ stars.

I've used a KX-TGA6512B base for over two years, and I absolutely love it.  Because I'm on the phone for hours every day, I rotate between 5 handsets.* Even rotating between 5 handsets, one breaks every 7 months on average.  I would expect they'd break sooner if I had fewer handsets.* My base station is limited to 6 handsets total.  Even if you take the batteries out of a handset, you will not be able to replace it until you formally de-register it.  (1) On the handset you want to de-register, go to Menu> Initial Settings > Handset Name.  This will give you the name of the handset you want to de-register.  (2) On another handset that's already registered (not the one you want to de-register), hit Menu # 131.  Then Select the name of the handset you want to de-register, and then hit select.  You will now be able to registered additional handsets, but again, only up to six total at any one time.

I bought these test strips because I was on the Adkins diet and wanted to see if I was in Ketosis.  The fact there are other tests on the strip is an added benefit, especially because these strips are less expensive than most Ketostix.  When I saw my results, I figured I might as well see what they all mean.The strip indicated there was protein in my urine.  The instruction sheet isn't very helpful.  Is it bad to have protein in the urine?  How much is bad, and how much is OK?  For that, you'll need to research on the Internet, because the instructions aren't very helpful.Well, what I found out is disturbing.  Protein could mean chronic kidney disease, because the kidneys aren't properly filtering protein, or it could mean that I work out strenuously and don't have kidney disease.  Since I didn't have any other indicators of kidney disease (eg, high blood pressure, diabetes), and I do work out strenuously, I was only mildly concerned but wanted to verify.I bought another brand of strips that only check for protein and glucose, and those sticks show I am 100% normal with no protein in the urine, while side by side the Phinex show the presence of protein.  I do think these Phinex strips are a useful tool and the other tests seem really accurate, but results need to be taken with a grain of salt.  The meaning of the results also need to be researched.So the strips are a four star product, with one star removed because results should be verified, and the instructions could be better.
GNC Pro Performance Chocolate Supreme tastes better but has more carbs (6 grams in GNC vs. 3 grams in ON).  Other than than, you're just paying for protein.
I'm in month 6 of these damned Invisaligns.  I used to be so diligent to get them back into my mouth after eating.  At least I have a good carrying case when I forget.
Cleans the smudges off of my eye glasses with no streaks.  Very soft, so I'm not worried about micro-scratches.  I've placed these strategically around the house and car.

I used a 2" piece of Velcro to mount this on a safe door (metal door, not carpeted).  Then I just stuck the holster on the door, since the back of the holster is Velcro too.  Seems secure enough.However, the Velcro strap that comes with the holster could be an inch or so longer.  As it stands, the Glock 23 barely fits.Great holster for a safe door or range bag with Velcro attachments.Two Inch Wide Velcro:  Velcro Brand Industrial Strength Tape (2 Inches X 4 Feet) - Black

The active ingredient in Mucinex is Guaifenesin.  These have 600 mg, while the Maximum Strength has 1200 mg.  I've used a 200 mg liquid in another product (Robitussin Cough + Chest Congestion) and found it as effective as these tablets at the time.  Both these 600 mg tablets and the 200 mg liquid really really work.  The mucus coming out already has been broken up into little pieces.  Someone said this is a life saver, and I have to agree.  This is an amazing product, with a very stupid name.  At least "Mucinex" is easier to remember than "Guaifenesin".
Clear and well-written text, with relevant cases.  No information that isn't needed.  I'm using it as more of a hornbook.

This jar base (officially called a "jar bottom cap" by Oster) is no different than my original base that looks like Bakelite.My original base was expanding/swelling because I put it in the dishwasher.  I had to push it down harder and harder on the blender in order to make it work (because the drive shaft didn't reach the bottom of the blade).  Eventually, the jar base would have cracked because of pressure.  I sanded down the ribs on the original base, in order to make it fit again, and now I have the original base working again.  I was surprised how much I had to sand down the ribs, though.  I had to put the sandpaper flat on the counter and move the plastic base back and forth, otherwise I got rounded edges.

I agree with a previous reviewer that the mesh is too wide for many cheaper teas, which tend to include leaf parts and tea dust.  However, for whole leaf teas, this is perfect to make large quantities (eg, 1 liter +).I washed it in the dishwasher and also left it in water for an extended period (12 hours), which no evidence of rust.

This is the only glass pitcher I could find that can take hot water for tea.  The reviews for almost all other ptichers noted the glass breaking.  I didn't want to use plastic because of leaching chemicals or melting.  I've put the tops in the dishwasher, with no ill effect.It's 12" high with the top and a little less than 3 1/2" round at the base.  I have one with a white top and another with a grey top, to note different types of tea.  You can buy extra tops if you just have one pitcher, but want to color code as well.Thankfully, this pitcher rocks because it's also the only one that works for me.

Below is a recipe for a Chia seed drink that I make at home.  However, these Squeeze packs are tasty and good if you're on the go, although a little expensive.I mix 9 parts water (3 cups) to 1 part Chis seeds (1/3 cup), which I leave in a plastic container (eg, Sterilite or Snap) in the refrigerator for 8 hours.  That makes "Chia gel".  I then squeeze juice from a lime into 1 cup of the Chia gel, and add a tiny amount of sweetener, such as Agave Nectar.  I mix and drink, and it's really good.
The bags fit just fine and are much less expensive than others I've found.  A little thin, but perfect for use in a bathroom wastecan.

It's a black piece of metal that's been bent to hold your phone or tablet, at a good angle for Facetime or just to use.  There's a space on the bottom where your charging cable can go through.  It's well designed and certainly not smelly or ugly by any means.  I even put my iPad 3 with a portfolio type case on it, just to see.  The stand holds the iPad well enough to use without falling, although you need to be careful.  The iPhone 5 with a slim plastic case (impact type plastic) words flawlessly.I love it.

The clips that hold this unit to the vent are short and mine failed in a very short period of time, perhaps due to the air conditioning being on for a total of 2 hours.  I don't see this as an acceptable solution.

This is my favorite tea by far.  The flavor is strong and smooth, not bitter like some other brewed teas.  However, the 33.8 ounce Tejava (in a glass bottle) sells for the same price in stores, making it about half the price of the listing.Tejava's website is very interesting about how they only pick the best leaves from the plant, leaving the inferior leaves unpicked, and only during certain months.  The quality shows.

The slight indent in the middle makes the NeckBone much more comfortable than a traditional neck roll pillow.  It's very comfortable for use when sleeping on my back or my side.  I think it would be good for long flights as well.

This book is not particularly useful when read independently of the keyed text.  The language reads as though written by first year law students.  I would not recommend unless you also are reading the Areeda Casebook.

I was a fan of the original Rock Band when it first came out on PS3, and the PS4 version brings back a lot of fun family memories with a refreshed but very familiar look. The new drum set has been overhauled completely from previous versions, with thicker, more sturdy drum pads and an easy to adjust stand. The guitars have that familiar Rock Band feel, with responsive fret buttons at the top and at the base of the neck, and the no-click strum lever feels more like you're playing a guitar string as opposed to pushing a clicky-lever that Guitar Hero has.This 4th version of the game has a new "freestyle mode" where you can (kind of) play whatever you want during the guitar solos, but it's not completely open - the screen cues will still tell you the strum-type, and it's up to you to try to match it with your own selected notes... so it's not entirely independent, but it's a different feature that you can use, or disable for the more conventional guitar solos.I do like how the drums and the guitars were completely wireless this time around, and I would have preferred the USB Microphone to be wireless as well - but I suspect that it's wired to deliver the constant stream of voice data without lag (as opposed to quick "blip" signals that the instruments send).Graphics-wise Rock Band keeps it simple, with animated characters that you can customize to your liking without trying to bring in too much realism. The song list on disc has a wide range of music, and the best part is that you can go to the PSN store and re-download all of your previous purchases from previous Rock Band games without having to rebuy them. This feature let me play songs from the previous versions and only expanded the song library even more.It's been years since the last Rock Band came out, and being able to play again on my PS4 is fun for the family and friends. Other than the semi-independent freestyle mode and a tour mode that feels a little short, Rock Band 4 still delivers and is still just as fun to rock out like the original.
Nice connectors, has rubber seals at both ends of each plug half. Assembly is quick if you crimp, but there's enough room in the housings if you want to solder your pin connections.

If you need added fuse protection for your vehicle accessories, you can't find anything better than what Blue Sea offers. Sure, it's normally a marine application, but a lot of people use them for vehicle purposes like me. The whole assembly is heavy and feels really strong, craftsmanshp is excellent, and you can tell just by looking at it that this fuse block means business. The built-in grounding block has identical connections (meaning for every positive terminal screw there's a negative terminal screw) so you can literally wire anything you need fused directly to this fuse block. No more add-a-fuses, no more splicing and extra messy wires all over the place; I have a pair of off-road lamps, my aftermarket horns, and two car audio processors connected to the Blue Sea. Also, having all of your accessory fuses in one place makes any troubleshooting or maintenance just that much easier.
Nice and strong cable ties, does not feel flimsy like the cheaper, no name brands that break easily.
Nice assortment of blade-type fuses for all sorts of electronic device protection.

I've tried other "white" halogen bulbs first (none are really white), I've tried lower-cost LED bulbs (which always seem to end up flickering after about a month), and in the end these have been the best so far. Brightness is very high, the light is actual white in tone, and no flicker whatsoever. I only gave these bulbs 4 stars instead of 5 because of their higher price compared to alternatives, but this is definitely a case of you get what you pay for. If you need a bright, real white, reliable LED bulb for 921 sizing, this is the best choice.

I bought this "kit" in order to install a pair of aftermarket horns on my truck. It is a nice combination of parts - 12v relay that has a mounting tab molded in (a nice touch) and doesn't feel empty or cheap like other no-name relays, a matching relay socket with color coded wires for easy hookup, and a blade-type inline fuse holder (if you need it). You still need hookup wire to complete any installation, but at least with this kit you can be sure that you're giving the new accessory 12v full power.

Although I agree that these bulbs are "more whiter" than stock OEM bulbs that usually have a yellowish tone, they're still not white when compared to LED bulbs. There's still the hint of yellow - you just don't notice it much because the blue lens tinting kind of tries to mask the actual color of the filament inside the bulb (which is still yellow tone). For halogen bulbs they're fine, but again not exactly "white" light.
Nice bottle, keeps drinks cold for almost a whole day.
Nice bottle, keeps drinks cold for almost a whole day.

If you've played the first two games in the trilogy, it's only fitting that you finish with the finale. Arkham Knight doesn't try to reimagine or reinvent itself after the first two games - it continues on with the same formula but with current gen console power to deliver excellent open-world gaming (even if the "world" is just Gotham City). After playing through the entire campaign, it's safe to say that some of the puzzles are easy, the driving element is a little twitchy, and the graphics aren't hyper-realistic. However the graphical design of many of the characters is excellent, the story is not epic but above "pretty good", and there's a lot of exploring available to give hours and hours of gameplay.

After having great results with Mothers Reflections Tire Care, I decided to try out their Protectant for the interior trim and my tonneau cover. Unlike other protectants that have some sort of fuel-like smell to it, the Mothers brand also shares a pleasant, almost spice-like aroma to it which is nice considering that it's being used both inside and outside of the vehicle. It sprays on clear, and doesn't dry up quickly - so with only 2-3 sprays I can already wipe down half of my truck's tonneau cover. On the same note it isn't sticky or oily, and within a few minutes it is no longer "wet". It brings some life back into dull plastic, without having a "wet look" gloss. Just like the Tire Care, the protectant don't seem to pick up dust and dirt like other protectants I've tried. After using this and the Reflections Tire Care, I'm going to continue trying other Mothers products.

Bought this kit after it was suggested by the Crucial Memory Finder program to upgrade my +6 year old Shuttle XPC, which had only 2GB from the factory. After the easy install, my pc felt a lot faster. I've used Crucial memory before and never had any issues, I'm pretty sure it will be the same with these.

I needed some new trail/camping shoes, and after looking at other brands I ended up deciding on the AX2's. Once I got the right size (more on this later) the shoes fit nice and comfy. The inside has thin but noticeable padding; the flexible sides and toe area are great - the AX2's don't feel like other shoes where they make your foot conform to the shape of the shoe walls because they're stiff.I got to use these across a lot of varied terrain, from gravel, dirt trails, rock riverbeds, downed trees, and sand - and the tread pattern was very capable on any of these surfaces. On non-trail surfaces (concrete, asphalt) they tread actually acts as an impact absorber, and you can definitely feel it when you take a step, as they are very comfortable to walk in for long periods of time both on and off-road.Also, at $80/pair you would be mistaken to pass these shoes off as "cheap" compared to other brand "trail" shoes that seem to hover around the $100+ price point. They are very well made, feel great when laced up, and are very versatile. The only reason why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was because the US sizing seems off; I normally wear a 10.5 in athletic and casual shoes, but when I ordered the 10.5 it was way too long; With medium thickness socks on, I could squeeze my last two fingers (ring and pinkie) in between my heel and the back of the shoe. I went to a size 10 though and they fit perfectly.

I chose this because of the claimed "satin finish" and it wasn't lying. Instead of the high gloss, shiny "wet" look, I prefer my tires to just look "like tires"  should look, which is not dry but not glossy either. I'm glad that I tried the Reflections Tire care (kind of ironic since it doesn't reflect much) because it was exactly what I was looking for for my truck. RTC keeps my tires looking new, and unlike those "wet" oily tire gels and sprays, I do appreciate how my tires don't seem to pick up dust and dirt after a few miles of driving right after applying the RTC. On top of that, the RTC (like the other Mother's products I've started to use recently) has a fragrance to it, so you're nose doesn't suffer from that harsh chemical smell that other products have. This is good stuff.
This was a requested gift for my niece, and she likes it a lot so it gets 4 stars.
This was a requested gift for my niece, and she likes it a lot so it gets 4 stars.
This was a requested gift for my niece, and she likes it a lot so it gets 4 stars.
This was a requested gift for my niece, and she likes it a lot so it gets 4 stars.

If you want white light instead of the typical OEM "yellowish white", these do the job. They are high quality bulbs, and yes - they do cost a lot more than other brands (which explains my 4-star instead of 5-star rating), but I haven't used a PIAA bulb yet that didn't outlast the lower cost brands. Who knows - maybe I'm just lucky with bulbs, but I'm not complaining.

Instead of going with the more "usual" car audio brands (Kenwood, Alpine, Pioneer, etc.) I did some research and discovered Image Dynamics. I went with these CXS64 V.2 components after reading reviews from car audio forums, and they do not disappoint at all. The CX-64 woofers build quality is excellent - carbon cones, super heavy magnets, and an option to mount the tweeters coaxially or as separates (all parts needed to do the conversion are included in the box). The XS-28 tweeters include both surface and flush mounting, and have removable grills for custom installs. The included passive crossovers are a little larger than I expected, but in return they offer a lot of preset combinations for crossover frequency, tweeter level attenuation, and even crossover slope.After installing them, I tested the sound using varied music with a wide range of instruments and vocals - everything from percussion to jazz to EDM to rock and everything in between. I'm powering these speakers with an Alpine V9 that is feeding each pair of components 200-watts in bridged mode, and the CXS64 combination sounded amazing! Highs were crisp, midrange was clear, and vocals were very sharp. Even when playing dynamic tracks the CXS64's did the job and produced amazing sound. Needless to say, the sound quality was a huge step up from my factory speakers, and unlike the factory speakers I can crank the volume up now and the sound doesn't get distorted at all. My hi-fi addict friends told me that the sound will get even better after these "break-in" which is even better, because right now they already sound excellent.

Picked up this book after reading a lot of recommendations, and it is as good as I heard it was. I'm just starting to get into off-roading, and I have a basically stock truck at the moment - and this book gives me a lot of places to go to and explore. The summaries of each trail is to the point, with useful trail descriptions and helpful trail notes. The maps to each trail are easy to follow, and I like how they rate each trail on a 1-3 scale, including describing what kind of terrain and how equipped your vehicle should be for the location.

Of all the Nightwish DVDs I've seen, this is my favorite music-wise... mainly because I think they got it right by having Floor Jansen as the lead singer. The way she sings Nightwish songs (previously performed by Tarja or Annette) meshes perfectly with the heavy rock and metal sound. Everyone rocks out on stage, and you can feel the electricity as they perform all of their hits. The added disc covering the behind-the-scenes events showing the process of bringing in Jansen to take over the microphone was an interesting bonus. This DVD set is worth the money for any Nightwish fan, although I only gave the DVD 4 stars instead of 5 because just wished that they spent more time showing Floor and the band performing - instead of splicing in hundreds of shots of random crowd surfers every 10 seconds or so throughout the whole concert.

I bought this because the description says that it "easily fits big smartphones like the iPhone 6 Plus." When I received it, that's the first thing I tested - and it does hold my iPhone 6 Plus, if not just barely. The iPhone 6 Plus does fit into the main pocket, but before you zip it up you have to literally lift the top part of the zipper over the exposed edge of the iPhone 6 Plus. Other than that minor detail, the rest of the belt is good. The main pocket has a couple dividers so you can separate your phone, some cash, and any cards. The separate left side pocket is perfect for holding car keys, and the elastic belt straps feature a large, strong buckle that snaps together tightly. The mesh lining on the inside (the part against your back) is comfortable, and the materials and construction feel great.

Used this mini-relay for some interior lighting, and it works just fine. I wouldn't recommend it for high-amp requirements, as I'm only running lights with a 5 amp constant draw and the relay gets pretty warm to the touch. This is probably best used for short-term or momentary applications i.e. trunk release, etc.
Bought this to use with the Apple HDMI to lightning adaptor, since the adaptor has a short lightning cable segment. This extension cable plugged right in and worked perfectly.

I bought a roll of this wire to do a full vehicle audio install, and it did not disappoint. The actual wire inside the insulation is thick - I almost want to say that it's a little thicker than its 14AWG rating. This is nice considering that I've come across so-called "14 AWG" wire that was actually 18AWG with super thick insulation to pretend it was good wire. This Mediabridge wire is genuine, and as an added plus the wire insulation has easy to see marks for negative/positive.

If you want to install this LED kit cleanly, be prepared to pulling seats, trim panels, and lifting some carpet. Why? Because the four LED light bars are hard wired into the controller box. That meant that during the first attempt at installation, we had to try to snake each light bar (approx. 8" long) through the interior. This wasn't happening, so we ended up pulling the front two seats out of the car in order to install the LED kit. Sure - you could just install this quickly without running cable under the carpet, but then you'd have wires everywhere. If they added simple sockets to the end of each wire, it would have made installation a lot easier and with less hassle.Another thing - we could not put the controller box up front on the left side of the steering wheel column (where my friend originally wanted it) because of the hard-wired equal-length wires; with the controller up front, there would not be enough wire to run the LED bars all the way to the back of the interior. He ended up having to pick a spot in the center of the vehicle for the controller box.Aside from the installation woes, the kit itself works as expected; the lights are bright and the controller gives many lighting colors/options.

I tried this app just to see if I could get YouTube functionality on my Amazon Fire TV. It works for some YouTube videos, but doesn't find them all - even after typing in the exact video title into the search box (a title I got directly from my YouTube on my laptop!) It would be nice if the FireTV had an official YouTube app instead of these third-party ones that usually end up being ad fronts with later app "updates".

I needed this to be able to retain my factory steering wheel controls on my 2014 Nissan Frontier. I first tried the suggested wiring instructions as provided by Axxess, but it was for a 2013 model - and sure enough, the wire colors were changed for 2014. Since the included super thick yet super tiny "instruction" manual was of no use for troubleshooting, and since their website has nothing useful either, I tried calling the Axxess customer service (phone support only) but after being put on hold for 20 minutes I just hung up, recalling all of the negative comments I read online about the Axxess customer "service".  Luckily I found the correct wiring info on a forum - and after following those wiring instructions, I had the ASWC-1 working... almost. The volume buttons were mapped right, the mode select worked, and the tune/track up/down buttons were fine too. However the buttons for the factory hands-free were wrong. Here's a tip - if you have an Android device with a USB OTG cable, do yourself a favor and use the Axxess Updater App. I did not want to deal with the manual "count LED blinks" method to remap the hands-free controls to the correct functions, so I loaded up the Axxess app onto my Nexus 7 tablet, plugged it into the ASWC-1, and I had the remap done in seconds. In the end I got the ASWC-1 working exactly how I expected/wanted it to work, but I had to figure most of it out myself, the 3-star rating is because the unit works flawlessly once I figured it out; I would have given it more stars because it works well - except I'm taking 1 star away for each 10 minutes I waited on hold on the phone before giving up on asking the Axxess CSR for help.

I use this case/cover on my Macbook Air and it seems to be one of the better ones. The material is tough but not brittle like other case covers I've already tried. The rubberized outer texture is grippy but not sticky. All ports are accessible, and the vented bottom section lets air get to the cooling fans when needed. I also like how it's thick enough to protect my Macbook but thin enough so that the glowing apple on the back of the screen shows through.

I take one of these about 30 minutes before a big meal, and it seems to be working because I haven't had heartburn since I started taking Zantac (as recommended by my doctor, of course). The small size is nice too, I'm glad that it isn't some huge pill.

I needed a way to connect my Amazon Fire Stick (male HDMI connector) to the end of a permanently-mounted HDMI cable (also male HDMI connector) and this did the trick. Build feels fine, gold connectors are a plus, and when I plug the HDMI's into this adaptor it seems to have a nice grip for a good connection.

Works as expected; I needed this to use my iPhone 6 Plus nano-sim into an old iPhone 3GS that uses standard-sized sim cards, and it fits right into the 3GS perfectly. The included metal tool is a nice touch. I did have to take a small nail file and file down two sides of my nano-sim ever so slightly so that it would fit into the adaptor perfectly flush; the fitment of the adaptor is pretty precise, and I'm not saying that it's the adaptor's fault at all - I know that every so often a nano-sim might be cut slightly off. I just thought I would mention it so that others will know that their nano-sim might not be perfectly cut from the factory either.

First thing I noticed was that this wasn't exactly a "current generation" remote control - it's been around for years now (I realized when I opened the package that I actually had the same remote controller in my old car back in 2010). That said, a lot of the buttons aren't compatible with my 2015 Kenwood Excelon head unit. I would have thought that Kenwood would make sure that their only remote control would be 100% functional with their top-of-the-line head unit, but I was wrong. I bought this to mainly control the volume and track of my Kenwood head unit from outside my truck. It's a good thing that's all I wanted it for, because that's pretty much all it can do. I can't even adjust the head unit EQ.

I needed a cable to connect my laptop to my car stereo for audio tuning (laptop outside the vehicle) and this fit the bill. The construction is a nice quality, and the connections feel secure.  If you've ever had a KabelDirekt cabel before, you'll know what I'm talking about - these are very nice cables at a great price. Sound quality seems good too - I haven't heard any hiss, the signal sounds like it's going through at 100% (no attenuation), and even during silent parts of music there's no phantom noise.

Camera works just fine, I'm not sure if it's actually the "world's smallest" because there's a ton of aftermarket cameras available that look exactly like this one. Picture quality is decent, about the same as many other cameras I've seen/used. I thought I could use this "no line" version for my head unit as a front camera, but there's no way to reverse the image. I ended up switching to a Pyle PLCM38FRV (bought on Amazon Prime) since the Pyle gave me both reversible image and line on/off option.

I needed to get this cable to mirror my iPhone 6 Plus screen to my in-dash 7" receiver in my truck using the reciever's HDMI connection. One end of the AV adaptor plugs into the iPhone (lightning plug), and the other end has ports for an HDMI cable and a secondary lightning port, so you can still charge the phone while having HDMI connected. Built with a quality you expect from Apple, the AV adaptor works as described; I just wish it was a few bucks cheaper.

I purchased this to help me when I had a project that required a lot of wire-to-wire soldering. The clamps hold firm, the articulated arms help position your wires where you want them, and it made soldering wires end to end an easy task. Tip: unless you explicitly need magnification, do yourself a favor and remove the magnifying glass part, because it makes the stand top heavy, and it makes the whole thing tend to tip over just when you need it to stay put.
They're zip ties, a little thin but do the job for light jobs.
If you need to replace your ACR1 for the Audio Control Epicenter, this is the unit you need.

This latest Nightwish album follows along the same vein as the others, but it's not the best. I've been a fan of Nightwish for a long time, and after a long wait I was looking forward to a full album with their newest lead vocalist, Floor Jansen. However when I finally received the new album and listened to EFMB, I wasn't impressed.Let me be more specific: It's not that I wasn't impressed by Jansen's singing - but I was more disappointed in the fact that NONE of the songs on this latest album took advantage of her dynamic vocal range and metal rock ability. Adding Floor to the group gave them a new dimension with the vocals, because in my opinion she's like an awesome mix of the previous two lead singers. I love how she is a trained opera vocalist like Tarja (check out some of her early opera work on the Internet and you'll see that she can even hit higher notes that Tarja can't), but what makes Floor special is how she can also bring it like a true heavy metal rock star - screams and all (unlike Annette who I felt didn't have much vocal talent).Maybe I was expecting more songs in the style closer to those heard on their last few albums (Imaginaerum, Dark Passion Play, Once) because it felt like Jansen would be able to bring the right mix of opera/metal like she showed she could do on the "Showtime Storytime" DVD, but that wasn't what I got out of this latest album. I should have seen this coming, as the first single released from this album ("Elan") wasn't so much the "rock out Nightwish", but it felt more commercial, almost radio-friendly crossover-type music - as opposed to the chanting, the heavy metal riffs, and the symphonic formula that the better Nightwish songs tend to stick to.So in the end, this album to me is just "okay". It's not their best, and it's not their worst - but I feel like it is a waste in that they wasted a golden opportunity to use Floor Jansen's vocals to their fullest. Too bad, because at the rate Nightwish usually goes with album releases, we can't expect to hear more songs with Floor for at least another 2 years.

I ended up trying this game out after the whole Driveclub fiasco. "The Crew" turned out to be a nice racing game, something that feels more like the the old school "Need For Speed" games (when they were good). This isn't a "simulation" like Gran Turismo - it's a driving/racing game with a decent story and lots of side missions squeezed in between the main campaign. It has an open-world component to it, and there's also co-op play online if you want to hit the streets with your buddies. Graphics are good, voice acting is just fine (nothing over the top). It's not an epic game, but if you want a good driving game, take a look at this one.
Great for running/extending remote turn-on wires for amps, processors, etc.
Simple to use coupler, connections are nice and tight. I like how the pair is connected in the same unit (instead of individual couplers where you might lose one).

Very good, high quality cables. I like how the housing is super flexible, since it allowed me to snake the RCA's around areas of my interior between the head unit and my under-seat mounted amplifier. Their non "red and black" design looks great too - especially the clear housing that shows the twisted wires inside. I would have given them 5 stars if it weren't for their slightly higher-than-average price.

Very good, high quality cables. I like how the housing is super flexible, since it allowed me to snake the RCA's around areas of my interior between the head unit and my under-seat mounted amplifier. Their non "red and black" design looks great too - especially the clear housing that shows the twisted wires inside. I would have given them 5 stars if it weren't for their slightly higher-than-average price.

Good quality project box; doesn't feel like it's made of cheap plastic on an equally cheap mold. There are small ridges inside to give your board some spacing (not sitting flat on the bottom) and the included machine screws thread into brass inserts for a clean, smooth, and perfect enclosure.

I bought this cable to extend the "reach" of my aftermarket head unit's HDMI plug. The thinner cable housing lt me snake the cable in and around the dashboard with ease, and the plug ends themselves are of high quality. Note: If you're a Kenwood owner looking for an HDMI cable to use with your head unit, don't spring for their overpriced KCA-HD100 cable - the KCA-HD100 is just a regular HDMI cable! This or any other HDMI cable will work just the same.

I can finally stop using side cutters to strip wires - which sometimes works, and most of the time doesn't. The Hakko wire stripper is easy to use thanks to the comfortable handles and spring loaded return mech. It can strip wires of many sizes - easily identifiable since the wire sizing is stamped into the blade. The serrated tips work great for gripping wires (for example, if you're fishing a wire through a hard to reach area) and the built-in lock keeps the tool closed for safety and storage. The quality is also there too - I can see myself using this tool for many years to come.

This is an exceptionally interesting Franco-Flemish programme. It is built around a parody Mass by Philippe Verdelot on the motet by Jean Richafort 'Philomena praevia' – this being also included on the disc, together with other motets, a few antiphons and organ works interspersed between the Mass movements. Richafort's motet, in turn, is a setting of an extract from the medieval Latin poem by the English Franciscan friar (and later Archbishop of Canterbury) John Pecham or Peckham. This extraordinarily imaginative poem tells the story of Christ's life and death as expressed through the empathetic song of a nightingale, who accompanies Christ on his journey through life; when Christ dies, so does the nightingale. Of course none of this narrative is contained in the text of the Mass; but a parody Mass often constitutes, at least in part, a reflection on the content of its model. In fact, Richafort's motet evidently attracted some attention and was parodied by several composers including Gombert, Verdelot and Sermisy; Sermisy's very lovely setting was recorded as part of the sixth and last volume of the Leiden Choirbooks.Philippe Verdelot (c. 1470-1552) was a younger contemporary of Josquin, and at least one contemporary writer considered Verdelot's music comparable to that of Josquin and Clemens non Papa. The substantial dose of his music on the present disc is very fine indeed. In addition to the sombre but splendid Mass itself, the opening item is a lovely and uplifting eight-part motet, 'Gaudent in coelis', performed in sonorous style by the singers and trombones of the early-music ensemble Delitiae Musicae. This mixed voice-and-instrument scoring of what was originally intended as vocal music is perhaps not to all tastes, but it suits my own very well and it is certainly finely executed here. In fact, the male single voices of this Italian ensemble, sometimes with trombones and organ, do an excellent job throughout the programme. Marco Longhini is an outstanding director of early music, as he has shown in many other recordings, and here again he brings style, panache and an overall vision to the music which result in a compelling, varied and well-organised programme.Other moments especially worth mentioning are Verdelot's 'Si bona suscepimus' (track 10), beautifully performed by solo countertenor Claudio Cavina with four trombones; the instrumental Offertorium (16) played by trombones, with organ joining in later on - and just in case you think four trombones sound like a bit of a bore, they're certainly not so here, played with expressive rubato in the right places and reaching a splendid climax. After the Agnus Dei, Verdelot provides another very lovely eight-part motet, 'Salve Regina' (22-24), and the disc ends with Richafort's model four-part motet. The short chant passages at a few points in the programme are also very nicely done, aided by the recording in a sonorous church acoustic with a lovely ambience.The booklet notes are well up to the standard of the rest, and offer a real enhancement to one's appreciation of the music. In addition to ample information about the composer, the essay traces the tradition and procedures of the parody Mass, not just in the present example but in historical terms. The one thing not covered is any explanation of the origin of Richafort's 'Philomena' motet text, so one needs to find this out from elsewhere. Texts and translations are all provided, except for the opening 'Gaudent' motet for some reason.This recording should be of considerable interest to renaissance enthusiasts, but unfortunately it's become very hard to find. At the time of writing it's still available here on the US amazon.com site at a reasonable cost, but from European sites only at ridiculous prices. It's also available as a download. If you want the CD, though, best to get a move on!

Michel-Richard de Lalande, otherwise known as Delalande, was Master of the King's Music at the court of Louis XIV, and the king's most favoured composer after the death of Lully. Louis XIV liked, and could afford, to have music for all kinds of occasion, including sacred, secular and operatic, and some of Delalande's finest works are the sacred motets of which, like his great predecessor, he was a master.In a different category, however, are the 185 pieces composed to be played, as the title indicates, to accompany the king's suppers. They include a wide variety of forms and instruments, and were arranged into twelve suites. The present four-disc set was the first complete recording of all the Symphonies composed for Louis XIV; it was originally issued in 1990 and is now re-issued at a very handy price. Most of the suites begin with an Ouverture, and the subsequent movements include many short dance pieces, the more substantial forms of Chaconne and Passacaille, a few Caprices and the occasional Air. The latter are restored for this recording to their original version of airs for soprano.Instrumentation is varied, ranging from trumpets and percussion in the ceremonial, martial or hunt-style pieces to the more gentle, subtle tones of woodwind and strings and continuo where appropriate. There's a great variety of mood, pace and texture here, with Hugo Reyne's capable period-instrument band playing in excellent and spirited style throughout. The use of percussion provides further variety and colour in places, with some especially fine work on castanets to liven things up.And it does need livening up, for really this is mostly rather shallow music. It's no wonder because, while the Sun King undoubtedly had good musical taste, he wouldn't have wanted anything profound sounding forth while he was eating his supper and chatting away, as you do – and, judging by the contents of these discs, what the king didn't want he didn't get. There's plenty of light, graceful and superficially attractive music, with a few reflective moments. But the most interesting pieces for me are the more substantial Chaconnes, Passacailles, and the occasional Ouverture – and certainly not all of the latter, some of which are distinctly underdeveloped compared with those of Lully, Rameau, not to mention Bach, Handel, Telemann or a host of others.If you're irresistibly attached to the occasional music of Versailles, and fancy having more than five hours of it available to listen to, then this set will satisfy. But nobody in their right mind would want to hear it all at once – not even on the car stereo for a long haul on the motorway. I would stress that I don't want to knock a very fine composer, but I greatly prefer Lalande's sacred music, his motets whether 'grand' or 'petit'. He was also reputed to be an outstanding organist and keyboard player, and no doubt he would have been well able to craft some beautiful instrumental and chamber works; but unfortunately, as far as we know, nobody asked him to - or, if they did, none has survived.For me, the fault of this set lies with the music's purpose and with the Sun King himself, and not with his Master of Music. Reyne's Simphonie du Marais do the best they can with all this undemanding musical fare, and their performances really can't be faulted. The booklet notes are fairly brief, but informative all the same. No texts are given for the few sung pieces, but that's not a serious worry here. It's all in a nicely compact box, and won't take up much space on your shelves.

The Treaty of Utrecht of 1713 was a key event in European history, bringing what at least was hoped would be an end to two centuries of almost uninterrupted warfare. It was much celebrated at the time, and this disc brings us two excellent works composed for the occasion: one from Handel - the so-called Utrecht Te Deum and Jubilate - and the Ode for the Peace of Utrecht by Handel's contemporary William Croft. Also interesting in Handel's case is the fact that the commission for this work was a significant factor in prompting the great Saxon to settle in London.Handel's energetic two-part work has a youthful vigour ansd spontaneity about it, unlike his much later Dettingen Te Deum which is every bit as fine but more majestic and serene in character. Ithe Utrecht piece is deleivered here by the well-balanced choir and orchestra of the Netherlands Bach Society, directed in great style by Jos van Veldhoven. The instruments form a suitably substantial baroque band; the singing of the choir is excellent, spirited, and in excellent English with no discernible accents; the fine team of soloists are mainly British and do an equally good job. These are superb Handel performances, if anything even more impressive in the shorter Jubilate.The work by Croft, otherwise called by its opening line 'With Noise of Cannons', starts with an arresting and attractive instrumental Overture, and in fact the entire work sounds remarkably Handelian – which cannot be anything other than a great compliment. The title verse doesn't actually include any cannon, of course, but it's a vigorous, warlike piece sung here by bass Peter Harvey on excellent form.The alto aria 'Nor will we ev'n the Martial Trumpet spare', is nicely sung by William Towers, accompanied by fine passages for trumpet of which Handel himself would have been proud.The final chorus, 'Where, Mighty Anna, will thy Glories end' is written to a suitably grovelling text in praise of Queen Anne, but makes a rousing close for all that.Croft's enjoyable piece stands up extremely well in the Saxon's company, and should be of considerable interest to baroque enthusiasts who are unfamiliar with it. The booklet, apart from a few oddities, such as poor titling of some of the tracks and showing the choir singing 'serve the Lord with galdness', has all texts and excellent notes, and there are lovely illustrations in both booklet and CD pack. Recorded sound is first-class, and altogether this is a very fine, enjoyable and enterprising programme.

Composers in the time of the English Civil War had a hard job plying their trade during those  miserable times, and their reputations have never quite recovered as a result. William Lawes, thanks to some very fine recordings, has come a long way towards overcoming that handicap, but Henry Lawes and Christopher Simpson, for example, are little known today compared with their Elizabethan and Jacobean forebears and their Restoration successors. This relative obscurity is entirely undeserved, and the present recording is a beautiful demonstration of this.Simpson's 'Twenty Ayres for Two Trebles and Two Basses' are here recorded for the first time, and their music is absolutely lovely. Arranged into several suites or sequences, each one starts with a solemn, contemplative or melancholy Pavin, followed by other airs and dances which are wistful rather than joyous - that wistful quality perfectly captured here by the players of the Chelys Consort of Viols. The Sarabandes, on the other hand, are more lively in the hands of these players than we might usually expect from the format; so each suite forms a remarkably integrated work. While the 'Ayres' of the disc's title refer to Simpson's publication, the 'Graces' reflect the manner of playing expected for the times, and indeed equally generously present in this performance.The sequences of Ayres are interspersed here with four sets of Divisions, again for viols. Each one of these is a small masterpiece. It's hard to pick out favourites, because there's not a single dull moment here, but I found especially lovely the two division sets on tracks 8 and 9 - captivating music, deeply involving and, again, played by the Consort with soulful depth and unity of feeling.
