The other party seems to hear me just fine as I heard no complaints. Camera's performance is marginal, slow, but produce decent pictures. I used it to shoot pictures of my dish in a restaurant, and they all came out soft. Only outside with brightlight that I got some decent shots. Video is almost always bad, this phone needs very brightlight and can only do a good job in non-fast moving scenes. I shot a lion dance in Chinatown and the video is almost unusable, blurry with bad audio.Touch screen is faily responsive. No worse or better than other inexpensive Android phones, but not at iPhone level. Kit Kat is good to use, you would like it if you are used to Android operating system. I added a 64GB Sandisk MicroSD card and loaded some videos. As a media playback device, it is pretty decent. As I said, this could be your small tablet.But for the price, you can expect too much. Since it can support dual SIMs, it is great for those oversea trip as well. I think it is a good back up to have; but as a primary phone, spend a little more and get a better phone.

As a long time Sonicare user, I can tell you this: Forget this one and buy the Sonicare instead. Your teeth and gums will thank you for the wise choice. About the only interesting thing about this powered toothbrush have is its rotating brushes. But rotating brush head is also its major weakness: It is so underpowered that if you press it a little hard (very little) to your teeth and the thing stops. The tooth brush does not have enough power to keep rotating!With Sonicare, you have quarter-pause and 2-minute timer. Every 30 seconds Sonicare tells you to switch side and your brushing session always last 2 minutes. And the cleanliness you feel after brushing is priceless. The Conair has none of that, or I did not have a complete brushing session to know. I charged the toothbrush full (almost 24 hours and the light turned off to tell me it is full charged) and tried. It only took 15 seconds for me to know that this doesn't work for me and probably never will. I kept having to move the toothbrush aways from my teeth for it to contiue working. This in additional to expensive and tough to find brush head (as I heard) make the Conair not a good buy.3/12/15 UPDATE: I tried it again today to make sure I did not miss any thing. I left it plugged in for longer 24 hrs to ensure the battery is fully charged. Then squeezed a pea size toothpaste on it. Same result! The toothbrush stopped with just a little bit of pressure. It now definitely will be retired to the garage waiting for a trip to Goodwill.

Most extended battery made for iPhone I know aren't going to win any beauty contest anytime soon. They are all bulky and effectively nullify all design work put into the product. Well this one is almost no different. Slap this case on and your beautiful iPhone 6 looks just degrade to ordinary. However, it is the best looking so far, and all the features this battery/case come with almost make up the loss.it is a protective case with battery. Your iPhone speakers are amplified, sounds much better than what on the phone itself. Lightning connection replaced by micro USB, I am sure, like me, you have 10 of those just laying around. No panic if you forget your cable at home. Power button in the back, and can tell how much juice remains in the battery. Nice curvatures to hold the phone, even it is a bit heavier.So, this is something nice to throw into the luggage on a trip in case you need more talk time. Others report a solid 3 hrs increase in talk time, I have not yet to try it. First impression is good and expect it is a good product too.

This could be a very nice and interesting case for the iPhone 6 plus. Nice red color, interesting design surely a good conversation piece. Semi-soft rubber fit the phone nicely, texture on the sides guarantees you won't drop it accidentally, but easy to pull out of pocket. All buttons and ports are on the right place, I have no trouble operating the phone at all.Overall, it is a good case, except that it appears the design is glued to back of the case, not part of the case like I thought. The backing does not have a perfect glue job either, one small corner by the camera port seems to peel up (see picture). I don't know how long this will stay on.I had to pay for shipping as this is not a Prime item. Shipping it back is too much troubles so I keep it, but not totally happy with the case.

Great Canon Case, Amazing Price -Works withCompatible with the Powershots:PowerShot A400PowerShot S100PowerShot S110PowerShot S200PowerShot S230PowerShot S300PowerShot S400PowerShot S410PowerShot S500PowerShot SD100PowerShot SD1000PowerShot SD110PowerShot SD1100 ISPowerShot SD430PowerShot SD500PowerShot SD550PowerShot SD630PowerShot SD700 ISPowerShot SD750PowerShot SD770 ISPowerShot SD790 ISPowerShot SD800 ISPowerShot SD850 ISPowerShot SD870 ISPowerShot SD890 ISPowerShot SD900PowerShot SD950 ISWorks with most elphs and for many different "newer" canon models too.

Bought these (in King size) a few weeks back, but couldn't write a review until they were used, washed, and put on again. They were silly-smooth when first put on and are just as smooth after washing. I would agree with the manufacturer that these are as smooth as 1500-count cotton sheets at a fraction of the price. That said, you can feel that may not be as long-lasting as cotton sheets would (but at this price, who cares?), and I recommend that they be washed under the gentle cycle in your washer (warm water) with a cold rinse.After the first wash, I found that they were colorfast and, being polyester, were also wrinkle-free. I didn't notice any shrinkage after washing when they were put on the bed. I bought these in the Rust color, and they look great and absolutely "Pop" on the bed. At $25 per set, I figure I an buy another 3 or 4 and still keep total cost well under the cost for a single set of comparable cotton sheets.

Love this scoop! After years of using anemic plastic scoops that twist, bend and break sooner than later, I've found a scoop that will survive our three cats & two litter boxes. Now that we use the new ground "corn-cob" style of litter, we don't get the mini-cement litter clumps that are somewhat common with clay litter, but this would be excellent at loosening and removing these.I sides of the scoop are high enough that when you shuffle the scoop to strain the litter (and that which it carries) that the "stuff" doesn't end up on the floor all around the litter box. It is also VERY easy to rinse clean as the litter doesn't cling as it does to plastic scoops (especially when well used). I have read some reviews that mentioned that the foam-type handle begins to peel off after a time; should that happen, I have duct tape. I've already ordered another for the second litter box.

I bought 2 six-packs of these, one for just plain use in the dryer and another for use with an essential oil (I chose orange). Previous to these, my wife had bought some plastic dryer balls. They came in a two-pack, were very noisy in the dryer and, being very light in weight, were pretty much useless. We stopped using them after 2 dryer loads as we saw no benefit other than the noise.We've been using these for a couple of weeks and are very happy with the results. For large loads, we use all six balls and only four for medium loads (both our washer & dryer accommodate larger-than-normal loads). Here is what we have learned:1.  Our dryer loads DO complete in less time (estimate, about 10% quicker). This translates, over time, to a savings in electricity (we are at $0.14/hr) that will far exceed the cost of the balls.2.  Items like cotton dress shirts come out with so many less wrinkles that one could wear them without ironing (I iron them anyway because I'm a bit OCD in that regard).3.  The wool balls are very quiet in the dryer and are, in fact, hardly noticeable, especially when compared to the very noisy plastic softener balls we were using.4.  When used with just a few drops of the essential oil of your choice, the entire load will be infused with a light scent of that oil.NOTE: I recommend using two distinct sets of wool balls if you choose to use a fragrance and to keep the sets separate. Once the wool balls have been scented, they do not give up that scent easily or quickly. Use the one for non-scented laundry (outerwear?) and the other for scented laundry (underwear?). Enjoy the features of guilt-free fabric softening and the pleasures of the same, but scented. Highly Recommended!

Although I've been cooking for some 50-years, I've never used (or thought I needed) a spatula designed specifically for fish, although I have always been aware of them. I bought the Dynamic Chef fish spatula while it was offered as an Amazon Deal, and I'm very happy I did!The curved design of the spatula makes not only fish easier to lift or turn in the pan, but it works just as well for chicken parmesan (gotta brown those breaded fillets before you do anything else), eggplant, or any other delicate item you might saute. This is a true Chef's tool that fits well and feels good in the hand. The rough-textured plastic handle makes the home cook feel confident that, even if greasy, it won't slip from your grasp.It is light in weight and the balance is just perfect. It's a pleasure to use, works well and is Highly Recommended!

I have always used the traditional stainless steels whisks. I've had them decades and they have served me well. Recently I bought a couple of non-stick fry pans for eggs and the like, so I decided that, to be safe, I should buy a non-scratch whisk. Enter the Slippery Kitchen Silicone Whisk. It is perfect for my needs (eggs, small-batch light mixes, etc.). It's shortness (about 10" overall) and stainless-steel handle provides excellent control without wrist strain (at 64 and arthritic, this is an issue). I find this size perfect as anything that requires a very stiff whisk will be mixed first in a stainless steel bowl, so no worries.I really like the fact that the whisk is easily cleaned with just a quick hot water rinse (even when coated with a brown sugar-molasses mix). The flexibility of the whisk keeps this from being useful for any but light batters (pancakes, for instance), but for most types of sauces or eggs, it is fantastic! I now use it mixing liquids in my ceramic coated dutch ovens, as my stainless steel whisks left scratch marks that, over time, may have worn away some of the ceramic coating.A well constructed kitchen tool that is worth its price. Highly Recommended!

I bought these for my wife who is a Speech Pathologist. She works mostly with people who have suffered some type of brain trauma (accident, stroke, etc.), or are suffering from Dementia or Alzheimer disease. Many of these people have swallow difficulties, so my wife often needs to do an inspection of their mouths and upper pharynx (back of the throat) to rule out any physical, non-motor reasons for swallow problems. In the past she used a small LED Penlight. While this provided sufficient light, it was a bit large and patients often had to open their mouths more than was comfortable for them.She has been using these for a couple of weeks now, and she is very pleased. The yellow light is not an issue for her and she finds them light in weight and easy to use. She is particularly happy that her patients need only open their mouths slightly for her to light the oral cavity to see what she needs to see. They are very convenient for her as she can just clip them to her pocket. The smooth metal construction lets her disinfect them (with alcohol swabs) quickly and easily to maintain good sanitation.Highly Recommended!

I can't add much to the prior reviews except to say that (to this 64 year-old) George Ezra is an old soul in a young body. His insight in his lyrics and his uncanny timing in his music make him stand out from the messy crowd of new artists that, in reality, generally have nothing to offer. Ezra seems to be the Real-Deal and, if he continues to write as he does, will be  one of the best, a la Ed Sheeran.

After about 40 years, I have re-engaged with modeling. These type & style paints were not available to me when I did modeling in the 60's (oh God, was it that long ago ...?), so I am entirely impressed by the scope, breadth and quality of these acrylic paints. My son clued me into diluting them slightly with some water, and they work incredibly well on the (primed) plastic WW II models I'm doing.My first two models were a PT Boat and a WW II fighter plane. Just a few areas (on the boat, mostly) needed a "metallic" touch to make them stand out from the usual drab-color total painting. Great overall effect for me. I doubt I'll ever use another paint than Vallejo.

NOTE: I did not by this through Amazon (although I am a Prime member) solely because it was needed STAT. Had I done so, I would have saved money (as usual).My wife was recently in a car accident and the air-bag deployed which, although it kept her from any real damage, it caused a painful bruise on her sternum. I went to out local "chain" drugstore and bought this for her. Two minutes in the microwave later, she had instant relief.The wrap is very well constructed and has two handles that allow you to handle the heated product without dealing with the heat of the wrap right out of the microwave. Although my wife originally used this for her chest bruise that eventually resolved itself, she also had used it to relieve neck tension (to help avoid migraines). I, too, have used it on my knees for arthritis relief. It's a bit large for other joints (wrist & elbow), so I have just ordered the smaller size for joint use.The heat pack gives immediate relief (dry packs take a while), and you can feel it penetrate as soon as you put it on. Maybe it's my imagination, but I swear I get a "deeper" relief with this than a dry-pack type of heat wrap. As a Cold Pack, although it works well, it doesn't last near as long as the CryoMax cold pack (http://smile.amazon.com/Cryo-Max-Reusable-Medium-1-Count-Boxes/dp/B001QFZL1Q/ref=sr_1_1?s=hpc&ie=UTF8&qid=1444781408&sr=1-1&keywords=8+hour+cold+pack) that is designed for cold therapy alone.All-in-all, both my wife and I believe this to be a great product that will likely last for many years.

I purchased this item on an Amazon “Today’s Deal” offering, even though I had recently bought (again, through Amazon) the Photive HYDRA Bleutooth speaker (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00K589F8A?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_detailpage_o08_s00). I’m glad I didn’t give the HYDRA a top rating as this speaker is far superior in a number of ways. Let’s count them, shall we …PROS:1.  More compact & lighter weight2.  Significantly louder without distortion3.  Better frequency response, especially in the base range (rated at 68Hz vs. the estimated 200Hz for the Photive HYDRA)4.  Volume control for wired input devices (the HYDRA volume does not control output from input devices thru RCA connections)5.  SD card slot: accommodates up to a 32GB micro SD card, eliminating the need for external input devices)6.  The Arespark has a much longer battery life (14 hrs. vs. 8 hrs. [at medium volume] as stated by the respective manufacturers.)7.  Arespark has a convenient but unobtrusive battery level indicator.8.  Has a "Selfie" button for use with iPhones (not somethingI use myself)9.  Carabiner-like attachment clip (carry it with you “hands-free” while it plays) is very convenient.10. Weather-proof cover for inputs firmly attached: HYDRA has cover that can be easily lost as stated in my original review.CONS:1.  Relatively short USB charger cable (but most of us have others that are longer)2.  Short “device” input cable (again, as above)All-in-all the Arespark is far superior to the Photive HYDRA.  It has a better frequency response and is louder (without distortion) that the HYDRA, and at the same price or less. I had my HYDRA for about 3 weeks, but donated it to Goodwill after getting the Arespark. I couldn't be happier as it suits my needs and then some.

I bought this a while ago and have been waiting for the company to make it right ever since. Maybe I got a bad batch. Maybe I suddenly couldn't do with this product what I had done before a others. Maybe the God's conspired against. Nevertheless, this company (who offers a LIFETIME warranty on this product) eventually just ignored me when I would not work for me.Now before I continue, let me say that I still have the exchanged emails & the requested photos (proof) that I sent to them, which included a copy of my original purchase invoice from Amazon.I ordered these for the new Moto E (1st Gen) that I had just gotten to use with my Tr*****e account. Including phones for my wife & my son, I had installed this type of product 6 times before. Frankly, I thought this would take care of all our phones. Much to my chagrin, my first attempt at installing this on my phone (in a closed bathroom a recommended), I couldn't get the first shield to adhere without scores of bubbles that I could not press out. So, too, the second and third films. Bubbles + bubbles that I could not get rid of.But it's under warranty, right? So I contact the company. I don't complain; I only tell them what happened. Maybe I'm doing something wrong that I not seeing. Please advise, I ask. A few days later, I get an email asking me not to give a bad review. Please give them an opportunity to resolve the situation and would I please send pictures. I send pictures of the three failed results.  A few days after that, I get an email saying they got the pictures, can I send my original invoice. I send them a copy of my Amazon invoice for the product. After that, I wait. And I wait some more. Then I just forget about it & order a flexible glass protectors that installed flawlessly on each of the first tries.It's been almost 4 months since the original purchase and I just again today thought of it. I could leave it be, or write the review. I HAD to write the review. If you have a company that offers a warranty, you should abide by that warranty, even for a $7 product! They can do nothing for me now as I already have screen protectors for all three phones.I never asked them to replace the product. I only asked them to advise me (as I may have been doing something wrong). Instead they choose to, ultimately, ignore me.

Needed outlet expansion with moderate surge protection for my wife's home work desk with ability to safely recharge her work laptop. This was perfect. Easily installed into what was a double wall outlet using the integrated machine screw to attach it to where the wall plate screw went. Does not accommodate the large, clunker transformer/chargers, but does easily accept todays more narrow chargers.Once attached, the outlet tells you if your outlet is A O-K (green LED light) or has a fault (red LED light). In that case, better call an electrician as there is a short somewhere along the line. It provides a basic protection for your attached electronics (such as a re-charging item), but it doesn't provide the higher level of protection one would want for a wall-powered computer. For that, an APC battery back-up/surge protector would make more sense.Very happy with this outlet, but would have been happier, still, if the outlets were tilted out at a slight angle (20 degrees or so) for easier access. Not considered a flaw since I knew going in that they weren't.

The photo for this hat makes it look very much like leather, unless to enlarge the picture to easily see that it's cotton. Nevertheless, the two brown hats I received didn't look weathered at all, but they still looked great. They have a great patina that I'm certain will fade or time and use in the sun which will only make them look better.OK. Enough about the looks. Here's the real scoop:1.  The construction of this hat is second to one other that I have ever had. It is sturdy, perfectly proportioned, easily adjusted and has a substantial sweatband inside (i.e., it really will absorb sweat).2.  It is made in China, but with premium materials and cotton that has a heavy, rich feel to it. On the outside, the hat almost feels like suede.3.  The stitching is perfect. I couldn't find a single flaw or stray thread.4.  The fit is generous and deep. I wear a 7 3/8 hat size, and this fit me with a full 3/4" of exposed velcro in the band to make it smaller.  The hat itself it very deep (tall) so it may sink down on smaller heads, so keep that in mind. I don't know how well this would fit children or smaller women (my wife is 5'4" and it looked a bit "top-heavy" on her. I gave hers to my son.5.  A nice distressed leather look can be easily obtained with some light swipes with fine (400 grit) sandpaper in a few spots. Go very lightly a bit at a time, brush off between swipes, and avoid damaging any stitching. Gives a very nice effect.All-in-all, I have to say I've never bought a better, sturdier bill cap at any price. I believe you'll love the fit and feel.

My wife has suffered from severe migraines since she was a teenager, and I mean commode-hugging migraines. For at least 4-days each month, she was totally incapacitated. When she was in her early 30's, her doctor managed to get her into the clinical trial study for Imitex, an injectable medication that alleviated her headaches almost instantly after they occurred. Since then, many other medications have come out for migraine relief, but most of them are taken orally. They do her no good because by the time the migraine sets in, she begins to vomit, so oral meds never get absorbed. This leaves only the injectable. But this medication is incredibly expensive, even with insurance that pays for only some of her need. When we pay cash, it costs $55-70 per shot!She has tried many prescribed treatments to lower the frequency of her migraines, but none have been terribly effective. Recently, we read about Butterbur Extract for the prevention of migraines. It takes a month or so for any effect to be noticed. She's been taking this for about 50 days, and has begun to see a marked reduction of migraine onset. Because insurance requires it for her to get regular coverage for her injectable, she keeps a log of headache onsets. So far she has logged about 20% less than she did before she started this extract. She feels it is working (and who am I to argue?).Not every medication or herbal supplement works for every individual, but this has worked very well for my wife. Considering the inexpensive cost of Butterbur, we can't see why anyone suffering from migraines would not try it. If you do, buy a 3-month supply, as it takes at least 30-days for you to begin to see results.

After a VERY long hiatus (I'm in my mid-60's), I decided to start modeling again. For my plastic models, I chose a couple of WW II models that require some metallic colors. Now all I knew and used back in the day were oil-based paints and thinners. Primers were not a concern. Fortunately, my son does modeling for role-playing games and educated my on asking the parts before applying primer, all to give the acrylic paints (new to me, also) good adhesion and prevent flaking/chipping later on down the line.He recommended this brand of primer, so I bought it in basic light grey as a neutral base for the various colors I'd be using. Now I've used spray primers before, but always in home project applications, but I wasn't ready for what the Tamiya primer provided: the finest mist that I've ever seen come out of a spray can other than hair spray. It lands like dust on the plastic and covers in just a couple of coats. It dries quickly and allows me to paint without streaking or running with slightly thinned acrylic paints. Wish we had this stuff when modeling 50 years ago.

I use this mostly outside with my iPod so I don't need earphones while working in the garden, sitting out with my wife, etc. For what I paid for it (under $40) , I'm happy. I don't use the Bluetooth function at all. I bought this for its water-resistant claim, which seems to be true as I recently left it outside at night by mistake. We had one helluva thunderstorm that night, but the speaker worked just fine the following day.I really like the rubberized exterior that encases the entire unit except for the speaker grill which, itself, is very sturdy and not likely to be easily damaged. It has a nice grippy feel and won't be prone to slipping from one's hand. I've twice had it drop to the ground (through my own stupidity) from heights of about 3 to 4 feet. Neither drop damaged the speaker as far as I can tell. Nevertheless, I have ordered a padded carrier for the Photive HYDRA Speaker (http://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B0127P8TBW?redirect=true&ref_=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_13). I expect that with reasonable care this piece of electronics will last for many years.A few observations that, were it more expensive, would have brought the rating down to four stars:1.  The speaker does not get terribly loud, but it is fine for indoor use or outside at a limited distance (at top volume, it is at a comfortable listening level 50 to 60 feet directly in front of the speaker or about 30 feet off the the sides or behind the unit.2.  It has very poor Base response. It is fine for certain music types (Folk, Country, etc.) but if you like, say, Classical music, you will be very disappointed. I don't know that actual frequency response for the Photive HYDRA, but as a trained Audiologist and Acoustician, I would be surprised if it went much lower than 125 Hz or much higher than 16,000 Hz. Most stationary speakers will deliver a range from 20 Hz to 20,000 Hz. If you are a Classical music lover, look elsewhere for a portable speaker.3.  When using the auxiliary input the speaker's volume control does not work. Volume is dictated by the limits of the input device. The speaker's impedance must be much higher than earbuds as my iPod, when set at top output level, gets no where near as loud as it can with earbuds. If you connect a CD player through line-output (as you should) the volume may be quite loud but cannot be controlled. Connect thru' "earphone" output to have any control whatsoever. PROBLEM: Earphone output it so low as to be almost unhearable.4.  The rubber end-cap that protects the exposed inputs and the on/off switch is not well secured. It has a rubber "nub" that slips into a rubber hole to keep it attached by a less-than-one-inch rubber "cord". The end cap attachment is easily knocked out of its attachment hole, and the entire protective cap can be easily lost.All in all, I'm glad I bought this and it will travel with my wife and I (with an iPod) where ever we travel. (I'll never  try using a CD player direct, though). The speaker is compact, light, easy and quick to charge, and provides decent fidelity at all volume levels.

Each wrap is about 8-inches long to cinch up several cables into a neat bundle. The cool thing is that you can combine the wraps so that two or more can contain really large cable bundles. The pack of 100 will do me well to the end of my days, as they are reusable. I can't think of any reason NOT to buy these.

My wife bought us two of these in a local sports shop. Just makes me love her all the more ...  The tumbler holds a true 16 oz., and the double wall construction protects you from very hot liquids but, more importantly, keeps cold liquids cold without the outside of the tumbler sweating in warm air. The graphics are crisp and clean, but hand washing is recommended to keep them that way.This a is "Made in America product (how many of these do you find?) that comes with a Lifetime Guarantee. How can you beat that?

Although my wife bought this for me in a retail shop, my reviews on Amazon are always true and fair. This Tervis tumbler is just great. It holds a full pint and will keep it cold or hot for a good long while. I really love the fact that the double wall construction keeps cold liquids (even with ice in them) cold without sweating on the outside.The tight fitting lid is a no-spill deal where to drink you must slide the release back. If not, even if you should drop the tumbler, the contents will not come out; useful whether in the car or in the stands. It has a hole for straw access if you are so inclined. This a is "Made in America product (how many of these do you find?) that comes with a Lifetime Guarantee. How can you beat that?

Although my wife bought this for me in a retail shop, my reviews on Amazon are always true and fair. This Tervis tumbler is just great. It holds and incredible pint & a half and will keep that cold or hot for a good long while. I really love the fact that the double wall construction keeps cold liquids (even with ice in them) cold without sweating on the outside.The tight fitting lid is a no-spill deal where to drink you must slide the release back. If not, even if you should drop the tumbler, the contents will not come out; useful whether in the car or in the stands. This a is "Made in America product (how many of these do you find?) that comes with a Lifetime Guarantee. How can you beat that?

I love this protective case. I keep my phone in the ruler pocket on carpenter pants, or in a leather belt case; from either, this case still leaves the phone easy to quickly extract when I have a call. Other, heavily rubberized cases restrict easy access. While I doubt this case would protect from falls from hand height (at elast not many falls), it works for me. Easy to install, it fits very well and is very reasonable priced. Highly recommended!

Frankly, as good an artist as Darrell Scott is, I wasn't certain how I would receive this CD. I love Ben's work so much, I was worried that I might be disappointed. Then I listened to the first cut ("The One I'm Still Thinking About") and I was surprised that it brought tears to my eyes. Ben left us with a legacy of just over fifty songs, and there can be no better legacy to leave behind than one's own music. Darrell records about a fifth of that legacy and in so doing, has added to his own.Those not familiar with the late Ben Bullington and want to experience a fair spectrum of his insight, style and grace in the way he wrote songs, this album could be considered a "Best Of", and you would do no wrong in buying it. Those of you who do know Ben's work, you owe it to yourself to hear Ben's songs done in the spirit of his writing but with Darrell's own, expert twist put on music and phrasing. Darrell Scott, you have done right by Mr. Bullington!

Upgraded from an LG L840 which, altho' supposedly a "Smart Phone", was not. This is everything I expect from a Smart Phone. Easy web access, fast downloads, and full access to apps. The screen provides crisp & clear pictures. Love this phone so much that I bought one for my son. Highly recommended!

I bought this for my wife to supplement another Beanie Babie she asked me to get. Both of us thought this would be much smaller than it is, but how can any Beanie Boo or Babie be anything less than 5 stars?

This laundry bag measures 9" x9" x 20" tall, smaller than the typical folding basket that measures 13" x 13" x 19" that I have previously bought elsewhere for $5.00. Still, it is large enough for fit a full standard load of light to medium weight laundry (not heavy towels or jeans). I bought 4 bags. The first one I loaded with whites had both handles break at one of the two connection points immediately, so it has to be carried in the arms rather than by the handles. The second did not break under the same load, but it is obvious from the flimsy construction that it soon will. I didn't check the other two bags since I assume they are no better.It seems obvious to me that quality is not something this company values, nor is providing good value for your dollar. These belong in a dollar store and nowhere else.

My wife loves this Ty Baby to death. She bought it for a patient & now wants one for herself. (I have to admit, it IS cute.). She especially likes that the outer eye coloring compliments the pink flower on the head. Recommended for any collector of Beanie Babies or Monkey-doll collectors.

I agree with other reviewers that this album is the best since "Too Long In The Wasteland", his first. I'll even say that it is his best album to date. As a story teller, no one comes close besides the late Ben Bullington (notably, “Ben Bullington” and “White Sulfur Springs”). Some may compare Mr. McMurtry to the ubiquitous Bob Dylan, but McMurtry writes of only real life; if not life lived by himself, then life that is carefully observed and empathized with until a true story emerges. McMurtry is also one of the very few artists who regularly make a socio-political statement in their recordings (Steve Earle is another), perhaps part of the reason he doesn’t get more airplay or TV time.I’m glad that he decided to go mostly acoustic with this album as it has been how I have seen him in various small venues (Does he play any others? He sure deserves to.)  Mr. McMurtry’s guitar playing prowess is often concealed on his records, but on “Complicated Game” he shines, and you know it. The production and engineering are exceptional as is the musicianship of everyone involved. Truly, this is one of the 10 Best albums of 2014 in this genre. (It has been listed as Folk, Country & Rock. I choose to consider it Folk-Rock that has lately seen a resurgence since it’s almost-demise in the early 70’s).Hope you enjoy this album. Highly recommended!

Truth is, we're getting older and I wanted our "Last Fan". We try to use fans rather than our A/C for obvious reasons, but our living room fan has always really interfered with hearing dialog clearly when the fan was set on anything higher than Low. I was intrigued by the "silent" aspect of the fan, so I thought I'd roll the dice. I rolled a "7", and 7's a winner!I won't even compare this to the noise level of the comparable Vortex stand fan; it would be unfair (We had one that died this year after only 7 years of use ... second Vortex to do just that). On low setting, this fan cannot even be heard running, as the ambient room noise is louder; on Medium setting you can hear a very slight "sssshh" sound that is totally unobtrusive while watching TV (without use of sound bar or surround sound);' on high it becomes only slightly noticeable, but still doesn't distract; the "Turbo" setting is the 4th speed, and altho' louder, still doesn't make TV dialog harder to hear.As an acoustics expert, I can say that the reason for all this is the very shallow curve of the blades which are also thinner than the usual fan blade. Whereas most fans produce a "hiissss" sound (that REALLY interferes with hearing speech well), this fan produces a much lower frequency sound ("ssshh") that doesn't interfere as much with speech intelligibility, so hearing dialog is not interfered with very much. As well, the level of noise it produces is MUCH lower (by my measurement, about 20 Db) than the typical fan of the same size.It is easy to put together, has a much more stable base than did (does) our Vortex fan (of early demise). As well, the heavy base has four rubber-tipped feet to help prevent marring of smooth floors. Removal of the metal "screens" is easy for quick cleaning of both fan cage AND blades. The remote is very responsive and can control everything other than the tilt of the fan and oscillate function.Construction of the fan is substantial, and I can't see how it wouldn't last close to a lifetime. As I have had 2 of my 3 Vortex fans die on me within 3-7 years, I will be buying a 12" Rowenta for our bedroom. At this price (comparable to the "Vortex"), I will trust that an improved, but traditional design fan will serve me as well (and better, sound-wise) as any Vortex-type fan while lasting longer. Highly Recommended!

After we bought a new couch & love seat, I decided to protect them from dirt & spills that pretty much ruined our previous living room seating. I've been around for a while, so I knew that I would need more than what was recommended. That said, we got four 2-packs. Although we didn't need that much for a single treatment, I knew that I wanted a second treatment on the most vulnerable areas.Using this indoors is best done in spring or early fall when windows can be opened to dissipate the fumes and odor of the spray. Open windows also help accelerate drying time.I double-treated the armrests and seating cushions as I planned and still had two full cans left over (NOTE: Our loveseat is smaller than most at 5 1/2' in width. We have cats, so as soon as I realized fur removal was easier on the treated areas, I used most of the remaining two cans to treat the back cushions, as well.Spills bead up for a while on treated areas, giving you enough time to blot things up before they stain (I used plain water to test this). As I mentioned, if you have pets, this Scotchgard product will make vacuuming up fur easier & more complete than without it. All-in-all, highly recommended!

Bought these to replace similar worn-out items from another manufacturer after 7 years. I loved the look of these & really looked forward to using them. Unfortunately, although I bought the right size for us, I had to return them as they didn't fit our EEE width feet; Seemed like they would slip right over the edges of our shoes when in use. Returned them & bought the "Trax" we had previously used w/o issue.

Second pair of these for my son & myself. We're both shoe size 13-EEE and we find the large size fits well. For larger shoe sizes, I'd probably go with the X-Large size. Our first pairs lasted 6-7 years of dog walking and mailbox trips. They likely would have lasted longer except for the fact that a lot of the dog walking put us on plow-cleared blacktop road. Highly recommended!

I love my new HP Envy 7645 printer and, of course, this ink works perfectly in it. It was nice to have the bonus photo paper with it. I have only used 4x6 photo paper before, so the 5x7 was nice to try out. Very happy with the results. I have replaced my color cartridge once (been printing a lot of photos) and, as of this writing, I have 70% ink level in my color cartridge and about 35% in the B&W cartridge. I've printed 121 total pages and 31 borderless photos (mostly 4x6). I now this because the printer keeps track of what is printed.

I did not buy this printer through Amazon (although I would have saved $10 had I done so), but rather through a local warehouse club. I was dubious about my purchase based on all the poor reviews; however as all but two of the reviews were not "verified purchases", I did not lend them too much credence.  I know my review is not a "verified purchase" either, but I am a frequent Amazon purchaser & a regular reviewer who prides himself on accurate & fair reviews.I am using this printer on a Mac running 10.10.3. I bought it to replace my HP J5750 "All-In-One" that suddenly decided not to print in black. As well, my old printer shook my entire computer desk while it printed, and it never printed photos worth saving. The HP 7645 prints both B&W and Color on standard paper in less than half the time and doesn't shake my desk at all. Further, it prints 4x6 and 5x7 photos quickly and beautifully on HP & Kodak glossy photo paper; every bit as good as drug store prints. The quality of B&W printing is every bit as good as a laser, crisp and very detailed, so I don't understand those reviewers who claim otherwise. As an ink jet printer it is, of course, noisier than a laser, but not so noisy as to distract.I tried the printer first using the USB connector with excellent results. I then (and since) used it via the wireless connection which has worked flawlessly. Other users didn't mention their operating systems, so perhaps they were using one which had problems recognizing the printer, but my Mac had no issues. Print response was just  as quick as if the printer was connected via a cable.All-in-all, I highly recommend this printer for any Mac user.UPDATE: 04/17/15Had an issue where the auto-document feeder wasn't working properly. Went to HP Support and did a "Chat" with a tech-person. Issue resolved quickly and easily. I found my tech-guy informed and cordial. 20-seconds to connect, 5-minutes to fix. I'm a happy camper ...

I won this on a “Bidding Site”, so I lucked out and ended up paying less than two dollars for this tablet. I’ve never had a product likes this before, so I have no means of comparison to similar products costing 3 to 4 times the price of the ZeePad. Not having used any “Pad” but this one, I can still see why one would want to spend more for a brand-name, more expensive product.I haven’t explored everything yet, just the features that I would use most frequently. I’m a big Netflix user, and I had no trouble logging in to the service from the pad, and I watched several episodes of the 6-episode Vietnam series. I watched two 45-minute episodes with the battery level down to only 78%. From there, no matter the function I was in, the battery power dropped precipitously. It almost seemed as though the power was operating on a logarithmic function where the power draw was 10x greater than the draw before it. It declined rapidly from (10 mins.) from 78% power to under 60% power. Shortly thereafter (at about 40%), the tablet just shut down completely.While I watched Netflix, the stream was steady & uninterrupted and the picture was very good. I watched some episodes of another series on Netflix (with the power cord plugged in), also with very good results.I was unable to listen to music from my Amazon Prime account or from any online streams of a radio shows connected via websites, although I had no problem listening to Pandora, once the app was installed.I can shop, I can do email & Facebook, but there are many things I cannot do because of the limitations of this tablet. If you are content with very basic apps AND you don’t mind using the tablet while plugged into its power supply (which I now do because of logarithmic discharge of the battery), then you are good to go to buy this $40 tablet. Just don’t expect anything more than a $40 tablet.What is a $40 tablet? The screen can be seen only when “face-on”; the battery life is relatively short & unreliable; some applications wont run (e.g., Amazon Prime music); the speaker is mono and very “tinny” (better listened to using headphones); navigation is difficult, and certain things (like deleting an item) are hard to do.All-in-all this is a good deal for someone who just wants to watch shows on-line, do some basic email/Facebook stuff, and listen to Pandora while doing other things. Remember: you get what you pay for.

I wear a 13-EEE in a shoe, but I bought these knowing that the “D” width would be narrow for me, but I figured that they would stretch out over time. It’s been about 3 months now, and the width seems fine; they have “molded” to fit my feet. The same cannot be said of the length. The size 13 I bought was tighter than I thought it would be. If they were shoes, I would have returned them, but as slippers that will be worn just a couple of hours/day (at most), I kept them. I would have to say that these run a bit small and should be purchased one-size larger than your usual show size.The sheepskin lining is great. Smooth and comfortable from the start, the thick lining quickly conformed to the shape of my foot. As advertised, your bare feet will not get sweaty in thises slippers, and for that I’m grateful.The soles are thick enough to be worm outdoors (to get the mail, paper, etc.) without feeling the pebbles of our gravel driveway. I have worn them, as well, while driving; very comfortable.Although they are made in China (hard, these days, to find something that is not) they are well constructed and feel like they will last a number of years. I look forward to slipping into these each day when I come home from work, and I wear them around the house on my days off. All-in-all, I’m very happy.

I gave this to my wife as one of her Christmas presents, and I could see the disappointment in her face when she opened it. If she had a cartoon caption box over her head it would have read, “Oh, great, a callus remover; how about a whole body massage?” Then she used it and it was love at first try.This grooming tool is just great. She had more callus on her feet than skin, but she loathed the feel and sound of the usual manual callus scrapers that I have always used. A couple of months have passed, and her feet are free from dead skin and she is finally pain-free wearing shoes. It took a while, but now she only does maintenance to keep her feet “comfy”. I have used it, as well, and it works fast & does a great job of keeping my own feet in tip-top shape.It uses four “AA” batteries, but rechargeables are not recommended by the maker; I tried them, but the buffer speed was lower, so we stick with alkaline batteries. If you have bad feet to start with, you will go through a lot a power cells until you get into the “maintain” mode: it EATS batteries with constant use.All-in-all, we could not be happier with the performance of the Amope. Highly recommended!

If you have a washer that empties into a sump pump, you should be using a lint trap. You'd be amazed at how much lint & hair, etc., your washer spews into your sump, even if you don't have pets. If you DO have pets, a lint trap is indispensable. Lint will cling to the input & output port of your sump pump. Over time, this build-up causes a blockage that will stop your pump from working & require a replacement. It's cheaper & smarter to use lint traps. With one of these in place, whatever gets past will also pass through your sump pump without causing any damage or build-up.Now for the product review. These are usually sold in 2-packs at many types of retail store, usually for anywhere from a dollar to two-fifty. Like these, most come with a zip-tie for each trap. At half the price of what you will pay in a retail store, these lint traps are a bargain. They are shorter than the 9" length the product description claims (try 7" when fully extended to USEABLE length). Unlike store-bought brands that are stitched on the bottom, these have a metal "crimp" to close off the bottom, and this shortens the "real" length. If you use any of this type of lint trap correctly, you don't let them get more than half full, so the length doesn't matter that much, really.Even though they may need to be replaced more frequently than store brands, they are still more economical by 50 percent or more and translate into a great savings. They work as well as any other I've ever used. Highly recommended.

This is the first Sangean radio I've bought, but it won't be the last. Except for a "boom-box" era relic, every radio I have is AC powered, so I thought it would a good idea to have something basic that I could rely on during power outages. Then I realized that this would also be something good to have while camping, backpacking or even in the car on long trips. It is, after all, an EMERGENCY RADIO! This review will not include information already in the Amazon product description.The construction is very substantial. It's made with the same plastic material used in the making of various construction-site things that  "take a licking but keep on ticking". The radio is protected from "drop" damage by thick, screwed on, rubberized protective caps. One rubberized end has a flap that gives access to/protects the connections for headphones (the use of which mute the speaker), USB power-in and USB power-out. Now, DO realize that this is a basic AM/FM radio with a Weather Band and an Emergency Weather Alert setting. You cannot play your iPod or iPhone through it as it has no external input. You CAN, however, charge either of these items from the radio itself. The quality, design and construction of this radio is absolutely excellent. Instructions for use are straightforward and easy to understand.Although it weighs only about 14 ounces (with the included Lithium-Ion battery), it feels much more substantial. It is conveniently small (3.5"H x 2.5"D x 6.0"L) with a retractable antenna for both FM and Weather bands. There are 7 Weather band stations, but expect to get only 1 or 2 local stations to come in; frankly, that's all that will be available in any particular area. In times of potentially bad weather (e.g., the risk of tornado), the radio has a "Weather Alert" setting that, if a local/national weather alert is issued, will give you an "alarm" that will be followed by the actual alert; a near-essential feature here in the Midwest, but also useful in other areas of the country (again, when camping, hiking or in the car, this can be a life-saving feature).The sound from the mono speaker is very good. Although the radio has no tone controls, they're not needed. There is an excellent balance of tone, not too much bass or treble; very easy to listen to. FM reception is very good. I don't listen to AM often, but I tried several stations to see how well the radio did. It passed with flying colors. The radio has a ferrite antenna for AM reception, so the telescopic antenna isn't needed. The stations I listened to all came in quite clear and without the AM static I grew up with. I'm about 20 miles north of Milwaukee and I was still able to get a Chicago station, loud and clear: impressive.The incremental volume control goes from "0" to "30". A good listening level, for me, is between "14" (in a quiet situation) to "24" (in a noisy environment). With the volume at the max of "30", very slight distortion was evident in the most-used FM band. Because the AM band has less fidelity, it can be "cranked" to the highest volume level without regard to any kind of distortion. Likewise the Weather band (the fidelity of which sucks, anyway).Sangean claims the battery will provide about 10 hours of power with the radio in AM mode. In FM mode (at a moderate sound setting of 20), it gave me over that much time before the charge light told me it needed recharging. Pretty decent since it can be fully recharged in about 2-hours with a USB input (I use a direct AC to USB charger. It may take slightly longer with a PC-based USB power connection).When in the off position, the radio displays the current time. Once turned on, you can select stations with "band select" followed by manual tuning , or you can select up to 19 presets (AM & FM combined) which are easily programmed. In warmer, sunnier times the radio is automatically run or charged by direct sunlight by way of a large solar panel on the top of the radio (15 hours of direct sunlight = full charge). In a "worse case" scenario, you can run the radio using the folding & included "Dynamo" crank handle. The Dynamo provides 5-7 minutes of use for every minute of cranking at about 120 cranks/minute; not ideal, but useful in dire situations.Finally, the radio also has an LED light that provides (my estimates) a steady "high" brightness of about 15 lumens, a low night-lite level of about 2 lumens. It also provides a steady pulse light (on high only) of about 1/second and a standard SOS signal at the same brightness level. In keeping with the emergency theme, the radio`has an "Emergency Alert" button that produces a piercing, pulsing sound for purposes of location.On the overall, I can't think of anything else I would want in an emergency radio The sound is good enough that I will be using this in my main bathroom on a regular basis for local music/news while I shower and keep it charged with an AC adapter. All-in-all, I feel better that I have a radio that I can use anywhere that will keep my both entertained AND informed without any loss of power worries. Highly recommended!

I bought this at the same to I purchased our coffee maker that used basket-type filters. I had paper filters, but I thought this would be more environmentally friendly. In the long run, I though it would be cheaper to use than paper filters. Before I used it the first time, I gave it a thorough warm-water wash with soap to remove any manufacturing residue. Two uses later, I switched back to the paper filters. I'll put aside that it was very messy to clean after each use and just mention that it imparted a definite metallic taste to our coffee. Perhaps other, more expensive filters of this type do not have the same effect, but this one did. i guess you often get just what you pay for, and this is one of those cases. At 6 bucks, it was a total waste of money. Fortunately, it is recyclable, which is just what I did with it..NOT recommended!

I bought this for my wife as one of her Christmas presents. She wanted a "Crane" necklace. I look at many, and this seemed to be the nicest. The picture shown on Amazon does not do it justice. Both my wife & I were surprised and happy with the degree of detail and the craftmanship evident in the pendant. She wants a pair of earrings, now, of comparable quality.

Randy has health issues which, as we all know, are ridiculously expensive,. When Willie ran into money issues, we all ran to buy "TapesFrom The IRS" to help him out, and we did just that. Now Randy needs our help, and we need to run and buy these two recordings (Vol. 2 is also released). No one today has a voice as "old school" as Randy, so us Traditional Country lovers need to step up. This recording (and the follow-up, Vol. 2) delivers more than one perfect rendition of 13 country classics worth hearing by anybody, but BEST heard when sung by Randy Travis and his rare and timeless voice. Get well soon!

My wife has used these for a couple of years, buying them through a local beauty supplier. When the supplier stopped carrying them, she had me search on-line for these, and I found them here. The woman is good. If you like pop music, you won't go wrong with this album.

Magnesium has muscle relaxant properties. Your entire circulatory system (heart, veins, arteries) are muscular in nature. Take magnesium on a regular basis and your heart works better, your veins & arteries relax, potentially lowering your blood pressure. I had a "high-normal" blood pressure and was on medication to keep it within normal limits (120 over 70 or less). I eat very well, keep my sodium intake at a reasonable level & excercise on a regular basis. I started taking magnesium, stopped my blood pressure meds, and now maintain a pressure of 130 over 70 or less.The Viva Labs product is good and does the job. The pills are coated to go down easily (they are not small) and, taken with or without food, do not repeat or cause me any gastric distress. An excellent product at a very reasonable price.

I made the mistake of buying this direct from Zippo and paid the full listed price + shipping (stupid me!), but that doesn't make it any less a great lighter. The Green Bay logo looks better live than it does in the Amazon picture. The rest of the case is the "distressed" style, so it won't show scratches and such that a highly polished lighter would. Of course, it has the usual hefty construction of any Zippo. A great buy for any Green Bay fan. Go Pack!

I made the mistake of buying this Zippo direct from the company and paid the fulllisted price (stupid me!). Nevertheless, this is a Zippo on steroids. I have another brass Zippo that I bought in the 80's (that still works fine), but it doesn't have the heft of this lighter. Even the Zippo "click" that this one has is meatier that their non-armored offerings. At the Amazon price, it is a virtual steal!

This collection of Phil Ochs songs is easily the most treasured of his recordings that I own. I’ve been a Phil Ochs fan since my early teens in the 60’s, and I own every LP he ever put out in the States, but I never heard a good number of these songs. Whether or not you are a fan of Ochs, if you are a lover of traditional folk music, you owe it to yourself to buy this CD, as it belongs in your collection.Until you hear this performance of just Phil with his guitar, voice and well written songs, you amy never understand fully why he was considered to be right “up there” with his good friend, Bob Dylan. You may never fully understand why Pete Seeger thought so very highly of Phil. You may also never understand his true genius until you hear these 25 songs that he had written by the time he was only 22 years old. He had vision and insight well beyond his years.This CD will make you feel as though you are in a small club listening to Phil in person back in a time when the protest song was sought out and appreciated by audiences (albeit generally small). Many of these songs are actually still topical today (The A.M.A. Song, The Ballad Of U.S. Steel and The Power And The Glory (which he refers to on the CD as “my anthem”).If you know the full story of Phil Ochs and his untimely death, you will have tears in your eyes if you think about the talent that was lost to us when he ended his life. This CD is a peek back into an era and into an artist that, some 50+ years ago, helped shape what the decade of the 60’s became. Buy it, ingest it, enjoy it and in the end, treasure it.

If you love traditional country western swing (with a touch of Honky-Tonk), you need this CD in your collection. With songs originally recorded from the late 40’s through the very early 60’s, this CD surely rings true.Using the original Master recordings, Capitol has managed to produce a CD that has exceptional fidelity with crisp and clean vocals & instrumentation. The sound is certainly better than any original disc would have been.At about 45 minutes in length, it’s a great bargain for a series of recordings that will bring you back to your early years when the music was simpler and everything was just more straight-forward. Buy it and enjoy!

I bought this to replace my wife's very old and very worn looking cup warmer that she uses in out family room to keep her tea or coffee warm. She generally uses over-sized cups and has a warmer that fits them. She's keeping it for now. The Mr. Coffee warmer will fit only the average-sized cup that holds the usual 10-12 ounces (my wife's cups hold 20 oz. or more).She uses it now in her home office area with smaller cups and really likes the base-mounted On/Off switch (her other warmer has a rotary "line switch" about 18" down from the cup warmer with an "On" indicator light located on the warmer base. This has the "On" indicator alongside the power switch. It works fine with the average size cup, but cannot be recommended for large size cups.

Before getting a hole in one of the fingers. I expect at least 2-3 weeks of use out of my dish gloves before they get a hole. I couldn't find any others at the stores around my in-laws rural house so I ordered these. They are fine for cleaning the bathroom but for dishes, not so much.

My daughter had one of these for 3 years during middle school and loved it. We passed it on to her brother, who started middle school this year. The zipper broke, and we couldn't find another one at Staples, so we bought it here. Great for organizing many classes in one place.

We had guests with a child stay one night, and there was a power outage. Their child was frightened, and we only had a couple of flashlights, which the adults used to try and figure out why the power had gone out. After that, I ordered these and put one in every room. They work well, shine bright, and didn't cost a lot. Yes, 3 AAA batteries seems like a lot per flashlight, but whatever. Now everyone in the house has their own light when they need it.

I'm sure it works for some people. I have a Smart TV from Samsung, and we mostly just stream what we watch from Netflix or Amazon Prime. We downgraded out cable and ordered this.Our TV is next to a huge window, which is where we put the antenna. We hooked it up (easy install) and we were pleased with the picture quality and the stations we received. The weather was perfect when we first got it.Some rain and wind moved in and out went the great reception. Freezing pictures &  pixelated programs frustrated us. We would be watching football and the picture would freeze, pixelate, then start back up a few seconds later. You can miss some good plays during a game that way.We moved the antenna around to try and get better reception, it didn't help.I live about 15 min from Boston on a major road with no large buildings around me. I also live near a lot of businesses so there is plenty of access to wifi, antennas, etc. Can't blame it on my position.Too bad. This item would have been a good deal if it had worked for us.

That's a bold statement, I know.I'm a Texan that has lived in Boston for over 20 years. The cold weather is so hard for me, because all my life I have battled painfully icy hands and feet, even as a kid in the South. I live in a house built in the 1860's, and IT is cold all the time as well. We keep space heaters everywhere. I wear thick socks & house shoes. Warm layers of clothing. None of that makes a difference to my hands & feet. I end up putting my feet in a hot water bath several times a day. It's such a hassle but necessary for me to function. I can't go do outdoor activities unless I've preheated myself.Here is what I know is NOT causing me to be perpetually cold: (ruled out by extensive medical testing)-Thyroid or adrenals-Iron level-Hormones-DiabetesI've been the same healthy weight for 25 years, plus I am physically active. The final ruling is poor circulation, what are ya gonna do?My husband like to find a solution to everything. He saw these on here and ordered them. I commented that I thought these were ridiculous and wouldn't make a bit of difference.I was very wrong. These are the bomb! Put them in the microwave for about 45 seconds then pop onto feet. Have a seat with a book or magazine for 10 mins or so, because they aren't made for walking around. The bliss of my toes getting warmed up just makes me happy. It's easy, and I don't have to make a huge production out of running bath water, soaking & drying my feet 3 times a day (although I do have very clean feet as a result). They warm the bottom and top of the foot. The bonus is that these also work nicely to warm up my hands! Instead of running the kitchen faucet I just stick my hands in here. Warm in no time.Now I can reheat myself into a less cold & cranky state in no time at all. My husband says, now wasn't that worth $20? I wish I had these years ago.I must add that after we purchased these, I saw them at Marshalls for $15. Whatever. If you have cold feet, this is your savior.

In 2008 out of nowhere my eyes had a horrible reaction after taking off my makeup. I had never had a problem before, now my eyes were crusty and swollen almost shut. I don't even wear make up but a handful of times a year. I tried everything to remedy this. New eye makeup, the expensive kind. New makeup removers. Lots of brands & price levels. Nothing made a difference. My eyes would pay a price for a good week afterwards. I resigned myself to wearing eye make up maybe 1-2 times a year. This went on for a few years.Then I got a free sample of Lancome Eau Frache Douceur in 2012. It was the magic potion I had been searching for! My savior! It removed my make up without a reaction. It was pricey, but I splurged on a bottle. I make it last because, again, I don't wear makeup that often.This past summer I went away on vacation and forgot my beloved Lancome! Ack! I wasn't prepared to spend the big bucks to order a whole new bottle, and I was nowhere near a dept store to try and bum a sample.I did the research as to what made that Lancome  product so special. Turns out it is micellar water. Why have I not heard of this before? I took a chance and ordered this product to fill in the gap.Again, my lucky day. Worked just like the Lancome version at a fraction of the price.Note - I do NOT wear heavy make up, so I don't know how this will work for those that wear a full on face of product. I wear mascara (not waterproof), eyeliner, some shadows, powder, some liquid blush. A light hand on all of it.Definitely worth a try!

It isn't the same color (probably oxidation due to long storage time in varying temperatures), it has a different label and an off odor. See my attached picture. I am returning it right away.

It is expensive but one of the best gentle exfoliating cleansers I have found. I have "mature' skin (read - peri-menopausal and dry!) that still needs to be scrubbed but only a couple of times a week. This has a LIGHT fragrance that doesn't overwhelm, I hate perfume-y face products! Gentle, not harsh. I tried it on a whim when I saw it on clearance/close out (didn't sell well there, I suppose) at Whole Foods for $11 - I was hooked. The regular price at WF was the same as it is here.

Inexpensive and does the job well. Protects it from falls and getting knocked around in my purse. The edges of this cup are thin, easily chipped in the sink or dishwasher. Once the edge is chipped, it dribbles when you drink from it even with the silicone lid on. Not good! Maybe worth $4.

I just bought this yesterday. My hairdresser thinned out my ends too much and now I have no volume. Grrr!! I chose this product because I have used texture putties in the past with success but I HATE it when they are overly scented! This one has a very light scent. I wish someone made something with NO SCENT. So many people get tired of too many artificial smells on their person. Anyway, a tiny bit rubbed into warm hands then evenly spread from roots to tips (least amount on tips) does a nice job of adding volume without weird stickiness or stiffness. I bend over at the waist to work it into my hair for even distribution. BTW I got it at a beauty supply store for $3 less than is listed here.

Both my daughter and I have low iron. My daughter has had GI problems in the past so we needed an iron that wouldn't constipate or irritate. I have found that this does a good job with no GI complaint. I also like to use Floradix iron & herbs to add in another type of iron on days when I don't use this. (Sometimes I like to mix it up just to try to get a variety of vitamins & minerals from different sources). Floradix also doesn't irritate our guts. We take it with vitamin C per the doctor's orders for best absorption.

I wanted to like this supplement more, but the B12 isn't methylated (I should have checked on that before I ordered, my mistake) and the shape! It is an oval but very thick in the middle. My teen & tween are great at taking vitamins and struggle with these. I like New Chapter otherwise.

I was trying a new magnesium, usually I get the Thorne Mag Citrate capsules. These were a bit too big for me to swallow. I put some in water and they didn't dissolve even after 2 hours. I have benign thyroid nodules, so swallowing can be difficult. If a tablet is sitting in my throat not dissolving, it can get very uncomfortable for me. I ended up in the ER after a too-large calcium tablet would NOT dissolve (NOT Doctor's Best). It ended up irritating my throat and making me lose my voice for a week. I had to return these. Not taking another chance.

My mom gave me this to try and sneak into my kid's food for extra protein. I was surprised how well it blended in to tomato soup and even a teaspoon into their hot chocolate! Hey, you get it in where you can. I don't find the taste bad at all. Everybody has a preference.

This is a great bang for the buck. Very relaxing and yet somewhat odd. HOWEVER! When I bought this a coupld of weeks ago it was $2.99, now it's $5! So look around, these are all the same, you will find one for less.

I wanted to like this hair dryer. I loved my Scalpmaster Elite until I dropped it on a hard tile floor from high up pulling it from a cabinet and broke it. My fault! (I own 2 of the Scalpmaster Elites, an extra for my in-laws house when we visit, which is often). I also use the concentrator tool on it. If you haven't learned how to master the tools, look at the Sam Villa hair education videos on YouTube or his site for pros. Good Info, great tutorials!I ordered this one thinking that maybe this was the updated version of that one.The Scalpmaster Elite is a super hairdryer for those of us that want a pro looking blow dry at home. The Revlon/Clairol hairdryers you get at Target are crap, and you will understand that only when you move up to one of these. Plus they have such a short life! Ugh!  A good, semi-pro hairdryer is the way to go for most of us that are good at doing our own blow drying. I like the way I blow dry my own hair, to the point when my hairdresser finishes my cut, she hands me a brush and her $150 pro dryer and I get to work. This is how I know I do NOT need a pro dryer. They are heavy! They are made to dry for hours a day 5 days a week. That can get hard on your wrist after a while.On the plus side, the Ionic is a tad smaller than the Elite, so a bit easier to handle as you work around your head/sections. However, it says it is 1875 watts. What? No way! It feels like a travel hair dryer, it blows so weak. And don't get me started on the low air setting. It's like a 'why bother?' My teen age daughter was laughing when she was using it on the low air setting.And the concentrator tool - what is that? I will post a pic comparing the Elite tool vs. the Ionic. It barely fits on the end, and as you blow dry your hair, you need to adjust where it is angled. It is made of thin (and clearly easy to crack/break) plastic. It gets very hot with little use, ok, not unexpected - but not easy to adjust for your needs as you can tell when manipulating, it is on the verge of cracking. And if you hit it with your brush, as that sometimes happens, it gets knocked off! This tool has been designed to fit just inside the rim of the dryer. There is very, very little space for that to sit properly. As I try to remove or adjust it, I am constantly thinking "I am about to break the tool or the end of the dryer!" The Scalpmaster Elite tools fit OVER the outside of the nozzle, are MUCH more well made (thick plastic that clearly won't crack!) for long term use. And the opening is too big - oval shaped, not great for concentrating the flow of air. Poor design flaws on the Ultra Elite Ionic.Since I have a teen daughter and myself using this dryer, I went ahead and returned it & reordered the Scalpmaster Elite. It is $20 less here on Amazon than at my local beauty store (that got me hooked on them in the first place with a good coupon!). Totally worth $45!Hope this helps someone!
My son has been wanting his own Swiss Army knife forever, and this was what he chose. He paid for 1/3 of it, so he treasures it all the more. Classic piece! Loves it!

Not every day, but when they are sick or fighting a cold. Even my husband, who is skeptical about supplements, has seen it work for him, stopping a cold in much less time than before. Should be used in conjunction with selenium for best results.ALSO...there are so many of us on Amazon trying to find products like supplements, vitamins, herbs,creams, etc., to manage our health and well being. I try hard to bring an honest review to you. However, much to my chagrin, I am finding paid for and planted reviews. We all know that the person selling a product is going to try and coax a couple of good reviews, but when I come across a product with an outstanding & unbelievable amount of 5 stars, I looks further. For what? Too many 5 star reviews from people who have no other reviews, written in as few words as possible to make the word quota. OR a 5 star review written by someone that has maybe 1 or 2 other reviews for a couple of cheap items, often all bought at the same time. Or many of these types of quick 5 star reviews showing up all around the same time period. Then there are the 'verified buyer' obvious paid reviews. I've read that this is worked by offering someone an Amazon gift card in exchange for that person purchasing the product then positively reviewing it, thus earning the 'verified buyer status' and elevating the validity of the review. So be forewarned and look a bit further in for the high quality reviews many of us take the time to write!This extra post script is NOT in reflection of the product I am reviewing here; it is to educate readers as they wade through all of the reviews to try and get the correct information to make a well educated purchase with their money.
