It has the antennas to work with Verizon but It is my understanding Verizon has blocked it. This phone, as of this writing, will probably not work with Verizon. The wide spectrum of the phone's antenna will allow it to work practically everywhere in the world (you will need a working SIM card).So how is the hardware? For the most part, its hardware hits that sweet cost/benefit spot. None of the hardware is top-notch (they are a notch below) which is good enough for almost everyone. For example, the phone uses Gorilla Glass 3, which isn't as good as Gorilla Glass 4, but the difference between the two is small. The advantage is they are much cheaper than having top-of-the-line components. Hence, this is an affordable phone that will certainly meet almost everyone's needs.The only part of the hardware which I do have some complaint is the speaker. The speakers are certainly good enough for listening during a phone conversation or a youtube video. But both the volume and sound quality will not wow anyone. Overall, it is an acceptable speaker.Perhaps the best part of the hardware is its near-top-notch camera. This camera takes pictures as good as my iPhone 6. Trust me, that is a high compliment.The call reception is quite good. The battery life is much better than my iPhone 6. This phone lasts me 35+ hours with regular use. My iPhone 6, with similar use, will last me around 16-20 hours.The phone looks and feels better than the pictures. The body is high-quality polycarbonate (high grade plastic used in bulletproof glass). It certainly doesn't feel cheap.I recommend the 32GB storage option for practically everyone.Pros:1)Looks and feels better than pictures. Made of high quality polycarbonate and the phone is very thin.2)Hard to beat the value. You are getting a phone with 2nd best components available for a rock bottom price.3)Very good overall performance. It will certainly will be good enough for almost everyone. It seems even faster than my Samsung Galaxy S5, which might have been the fastest phone in 2014.4)Very decent battery life and screen.5)The Android OS on this phone is decoupled from the carriers and manufacturers. That means you can upgrade the Android OS and obtain the latest patches without ever connecting to the carrier network. You can do it through Wifi. That makes this phone ideal for Android developers.6)This phone works with the Google Fi cellular network.7)The wide antenna bandwidth allows this phone work with almost any cellular network (probably not Verizon).8)Fingerprint scanner is even faster than my iPhone 6, which itself is very fast. And I do like the position of the scanner (back) better. The finger print scanner definitely takes less than a second.Cons:1)Speaker is so-so but still very much acceptable. It won't win any hi-fi awards.2)You only get the most plain vanilla Android OS with apps provided by Google for things such as web browser, email, and calendar etc. If you are used to 3rd party widgets, apps, and enhancements provided by OEM, then they will be missing in this phone. You will, however, be able to run practically all the Android apps from the Google Play store on this phone.3)No option for higher storage than 32GB.

This is simply the best computer peripheral I have ever used. So much so, I don't even want to use my mouse anymore.It is about a size of a small paperback book. It has plenty of surface area. It also has an internal battery which lasts about 30 days. You charge it using the lightning cable which is provided (you can use it while charging). It can use either the bluetooth or the lightning cable for connectivity to the Mac. I did find this trackpad to be tad more responsive when connected by a lightning cable. But bluetooth responsiveness is more than adequate.To me, the magic of this trackpad is with the subtleties. It is incredibly responsive to the touch. In fact, you learn to relax your fingers a bit because that seems to work better. Unlike the previous generation, this can also track different pressures you put on. Pinch and zooming, which works on Chrome as well as Safari, is a delightful experience.From my experience, once you get used to this trackpad, the amount of effort to utilize it decreases and it will become second nature and you will wonder how you have ever used your Mac without it.Pros:1)Large. About the size of a small paperback book.2)Smooth and highly responsive.3)Pressure sensitive. Good tactile feel.4)Beautiful.5)Long battery life (30 days).6)Works with both lightning connector or bluetooth.7)Works with Parallels. I can use it with Windows and Linux which are part of my Parallels virtual machines.Cons:1)Not cheap.2)Works only with Mac (as far as I know).

I bought the Octane.I would like to contradict one reviewer here who stated the cover has a magnet. It doesn't. Therefore, the cover will not stick to the iPad.Luckily, the side edges protrude so the front screen is protected from a fall on a flat surface even without the cover.Overall, the case does a good job of protecting the iPad Air 2, but it is slightly bulky.

This is my first folding bike. I am just a casual rider (in shape).I rode this along the streets and the beaches of Southern California. Overall I was impressed.The frame had no flex and overall felt rock solid.When folded, the bike was actually larger than I expected. Do not expect a bike that will fit neatly into a suitcase unless it is very large. I could fit this bike into a trunk of my car, but not without clearing a lot of space first. Compact this bike isn't. But it is compact enough to carry within a trunk of a car.It weighs around 24 pounds, which is borderline heavy to carry.The saddle was uncomfortable. Fortunately, I replaced the saddle with top of the line gel saddle and it is now comfortable.The only ergonomic adjustment is the height of the seat post. For those who are used to riding conventional bikes which fits their size, this bike will take some adjustment. The bike isn't uncomfortable (except for the saddle), but its one-size-fits-all ergonomics will not please everyone.So what is there to like? It is fast. It is light. It is simply cool and it will definitely grab attention.It also has high-end (not the highest) components such as a shifters, gears, brakes, and tires. I had no trouble going past by slower bikes.The 10-speed is plenty and I actually prefer it over my 18 speed bike which requires far more gear changes.If you need a folding bike which fits within a truck of a car and rides like a high-end bike, then this bike will fit that bill.Pros:1)Fast, light, and unique. This is an enjoyable bike with cool factor to match.2)High-end (not highest) components (shifters, gears, chain, brakes, frames, wheels, and tires).3)It folds and fits into a trunk. That's simply cool.4)The frame is solid and I felt no flex.5)The paint job was better than expected.Cons:1)Only the seat post height is adjustable. For those who are keen on ergonomics, this bike may never fit you perfectly as you would like. Overall, I have found the ergonomics satisfactory but not quite as comfortable as my well fitting conventional bike.2)The saddle is uncomfortable. But that is quite common with OEM saddles. I highly recommend replacing the saddle with more comfortable ones.3)When folded, it was larger than I had expected. In my view, the bike was designed more for performance than for compactness.4)I would not recommend this bike for serious riders who ride hundreds of miles per week. But then again, you probably already know that. :)

In my opinion, this is an unsatisfactory case for two main reasons.First, the cover has a very weak magnet that barely sticks to the front. For example, when held upside down, the front flap will detach from the screen.Second, the case itself does not protect the screen. There is no protrusion, as you would find in many iPad cases, that protects the screen in the event of a fall and the front flap has come off.The only thing I like about this case is its thinness and lack of bulk.Pros:1)Very thin and lacks bulk. Overall, made of good materials.Cons:1)Front flap has a very weak magnet which makes the front flap fall off too easily.2)The surrounding case does nothing to protect the screen in the event of front flap falling off.

If you need a bag that will keep your 6 pack of beer and some sandwiches cold for a summer picnic, then this bag may do the trick.I have used it keep my drinks (mostly juices) cold for summer camping and it did a very good job.One downside is its weight. This bag is not light and certainly will add bulk.It is actually little heavier than I expected and I do not think it is suitable for hiking (unless you really like to carry extra weight).

Works very well. It reaches places where the previous version didn't reach quite as easily because this head is much smaller.Please note, this item will not work with older sonic models. So please check if your sonic model is compatible with this toothbrush.

Is this suppose to be a premium Earl Grey?If the ideal Earl Grey is suppose to be the most bland and un-aromatic tea in existence, then yes.In my opinion, this tea tastes almost like water.Yes, that makes this tea smooth because there is extremely subtle taste and equally subtle aroma.But I wasn't looking for the most bland tea possible.I wanted that Earl Grey kick, and this tea has very little of it.

For the price, it would be hard to the quality of this carafe. It simply works.But there are two things about this carafe that makes it less than great.First, is the small opening which forces you to use pouring angles that are higher than it should be. In other words, it takes longer and more effort to pour the drinks than it should. Second, the thermal quality of this carafe is good only for 4 hours. If you need anything longer, then you are better off buying much more expensive Thermos brands of carafe.Pros:1)Large 2 liter capacity.2)No leaks.3)Unbeatable price for quality.Cons:1)Small mouth forces you to use more effort to pour the drinks which also takes longer to pour.2)Thermal quality isn't top notch but good enough to keep your drinks hot for 2-4 hours. If keeping your drinks hot as possible for longest duration is your priority, then I suggest purchasing Thermos carafes which cost far more.

I had the 2nd generation Kindle (2009) and most recently read all my eBooks on my 3rd generation 9.7 inch iPad (2011).I recently gave my iPad to my mother. Since I was using my iPad principally for reading eBooks, I decided to get the latest Kindle. For the most part, I was disappointed and I returned the device (I rarely return anything).The screen is about the size of a 5.5 inch smartphone. The screen is even smaller than my 2nd generation Kindle which I thought was too small. Going from 9.7 inch iPad to this Kindle for reading is like going from Cadillac Escalade to Pontiac Fiero.I think the midget screen size is fine for novels and fiction. If you read anything technical, however, then Kindle's midget screen size is really cumbersome.That's too bad because the screen, besides its size, is really ideal for reading. It responds well to touches and turning pages are quick, responsive, and intuitive. It even handles highlighting text almost as well as iPad.I do not recommend this device for those who are seeking bigger reading device.I do not recommend this device for those with 5.5 inch or larger smartphones or tablets.I recommend this device for those who would use it for reading novels and short stories with little to no illustration.Pros:1)The screen is ideal for reading text. You can read it comfortably in the dark with little to no eyestrain.2)Quick and responsive. The touch interface is intuitive. Even highlighting text is fairly fast. Page turns are also quick and almost as fast as iPad's.3)Long battery life.4)Overall easy to use.Cons:1)Screen is midget sized and no bigger than the 5.5 smartphones. If you have 5.5 inch or larger smartphone or tablet, save your money and read off of those.

This is a no-frills water boiler that should meet most people's needs with some compromises.I use this at my office. I do not trust the water coming out our pantry's faucet (it has rudimentary filter). So I bring my own water to office (I have a state of the art water filtration at home) and use this boiler for my hot water needs such as coffee, tea, and even occasional ramen noodles and soup.I have a 3.2qt (about 3 liter) version that more than meets my needs as far as amount of water that needs to be stored and constantly boiled and heated.Overall, most will find this water boiler satisfactory.Pros:1)Cheaper than most.2)Works reliably and not too flimsy of a construction.3)Does NOT rust in mine. It seems the innards are coated and I do not recommend scraping the coating off.4)4 water temperatures (you will probably use all of them at some point).5)Safety dispenser (two button press required to get hot water).6)Auto shutoff so it won't become a fire hazard.Cons:1)Initially, it takes 27 minutes to boil water @ full 3 liters. That is an awful long time and way longer than most water boilers (not necessarily the same type). I have a more conventional electric kettle at home which only takes about 3 minutes to boil 1 liter of water. Please note, once water is boiled, it is purposely maintained at 4 different warm temperatures. So it will take less time to reboil it (5-10 minutes).2)When I set the water to boil (or reboil), it makes a noticeably loud water percolating buzz that is heard throughout the office for several minutes. If you are in a cubicle, I do not recommend this product as your co-workers might hate you. Noise pollution this water boiler is guilty of.3)The water is never boiled to a very high temperature. So if you need your boiled water extra streaming hot, then this water boiler will disappoint. It is plenty hot, however, for all practical needs (coffee, tea, soup, etc).4)There is no off switch. You need to unplug it.5)I highly recommend using only bottled or filtered water as all the minerals and particles will accumulate inside.
I had a problem with dishwasher detergent leaving residue in my dishwasher.I am happy to say this product solved that problem. After a full cycle, there is no residue in my dishes when I use this.

First thing I want to tell the buyers is this dock is not compatible with MagSafe 1 OR its MagSafe 2 adapter. It is compatible only with MagSafe 2 (not with MagSafe 2 adapter for MagSafe 1), which is available only with the latest MacBook Pro.For me the, the main reason why I purchased this dock was to secure my MacBook Pro at work. I use the HDMI for the monitor and the single USB port for keyboard and mouse through a hub. It works beautifully.You will need to purchase a separate laptop lock to secure this dock.Pros1)It works reasonably well. It can secure your MacBook Pro with a lock.Cons:1)Does not work with MagSafe 1 or its adapter to MagSafe 2.2)Only a single DVI, HDMI, and USB port each.3)Not of the highest construction. But it is adequate.

The first thing that struck me about this lock is that it is made of high quality materials with better than average fit and finish.Cheapness this lock does not feel like.The second pleasant surprise is that it has a 4 digit (many locks only have 3) combination.I bought the 4.4m one and it is adequate but I also fee it may might be inadequate in many situations. I suggest purchasing the longer one.Pros:1)Made of high quality materials with good fit and finish.2)4 digit combination. That's 10,000 different combination including 0000.Cons:1)Fairly expensive and the longer version, which is what I recommend, is over $30.
I would say this bar compares very favorably to KIND.It is both salty and sweet. It has lot of nuts such.Nuts, salt, and sugar. Maybe some preservatives.Enjoy!

I have 3 lightning cables from Apple. This is the only lightning cable I have that's not from Apple.I can say these are actually little better than Apple's lightning cables. The cable line itself is in a form of a mesh (not plastic like Apple's) and it looks and feels lot more durable and flexible. I ran over it several times with the wheels of my desk chair and it works fine.This is also about 7 inches longer than the standard Apple lightning cable.The lightning side of the cable is almost as thin and slight as the Apple's version. They are practically the same size. If your iPhone's case had no issues with the Apple's lightning cable, then the same case should have no issues with this one.

I love the design of this grater.First, it has two types of grater and they are angled for ease of use.Second, you can fold the handle and have a perfectly angled grater that you can use to slice potatoes and cheese and alike.The overall quality of the components are of high end. You won't find cheap looking plastic or metals in this grater.Yes, this grater is expensive, but it is also higher in quality.

The majority of this book are quotes from famous people who eschewed religion.The list is an interesting one because the list includes many that one might think was at least somewhat religious such as Beethoven.About the first 1/3 of the book is about author's views on Christianity in particular. His central argument, in accordance with the bible, is that that to believe one's purpose is about glorifying God (Christian god) is to put oneself into a form of self-imposed slavery (god as the master). To give in to this slavery, the author argues, is to limit oneself from reaching one's true potential and to prevent oneself from seeing other versions of reality.Although I do not disagree with the author, I also think the author does make a critical mistake that many atheists tends to make. He is negative. He is anti-Christianity rather than pro-inspiration. His view fails to inspire people to feel better about themselves and the world around them, and most importantly, about the future ahead of us.The author, a former pastor, says atheism is not about dogma, and therefore, he stays away from it. But that stance also prevents him from offering an alternative to the inspirational message of Christianity (not necessarily a rational message) that many find so appealing. In my view, what he should do is to take a page out of Christianity's playbook and choose to inspire people with atheism rather than spread the "Christianity is BS" message.Pros:1)Well thought out book on Christianity and atheism.2)Has many good tidbits about the anti-religious beliefs of famous people.Cons:1)Majority of the book are quotes of famous people who eschewed religion (mostly Christianity).2)Too negative and fails to offer an inspirational alternative. Not everyone would find it appealing.

Some books are far better off providing visualization rather than more words. This book seems to have focused on having as many words as possible to fill up a thick book. I would like to have seen more downloadable code examples, which was sufficient in quantity and quality, but still not enough to my liking.Is this book comprehensive? I think it is the most comprehensive book on SSIS I have read. Would I want to read this book from the beginning to end? No, and I am a very fast reader.On the bright side, the book is written by SSIS experts with many years of experience and its shows. They cover not only SSIS but many parts of data warehousing, SSAS, T-SQL, and even C# codes. I think this is the most authoritative book on SSIS I have read.I also think the book could have included hypothetical problem and solutions (although it implicitly provides that in the code samples).It is too bad, the book could have been just as effective with about half the words.Pros:1)Written by group of SSIS experts.2)Comprehensive coverage of SSIS and related data warehousing and SSAS concepts.3)Detailed coverage. This isn't just an overview.Cons:1)Wordy. It is as if the authors were paid by the number of words they have written.2)Lacking in specific hypotheticals and solutions. For me, I want to know how to use SSIS to solve a problem, not necessarily on how SSIS works to an exacting detail.3)Scant coverage of MDX and DMX. Yes, very few organizations use them, but I also think they could have covered it a little bit.

I have owned the original iPhone, iPhone 3GS, iPhone 4, iPhone 5, Nexus 5, and Galaxy S5.This is the best phone I have ever owned. The next best would be the Samsung Galaxy S5.Which iPhone 6 should you buy? That depends on your needs. The iPhone 6+ has bigger screen, better battery life, and better camera (optical image stabilization). But it also comes in a bigger form factor which might be too large for many. It is worth noting that iPhone 6+ is bigger than the LG G3 (iPhone 6+ is thinner), which has the same screen size (5.5 inches) and I think LG G3 is just about the biggest phone that will fit into my pocket. To me, the iPhone 6+ is too big.The iPhone 6 has a 4.7 inch screen which is very functionally useful. I think it could be tad bigger (about 4.8 to 5 inches). In my opinion, the 4.7 inch screen size should be satisfactory to most, especially those who are used to the 4 inch screen size of the iPhone 5 and iPhone 5S. I am used to using Galaxy S5 (5.1 inches) and I don't find the 4.7 inch screen to be too small.So what makes the iPhone 6 so special? It's the form factor (thin and light), the awesome camera, and the touch id (fingerprint sensor).First and foremost, this is a beautiful phone to see and hold. I thought iPhone 5 was beautiful, but the iPhone 6 definitely is better looking! Everyone who has seen my phone in the last 3 days wanted to buy one. The Galaxy S5 is also a thin and beautiful phone. But it is also plastic and has an ugly protruding camera in the back that makes it look like a huge wart. I didn't think I would mind it at first, but the ugliness of the huge square protruding camera really bothered me, especially because, in my view, the S5 camera picture quality was average at best.Second, the camera on the iPhone 6 is just awesome, especially compared to the Galaxy S5. I thought the Galaxy S5 would take better pictures because it is 13 megapixels. Wrong. I have had more blurry pictures with the Galaxy S5 in 4 months than I had with my iPhone 5 in 20 months. Plus, the Galaxy S5 pictures came out very grainy. They looked like they were taken with a smartphone camera. Whereas the pictures taken by the iPhone 6 looked like pictures from a dedicated digital camera. I was especially impressed with its low-light photography and surprisingly powerful flash. Even when taking pictures in low-light, the iPhone 6 camera takes wonderful pictures.Third, the Touch ID (fingerprint sensor) feature is a huge plus for me. I was initially worried that it may take too long to process my fingerprints. Wrong. It takes less than a second to identify my fingerprints. It beats punching my secret code on the screen hands down.The Samsung Galaxy S5, however, still trumps the iPhone 6 in certain areas.The first and foremost is the battery life. Although the iPhone 6 (about 24 hours with normal usage for me) lasts about 20% longer than my iPhone 5, it still can't hold a candle to my Galaxy S5 which can last over 36 hours. If a long battery life is your main need, then I would either get the S5 or get the iPhone 6 with a protective battery case.Second, the Galaxy S5 still has the superior screen. It is not only significantly bigger (5.1 inches), but it is also a full HD (1080p) screen compared to the 720p screen of the iPhone 6. Four months ago, independent tests showed that the Galaxy S5 had the best screen on a smartphone, and I believe it. Seeing them side-by-side, I have to say that I prefer the screen on the Galaxy S5 over the iPhone 6.Lastly, I think the Android platform is well on its way of trouncing Apple in both the number and the variety of apps. Android simply has stronger marketshare and Android programming skills are more widely available. This is especially true if you don't use English as your primary language. If you are looking for apps in Chinese or Spanish, for example, you are more likely to find them in Android than in the iPhone.Pros:1)Beautiful form factor. Thin and light. Even the ever-slightly protruding camera looks beautiful2)Awesome camera that takes superior pictures over Android phones such as the Galaxy S5 and Nexus 5. I was especially impressed with the low-light photography.3)Touch ID (fingerprint sensor). It is fast and easy. It makes securing your iPhone 6 very breezy and convenient. I will never use the punching passcodes again.4)Seamless integration of hardware and software that is hard to beat.5)Compatible with most car audio systems. Most Android and Windows phones are not compatible (meaning you can't play music via the USB) with car audio systems. Your Android device can, however, still play music via blutooth if your car audio system supports it. But the music quality is often sub-par.6)Internal storage is much faster than the Micro-SD cards. All iPhone storage are internal, which makes iPhone storage non-expandable but it also enables them to have faster I/O.7)Seamless integration with iTunes. I didn't think this was important until I had to sync my iTunes music with my Android phones. It was a pain.Cons:1)Very average battery life. I still can get 24 hours with normal usage (20 min talk, 20 text, facebook, emails etc.). The lack of battery life is especially apparent when compared to the Galaxy S5, which I can use for little over 36 hours with normal usage.2)Very average screen. The screen size (4.7 inches) was very acceptable. But it is only 720p. Mind you, it is still an excellent screen, but it is also very average by today's smartphone standards.3)Only 1GB of RAM. Most of the top-end Android phones have 2GB or more. The iPhone 6 is a definite laggard in this area. You would need to kill apps (double click on the round button and swipe the apps) on a regular basis to save memory.4)Not waterproof like the Samsung Galaxy S5. I took my Galaxy S5 to outdoor sports and I never had to worry about it getting wet. But I can't do the same with the iPhone 6.5)Many Non-English apps are more widely available in Android than the iPhone.6)Expensive. Android Phones with similar specs would be around $200 lower in price.

I have owned the original iPhone, iPhone 3GS, iPhone 4, iPhone 5, Nexus 5, and Galaxy S5.I have owned probably 20 phone cases and bumpers.This is definitely the best bumper I have ever owned. I have a silver iPhone 6 and I bought the gold colored bumper.The first thing I would like to say about this bumper is that it protects well. I dropped my phone about 4 feet onto a flat glass surface with this bumper on and my iPhone 6 had zero damage. Contrary to some of the reviews, this bumper has a slight protrusion both on the front and back. So it protects the phone from drops on flat surfaces on all sides, including the screen.This bumper is made of high grade materials and it shows. The polycarbonate casing does not detract from the beauty of my iPhone 6. Trust me, if you get a cheap bumper, you will get a bumper made of cheap materials that would look cheap on your iPhone. You want a bumper that would enhance the beauty of your iPhone 6 and this bumper does that.My main concern with this bumper was that it is made of two pieces and I feared they could come apart. To my pleasant surprise, the inner silicone material and the outer polycarbonate material seems to work as one. The only time I even notice they are separate parts was when I took the bumper out of my iPhone.The bumper fits my iPhone 6 like a glove. It fits so well it was actually little hard to take it out.I had no problems with the buttons. They are responsive and works flawlessly with this bumper.If you are looking for a slim high quality bumper that looks good and protects well, then I can recommend this bumper.Pros:1)Made of high quality materials that enhances the beauty of the iPhone 6. This can't be said of many cheaper bumpers.2)Fits my iPhone 6 like a glove.3)Provides reasonable protection on all sides from drops on flat surfaces.4)The two piece acts like one piece when on the iPhone 6.5)Very slim form factor.Cons:1)The protrusion on the screen side is little less than the backside. Effectively, it provides little less protection on the screen side. But it also prevents the bumper from becoming too cumbersome and ugly on the iPhone 6.2)If protection is your highest priority, then I would get a more substantial iPhone 6 cases such as the ones from Tech 21.But they come with much more bulk.

I still can get 24 hours with normal usage (20 min talk, 20 text, facebook, emails etc.). The lack of battery life is especially apparent when compared to the Galaxy S5, which I can use for little over 36 hours with normal usage.2)Very average screen. The screen size (4.7 inches) was very acceptable. But it is only 720p. Mind you, it is still an excellent screen, but it is also very average by today's smartphone standards.3)Only 1GB of RAM. Most of the top-end Android phones have 2GB or more. The iPhone 6 is a definite laggard in this area. You would need to kill apps (double click on the round button and swipe the apps) on a regular basis to save memory.4)Not waterproof like the Samsung Galaxy S5. I took my Galaxy S5 to outdoor sports and I never had to worry about it getting wet. But I can't do the same with the iPhone 6.5)Many Non-English apps are more widely available in Android than the iPhone.6)Expensive. Android Phones with similar specs would be around $200 lower in price.

Is it not our inevitable death that gives our life some meaning? What happens if that inevitability turns imminent?At its core, this drama is about love, forgiveness, and redemption. Don't all meaningful relationships involve all three?This is perhaps the most original drama I have ever seen. There are situations in this drama which I have never seen before because of the nature of the characters. The main character for example, played so wonderfully by Lee Yo Won who is perhaps the most talented Korean actress of her age group, has two souls. But one soul cannot reveal herself. The result is everyone, including the main character herself, rationally concludes the main character has multiple personality disorder!49 days itself has a deep meaning in Buddhism as they believe dead people's souls wander for 49 days on earth prior to going to the next life.But 49 days also has a strong metaphorical meaning. Life is short. Achieving what are seemingly easy things, such as having 3 true friends/lovers in your life, can be very difficult. "People would never want to attend their own funeral while having the ability to see the hearts and minds of others", says the Grim Reaper, "because people would realize how few really loved them".Maybe we should all live our lives as if we only have 49 days to live and strive to have least 3 people who truly loves us (outside of family) in order to prolong our lives.This drama can also be hilarious. The comedy comes out of nowhere to delight the audience with laughter. There is no slapstick comedy here but of situational comedy where only the audience understands the nuances of each other's mindset and becomes aware of how ironic the circumstances are.All the characters, even the antagonists, are highly likable at certain levels. There is no dumbed-down "evil" character for the sake of being evil. "Why did you betray me?" asks the main character to her best friend. The best friend replies "You always thoughtlessly provided me things without regard for my feelings and needs. You never asked me what I needed or how I felt. You simply gave things you wanted and that always made you feel superior and better than me. You thought you were just being a good friend. But I felt humiliated that I had to rely on friends like you!" The psychology of this drama is real.This drama had high ratings in Korea. The only reason why it wasn't a major blockbuster hit was perhaps because the drama did not have strong star-power in its cast. But don't let that deter you from watching this gem.Pros:1)Highly unique drama with strong script and cast.2)The situational comedy of this drama is some of the best I have ever seen. This drama can be quite funny.3)The drama hits on all emotional cylinders. You will experience a lot of different emotions.4)Highly likable characters. Even the antagonists are somewhat likable. It becomes really easy to care for the characters.5)This drama makes you think about the deeper things in life. Are you sure you have your priorities in place? Watch this drama and you would know.Pros:1)The drama went about 2 episodes too long. But I am being picky here. Every episodes had its gems.2)The drama doesn't start to get interesting until about the end of the 2nd episode.4)The last plot twist (involving siblings) was both unconvincing and unnecessary.

This is a phone that will delight many users looking for a medium quality phone.But it will leave those only want the most premium phones somewhat disappointed.What is not so premium about this phone? The screen, although more than adequate, is less than a premium performer.More specifically, the screen has rather mediocre color accuracy that results in images that are less than stellar to look at.To me, that is the biggest downer in comparison to the Samsung Galaxy S5.If you do want a Nexus 5-like phone but with much better screen and battery life, then you should give strong consideration to its sibling: LG G2. Nexus 5 is a water-down version of the LG G2, and the G2 specifications are almost identical except for its battery life and screen performance to the Nexus 5.As far as form factor, it is a thin phone with good camera. The body is a high-quality polycarbonate plastic. It feels very good in my hands. In my opinion, the size of this phone is perfect and I prefer its size over the slightly larger Galaxy S5.Galaxy S5 has a better screen, battery life, and larger screen size than LG G2. And LG G2 has better screen, battery life, and larger screen size than Nexus 5. This doesn't mean Nexus 5 is not a very good phone. In fact, I recommend it to those who are looking for a medium-grade phone with slight deficiencies in screen and battery performance than can be easily overlooked.Pros:1)Cheap and unlocked. You can use this phone almost anywhere where its bandwidth are supported (and that would be most places in the world). So if you travel abroad and want to use foreign SIM cards, I recommend this phone because it comes unlocked.2)Very solid all around performer. You will not feel this phone is sluggish while running any Android apps.3)Very solid polycarbonate construction with a thin frame. Bulky this phone is not.4)For me, this phone is a perfect size.5)I particularly recommend this phone for Android Developers looking for a test phone. It works great for me.Cons:1)Screen performance (color accuracy) is lacking compared to LG G2. It is a definite step below the Galaxy S5.2)Battery life, although sufficient and better than the iPhone 5, is still a definite step below the Galaxy S5. I can, however, still get around 25-30 hours of usage with normal use. That should be sufficient for most people.3)No SD Card expansion slots. So you cannot increase the storage after purchase.4)As with all recent Android phones, this phone is not compatible with my car audio which doesn't recognize this phone as a "USB Device". So I must use Blutooth to play music on my car stereo which has a slight but noticeably inferior audio quality.5)Not waterproof like the Galaxy S5.

Clumsy design this is. I had a wart on my arm. After using this as, a big chunk of the skin on my arm became freeze-burned. It is taking few weeks to fully recover the mostly cosmetic damage. Worst of all, my wart was still there after 3 weeks.Now, I have a constant bandage on my arm and everyone is asking me why I always have a noticeable bandage on my forearm.I ordered the Compound W freeze-off and that works MUCH better. It is colder and needs less contact on the skin to get the wart removed.My wart has now been removed, but not because of this product.I do not recommend this product.Pros:1)None I can think ofCons:1)Clumsy to use. You will need to put a q-tip like swab upside down into a provided canister which contains a freezer.2)Not cold enough to freeze-away the warts.3)Caused a chunk of my forearm to be freeze burned. Now, I have a noticeable spot on my arm that is taking weeks to completely heal (mostly cosmetic damage).4)Please do NOT use this on your face.

I have a medium/thin hair. This is the best hair gel I have ever used.It is light. It is non-greasy but it holds like much greasier maximum strength hair gels. Even after 10 hours, my hair still holds well.It only takes slight amount of this gel to stylize your hair. This is not for those who need an absolutely firm hold, but that's no longer in fashion these days anyway. If you want your hair to hold really well but yet still look naturally flowing, look no further.Pros:1)Light. It only takes about a single penny size amount to stylize and hold my hair for at least 10 hours.2)No smell or greasiness. My hair looks totally natural yet it still holds for a long time. I can pass my fingers through my hair and still not have feel any stickiness (it may take 1-2 minutes of blow drying to reach this stage).3)No artificial looking hold. My hair looks natural.Cons:1)You would need to blow dry your hair to get the maximum hold.But this is true of most hair gels.2)Ideal for medium length hair but probably not the best gel for longer hairs.

This movie is horrible, horrible, and I do mean horrible.The acting, storyline, CGI, action sequence, music, and even the camera angles were just bad.The only thing this film has going is the central actress Angela Yeung Wing. She does her best to rescue this movie from oblivion, but she fails to do so.I totally lost interest in this movie after 15 minutes. I regret that I even finished watching this movie.Pros:1)Angela Yeung Wing...maybe.2)One notably good fight sequence.Cons:1)Horrible acting that nobody believes.2)Horrible story that makes zero sense.3)Horrible action sequences (not even worthy of a video game CGI).4)The movie twists into even deeper horribleness in the 2nd half. It is as if everyone just gave up rescuing this film.

This is a very good functional case that will protect your Galaxy S5 from drops. It does a good job of protecting the screen because the edges protrude. It also looks stylish as well.The materials are very average plastic. The back is made of cotton inserts that makes it feel somewhat like a rough denim.If you are looking for an affordable case which looks decent and also protects the Galaxy S5 from drops, then this would be a worthwhile choice.Pros:1)Protects the Galaxy S5 from drops. The edges are protruded to protect the screen.2)Reasonably stylish. Doesn't look cheap. The cotton inserts in the back is a nice touch.3)Fits the Galaxy S5 perfectly.Cons:1)Average plastic materials.

If made properly (meaning right amount of hot water is poured), this can be a reasonably edible breakfast.For comparison, this tastes slightly worse than Denny's, and I may even prefer this over Denny's on occasion.Don't expect miracles out of a freeze dried food. For those who complain about the taste, you are simply expecting too much. Your standards should be lowered to liking anything that doesn't make you sick. On that standard, this passes with flying colors.Okay, I became slightly bloated with gas and had to do nature's business when no one was around. But that was better than starving in the wild. Let the truth be told, I probably needed to do nature's business even if I had eaten a real breakfast.What is the downside? You need hot water, and don't forget the spoon like I did. Eating can be tough without utensils. It is an obvious fact we take for granted because no one is without a spoon in our modern society.I have eaten this twice. And I am still alive for the time being. So this gets my recommendation.Pros:1)Portable (very light)2)Edible3)Doesn't make you sick4)Looks reasonably like real food.5)I would prefer this over Denny's on some days.Cons:1)Needs hot water.2)Don't forget the spoon/fork.3)It is easy to pour too much hot water. Be easy on the water at first.

What is R? If I am not mistaken, R stands for regression.This book isn't about using R for regression.The "data science" the authors refer to seems to involve analyzing data around basic ratios and graphs. At least for me, some of the codes provided using ggplot2 did not work properly using the downloaded datasets.Another point of annoyance: downloading the datasets used in this book required me to download and use GitHub, which to me is a sorry piece of software that I would otherwise never use. What a hassle that was.The book assumes you are already familiar with statistics. I specifically do not recommend this book for those who are trying to learn and understand regression using R.Pros:1)Fantastic examples on how to use the graphing features of R.2)Good breakdown of basic data analysis (not on regression).Cons:1)Scant information on statistics and R. Don't mistaken this book as a book on statistics (as "data science" implies).2)Does not focus on regression using R.

This SD card USED to be one of the fastest. Now it is merely adequate.I bought the 64GB version and inserted into my Samsung Galaxy S5 (latest Samsung phone).The performance, although still adequate, is less than stellar. For example, to load the Amazon Kindle app, which is about 35mb and I purposely placed it into this SD card, it takes about 7 full seconds to load. The same app on my iPad takes around 2 seconds to load.Still, if you aren't too much into your smartdevice performance, then I wouldn't worry. But if you do care about how fast your smartphone can take pictures (assuming your pictures are stored in SD cards) or how fast your apps will load, then you should purchase a much faster SD card for your latest phone.Pros:1)Adequate performance.2)Hassle free packaging.Cons:1)Not the fastest, but still adequate.

This is a great device if you want to improve your finger, hand, and forearm strength.This comes in 3 exerciser bands with 3 different strength levels. The weakest one is too weak for me. The medium level is hardly any work. The strongest level is a good exercise but I wish there is a 4th and even stronger level.These are expensive given that these are really glorified rubber bands.Pros:1)Comes with 3 bands with 3 different strength levels. But only the strongest level does anything for me.4)Effective in strengthening the fingers, hands, and forearms.Cons:1)Should come with a band that is one level stronger.2)Expensive given these are just glorified rubber bands.

This shoe is lightweight, waterproof, has great traction, and has the correct fit for size.Maybe the only thing I find somewhat lacking is arch support. This shoe is ideal, however, for those with low arch. If you have a high arch, then you should consider purchasing arch-support from Superfeet (I did).This is a great hiking shoe. I would also wear this in a heavy rain. This is not a gym shoe and probably not ideal for sports such as basketball.Pros:1)Lightweight2)Waterproof3)Fits very precisely4)Great tractionCons:1)Not Ideal for high arch feet. You may consider getting arch-support such as Superfeet if you are high-arched.2)Attracts dirt to its exterior and they are not easy to wash off. I have to scrub the dirt off.3)Not a particularly breathable shoe. My socks are definitely wet after long arduous hikes.

This book does a fabulous job of explaining the nuances of regression. What's more, it has even better questions that makes you really think about the regression output.Although the author touches on the non-linear models, he focuses mainly on the linear models (single and multivariate).The book could have used more samples. For example, what does the T-value for Betas represent and how are they calculated? What happens if the null value for B1 is non-zero? The book doesn't quite dig deep enough for advanced regression.Pros:1)Fabulous questions and explanations.2)Rich datasets for regression tools such as R and SAS.3)Focuses and covers linear regression very comprehensively.Cons:1)No instructions (or output) on how to use any popular regression software such as R, SAS, or Minitab.2)Most examples are provided only once. There should be more sample problems with answers.3)No answers to any of the questions at the end of the chapters.

If there is a herbal panacea, it would be ginseng.In oriental medicine, ginseng is widely used for variety of symptoms including increasing immunity, energy level, and boosting metabolism. It is widely prescribed to those who suffer from illness such as the flu and infections. In the ancient days, soldiers would carry precious ginseng root with them on long marches to battle. When they ran out of strength, they would eat the ginseng root which would revitalize them.Ginseng, however, is not prescribed to everyone. For those whose body temperature is considered slightly higher than normal (when people touch you, they say you feel warm/hot), then Ginseng is often not recommended. For those whose body temperature is considered slightly colder than normal (when people touch you, they say you feel cold), then Ginseng probably would help you more than most.This is the highest form of ginseng concentrate. It looks like thick gel with medium level viscosity. I take this once a day (2-3 servings per days are also considered OK), and this 240g bottle lasts about 7 weeks for me. The quality of ginseng in this bottle is considered the finest by many.Korea has been known to grow the best ginseng in the world since the ancient days. The reason is Korea is a peninsula with lot of ocean wind and moisture that flows into its mountainous geography. Those conditions are considered ideal for ginseng.If you find yourself frequently running out of energy and is highly susceptible to contagious diseases such as the common flu, then I recommend this product.So what has been the difference for me? Without taking this ginseng once a day, I cannot run 6 hours a week (one hour per day for 6 days) as I do now. Also, people say I have far better looking hair (thicker and healthier). Finally, I contracted a summer flu and I couldn't get sick because I had to make a speech in a few days. Once the symptoms showed, I began to drink this ginseng 5-6 times a day for about a week. The symptoms began to disappear immediately and all coughing and flu symptoms stopped after 5 days. I don't know of any flu medicine that could do that.Pros:1)Highest quality ginseng in a highly concentrated form.2)Highly recommended to those suffering from low energy and "cold" body temperatures (people say you have cold hands etc.).3)Known to boost immunity, metabolism, and longevity. Ginseng has traditionally been the most prized medicine for its healing effects.Cons:1)Expensive. It can easily amount to several dollars per day.2)Although not bad tasting, it is still an acquired taste.

This would be a good text for Marking 101 and 102.There is nothing here that is awe-inspiring, especially because I read this after I finished my MBA.The book does a great job of explaining the fundamentals (3C, 4P, SWOT) and brand management.The book isn't quantitative and I felt its case studies were little lacking in depth.Pros:1)Good coverage of fundamental concepts.2)Written well and concisely.Cons:1)Case studies were shallow in coverage.2)Very much qualitative.

In my opinion, this is the greatest Korean drama ever. Although I haven't seen every single Korean drama (it is impossible), I have seen quite a few in my lifetime. This drama, in my view, is the best of the very best.What makes this drama special? It is about so many things we hold dear that includes love between child and parents, love between teacher and student, love of food and medicine, and love of truth and honor. Most of all, this drama is about redemption.  In my view, to live a meaningful life, one must choose to live a difficult one. Dae Jang Geum displays that in the most masterful and compelling fashion.The acting is special. It isn't just Lee Young Ae (Jang Geum), but I felt Kyun Mi Ri (Lady Choi) who plays the antagonist gave the best performance of her career. In drama such as this, the antagonist must be as formidable as the protagonist and I felt the antagonist's performance was just superb.The writing is second to none. The writers, in my opinion, were very experienced and understood the nuances of power and politics. For example, despite all her special talents and superhuman perseverance and determination, Jang Geum couldn't achieve success alone. One of her special and critical abilities were her ability to develop relationships with the right teachers and sponsors. If you want to understand politics and power, then this drama should be seen just for that reason alone.This drama has been an international hit. It isn't quite as well known in the US and Europe, but it is practically a household name in virtually every other continent.I recommend this drama especially for children. It has no sex or violence. Yet, it teaches some of the most valuable lessons in life one could learn vicariously, even for adults.Pros:1)Superb storyline that is compelling. It is about overcoming all obstacles in life by turning crisis into opportunities. It is about love and redemption. To live a meaningful life, one must choose to live a difficult one.2)Superb acting. This drama has some of the best acting Korea has to offer. Many actresses were at the peak of their abilities when this drama was shot.3)Unforgettable characters. I just will never forget them.4)Hits on all cylinders except sex and violence (there is none).5)Great for children.6)Superb portrayal of the nature of politics and power.Cons:1)Takes about 5 episodes to get going.2)Goes little overboard in terms of number of persecutions Jang Geum has to face.3)Last 4 episodes drags on the series little too long.

If you already have a satisfactory flashlight for camping and hiking and other uses, then I don't recommend this flashlight as it will not provide a substantial upgrade. I had already owned a $12 flashlight which was comparable in size to this flashlight but also used Alkaline batteries. I can't say this flashlight is much better despite costing 4X as much.If you don't have a flashlight and is looking for a compact high quality flashlight and don't mind the cost of this flashlight, then I can recommend this flashlight. It is a very good flashlight with obviously high quality materials and construction.The problem with this flashlight is that it isn't quite as bright as some people have claimed. Even at its maximum 320 lumen, it is merely bright, but not impressively so. Lightsaber this flashlight is not. Don't expect this flash light to temporary blind animals who are on your prowl, for example.Pros:1)High quality material and construction2)4 levels of brightness.3)Easy to use.4)Compact and ideal size for hiking and camping5)The clip allows the flashlight be attached to a hat and it works great as a hat-flashlight.6)Long lasting.Cons:1)Bright but not impressively bright. I was little underwhelmed. This isn't much brighter than my equivalent sized $12 flashlight.2)Uses CR123 lithium batteries. That means you would have to make separate and expensive battery purchases to power this flashlight. The batteries are not included.3)Expensive.4)The power output is especially underwhelming if you consider the price of this flashlight and CR123 batteries.

If you want to know how to become a CIO and what being a CIO is like, then this book provides insights into individual CIOs.Although the book does a good job of covering lot of successful CIOs, what is lacking are the deep analysis on the business secrets of each individual. If you are looking for the story behind the CIOs, this book provides that. If you are looking for a deep analysis and 3-5 core lessons on how to become a successful CIO, then you would be disappointed.Pros:1)Good sampling of CIOs and their stories of on becoming a CIO and everyday and strategic CIO challenges.2)Written well with good fluid style.Cons:1)Not a deep analysis on the business secrets of CIOs. If you are looking for 3-5 golden rules of CIOs, then you might be disappointed.

I bought this shoe as a casual business shoe that is also waterproof. It fits that need quite nicely and I am very happy with it.The exterior is a surprisingly highly quality leather and gives it that business casual look. But the core design is a hiking shoe. You can clearly see this is in the soles. So this shoe strikes a nice balance.Contrary to some of the comments here, I think this shoe fits me quite fine. I wear US size 9 (Euro size 42) and this shoe fits my foot like a glove. Note, you would want a shoe that fits somewhat snugly because it will also expand slightly after break-in. That is especially true of a hiking shoe.Pros:1)Ideal waterproof business casual shoe. If you live in a climate that is constantly wet (rain or snow) and need a casual business shoe that will not get wet, then you have found the right shoe.2)Looks good with surprisingly high quality leather.3)Still a very capable hiking shoe when the need calls.4)Fits me exactly as expected. I wear size 9 and that size fits my foot like a glove.5)Very comfortable and ideal for mid-arched people like myself.Cons:1)The leather can be scratched against the rocks when hiking. So this isn't an ideal hiking shoe, but it is a still very capable one with very good traction and waterproofing. I just wouldn't use this shoe as a dedicated shoe for hiking.2)The shoestrings are little too long and not of the highest quality. But that can be quickly ameliorated by purchasing after-market shoe strings.

These are good batteries at a great price if they work. From my experience, I have noticed about 10% of the batteries are dead before I even use them. I think these batteries lose its energy quite a bit during storage.Overall, these are OK (not bad) batteries.Pros:1)Works great with long lasting life.2)Comes in trouble-free packaging that is mostly environment-friendly.3)Very cost effective.Cons:1)About 10% of batteries are duds.2)Doesn't handle long storage times very well.

This book strikes out in many ways.First, it only has 98 questions, which is really not enough to cover most of questions that can be asked of Oracle.Second, the book chooses questions which are hardly asked in most interview questions (how to configure SQLPlus etc.).Third, the answers to the questions are not always deep.I cannot recommend this book. There are better source of Oracle interview questions available for free on the internet.

What they say about SWIMS shoes is true. These are ridiculously larger than the stated sizes. Maybe these shoe sizes are Norway (where these shoes are designed) shoe sizes.I usually wear size 9. But I purposely ordered shoe size 8. This shoe, however, was WAY too large. Even though I normally wear size 9, I think even size 7 could be slightly too large for me.I did order one other SWIM shoe at size 8 and that was still 1/2 size little too large.On the plus side, these are fantastic looking shoes and should provide good waterproofing.Pros:1)High quality and elegant construction2)Mostly waterproof.Cons:1)WAY too large. Order two sizes or maybe even three sizes lower. I ordered one size lower and it was still way too large.

This flashlight is probably my brightest flashlight. It outshines my much larger LED flashlights.LED flashlights seems to follow an exponential curve when it comes to luminosity. I have noticed that today's flashlight can easily outshine even the best LED flashlights of 4 years ago. This is one of them.I have taken this to hiking and it works wonderfully. Yes, the blinking flash feature is somewhat quirky but it can be easily overriden (just click on it two more times).What is the difference between this flashlight and the much more expensive flashlights such as Nitecore and Surefire?Mainly, Nitecores and Surefire can discharge their light in a much more concentrated manner. Think light sabres in Star Wars. They are much brighter and if you direct it at someone's face, it can temporarily blind them, which is the reason why they are often used by Law Enforcement Officers.Overall, this is a more than adequate flashlight for almost everyone and for almost any needs.Pros:1)Cheap2)Very bright (not enough to temporarily blind someone).3)Uses AA battery.Cons:1)The strobelight (flickering light) turns on way too easily.

Who woulda thought??? For me, this is to romance what Stephen King's "The Stand" was to horror. Note I said TO ME. Others might feel differently but "The Stand" had a profound impact on me. Literally for years whenever I would go somewhere new, I'd think "What if..." This book made me feel a bit like that.Most of the time I keep my "What if" thoughts private because even my hubs who thinks I might have hung the moon will occasionally look askance at my wild meanderings so I can just imagine what someone who doesn't know me well would think.Ms Shay, I like the way you think! A time travel romance where the heroine travels so far back, the wheel isn't even invented yet.....really? And to make it from the cave guy's POV......BRILLIANT! I couldn't wait to keep turning the pages to see what happened next and I cried at the end and I think the last book that made me tear up was Old Yeller or perhaps Black Beauty when I was in first grade.I luffs Ehd, Luffs Bey! I think many authors would have just made such a situation ridiculous but for me, it was just right for the most part. Edh was simple in his thinking most of the time but he was all heart and he tried so hard to understand his mate. Heartwarming!I enjoyed this book immensely and will no doubt be covering Ms Shay Savage's back list. If they capture my attention even half as much, I would consider it money well spent indeed.Thanks for a fantastic read!

Just recently I made the decision to start avoiding artificial sweeteners. I'm a type 2 diabetic (diagnosed 3 years ago) so I didn't want to give up the fake stuff because some of the products it's in are all I can have and aren't available with more natural sweeteners. Another thing is I have to make most of the food I eat from scratch and sometimes I get TIRED of spending so much time on food!I probably don't drink 2 sodas a month because of the sodium and artificial sweeteners. I'm so HAPPY to see this brand that doesn't even have any artificial coloring in it. It's just clear with a clean, sweet taste. There might be a bit of an aftertaste but I hardly noticed it and even though this flavor (black cherry) isn't a huge favorite, I still really enjoyed it. It's very refreshing and satisfied my desire for something sweet in the evenings. It's got a light fruity flavor and isn't overly sweet as some products with sweeteners other than sugar seem to have.I'm definitely ordering the rainbow pack. I can't wait to try the root beer with a bit of no sugar added ice cream (if I can find any without artificial sweetener in it).I highly recommend giving this a try. Maybe just a six pack to start in case you're more sensitive to any aftertaste.Thank you to the Maker/Vendor and Amazon for giving me the chance to give this a try. Definitely going on my list of diabetic must haves.

To keep my feet soft and nice looking, once a week I use Emjoi Micro-pedi nano to get rid of the rough stuff and then I slather my feet with Eucerin Aquaphor Healing Ointment, then socks. I have to do this at bed time because the Eucerin - which works fabulously - is so greasy you really couldn't wear it during the day or I would think it might stain some types of shoes. The rest of the week, I had been using some Jergens after showering and that seemed to work pretty well.After using the Ahava, I like it better. I can use it whenever and not have to just save it for bed time. It makes my feet super soft and no slathering is required. A little goes a long way and it seems to soak in fast so I don't have to wait to finish getting dressed. I'm still going to have to use the Emjoi but now at least I can do my pedicure any time of day and won't have to try to remember to do it before bed.This one's a keeper for me.Thank you to Amazon and the Maker/Vendor for giving me the chance to try this out.

These cups are very like the red solo cups you see at tail gate parties or camping a lot.It says they hold 18 ounces however, that is almost to the very top of the cup with just a small margin around the rim. While you're carrying it, if it's full and you accidently squeeze the sides, it'll cascade over the top. To me, it comfortably holds around 14-16 ounces.I regularly buy these cups and use them for eating soup out of or mixing scrambled eggs, etc as well as drinking out of. I'm a T2 diabetic so I have to make a lot of my food from scratch to stay on the diabetic "wagon" so when it comes to dirty dishes, it's like 5 people live here instead of just my husband and I so anything that means I don't have so many dishes to wash is a very good thing.If we drink liquids out of these then I rinse and use at least once more but if I eat soup or even at time, spaghetti or whatever, then it goes into the garbage. Another added benefit is if we're in the middle of a movie, these are very easy to carry into the livingroom and eat out of them. In fact, to me it's easier than trying to balance a plate on my lap, just make sure whatever you're having isn't super hot because you'll definitely feel it through the cup.These cups are very useful for lots of different things. I feel sort of bad about using so much plastic, but I feel even worse getting stuck doing great gobs of dishes every day and I use my own market bags to save on paper/plastic at the grocery so that kind of evens things out right?No doubt I'll buy more of these in the future.Thank you Amazon and the Maker/Vendor for allowing me to give these a try.

I have been using a sonicare toothbrush for about the past 18 months or so. Around 6 weeks or maybe 2 months ago, I had my teeth cleaned. At that time, I asked the dental tech if she noticed any difference in the scale on my teeth. She consulted my chart and said "Not too much. You tend to accumulate scale a bit faster than average".  I was disappointed because I thought the Sonicare would help with that.I like the Sonicare well enough except it's intense and when I brush the backs of my front teeth, I have to hold the bridge of my nose because the vibration will make me want to sneeze and it's not good to sneeze with a mouthful of saliva and toothpaste. Big mess.I probably would have just continued to use my sonicare because it was costly and it does work better than a manual toothbrush but then Vine offered me this set of Spinbrushes. I've used Spinbrushes in the past and LOVED them! I like that they are battery operated so no charging. If I'm away from home and it begins to run down, I just change the batteries. If the sonicare brush quits at home then I have to finish using a manual toothbrush. I never have that happen with the Spinbrushes.I also like that they have both a round head and the rectangular section. I feel like I'm brushing a greater area so in the two minutes I take to brush, I'm covering more "ground" than I do with the Sonicare which has a very small, almost child sized rectangular brush area. Also, the Spinbrushes don't make me want to sneeze and are not so intense as to be uncomfortable.Since my dental hygienist didn't notice a huge difference between the Spinbrush (which was what I used before sonicare) and my sonicare, I'd rather use the Spinbrush.This set includes Arm & Hammer Truly Radiant toothpaste (which we really like), two brushes and two extra heads so this will last me probably about 5-6 months before I have to buy more heads and in the past, I've had the Spinbrush base last literally a couple of years. Lots of times I just replaced them because I wanted a different color or they came out with a new style that I wanted to try.If you tend not to accumulate scale at an above average rate like I do, maybe the sonicare would help you better but I prefer the Spinbrush and most likely that's what I'll be using for a long time to come. They are reasonably priced, I can easily find the replacement heads where I live and I like not having to charge them and especially since there is only one lonely plugin in my bathroom and it's always taken up with other appliances.I highly recommend these.

My husband works hard and sweats a lot while at work. Since he works out doors, in the summer, I get him white t-shirts. I generally wait until I've got a few in the laundry and wash them using hot water and a bit of bleach to get the yellowish underarm stains out that are sometimes left on the shirt and that regular detergent won't budge. I notice that using the bleach seems to shorten the life span of the shirts eventually and after a few washes, they sometimes start developing those tiny pin holes in them. I've tried using detergent boosters in place of the bleach like Borax or Oxiclean and they just don't work as well as bleaching.I washed several of the white shirts using this Whisk deep clean and the stains definitely lightened. They didn't completely disappear but I think if I washed them again it would help and using this detergent from the get go when the stains are still very light, might have taken care of the problem completely with the added benefit that this Whisk is not hard on the material in the way bleach is.Though my husband doesn't like this scent as well as Gain detergent, he liked it well enough to keep using these Whisk pods. Also, I don't have to babysit the load like I do when I use bleach. I don't trust my washer to dispense the bleach like it should so I have to fill first, add the bleach, let the washer agitate a minute to mix and then add the clothes. Plus, no bleach scent on the clothes either.I like this enough to keep using. I still might have to bleach once in awhile (time will tell with that) but I think it will keep those ugly stains away much longer than my regular detergent and that will extend the life of the cotton tee's.

I took these as directed, starting out with one per day for a week and then going to two the second week.The first week I couldn't feel a thing. I have T2 diabetes, am going into menopause and have a thyroid that's off. All of that and my meds cause fatigue so some days I'm exhausted from the time I get up through the day. One tab of these was no match for my fatigue.The second week, I did notice a little energy but it was too little and unfortunately, there was a much bigger "crash" feeling as it wore off. I can't be having a crash and dealing with my already (sometimes) giant economy-sized fatigue.Bottom line: Just not working for me. May work better for someone younger without any health issues as I described above.

I like this balm. My hair is fine and sometimes flyaway and I have just enough curl that I can't just leave it, I either have to curl it more or straighten with a flat iron. The balm does tame my flyaways and my hair is super straight when I finish blowing it dry and flat ironing it. To me, this compares favorably with John Frieda Frizz Ease so if you like that, this might work for you as well.I have to say, I didn't particularly like the fragrance of this product. It dissipates to a more bearable level by the time I've blown my hair dry and straightened it. I can still smell it but it's not quite so overpowering and I don't feel like it will compete with whatever perfume I have on. Someone would have to get pretty close to you to smell it once your hair is dried and styled.This seems like it leaves my hair shinier than what I get with the Frizz Ease however, I think if I was using this on a regular basis, I would probably need to use a clarifying shampoo after every 4-5 uses of the Tresemme balm because I think eventually it'll build up on hair and this doesn't make me hate the product because lots of hair products build up eventually so I wouldn't let that aspect keep me from buying.The consistency of this product is sort of like syrup and it goes along way so apply with a bit of caution until you see how much you need to get the result you want. Better to have a little to little than too much has been my experience.I am going to continue to use my Frizz Ease or Fekkai Prx oil but for times when I really want some shine then I'd use this product again.Bottom Line: Regarding price, performance and scent and the fact that it does leave my hair nice and shiny, I would give this 3.75 stars

I think the taste of this is okay but I have a lot of reservations about everything else about it.1. The rice is sort of mushy to me and not as firm as I'm used to when I cook rice.2. Not a particularly healthy choice. In 9 ounces of food there are 44 grams of carbs and 890 mg of sodium and you can really taste the salt. For me, it's almost too salty to eat. You could cut the salt by adding a little chopped tomato or something like that but the point of a ready meal is so that you don't have to do any work to it. Just heat and eat. Maybe if I liked this a bit more, I'd be more willing to doctor it up but for me, it's like putting lipstick on a pig.3. As of today, it's over seven smackers per pound and that seems like a lot to me. You could hit the local deli and get a decent sized salad which would be healthier (and to me tastier).Nutrition Info:230 calories1.5 g fat10 mg cholesterol890 mg sodium44 g carbs2 g fiber4 g sugarIf I were still in my twenties and working two jobs like I used to, I would probably look on this with more favor but when I consider consistency of rice, cost, taste, carbs and sodium, it's just not for me.

My husband offered me one of these squares and dummy me went ahead and took one. I don't really have much of a sweet tooth but ever since I had that one square about 3 weeks ago, I want MORE! Every time I go to the store I have to tell myself "Don't do it!". I have T2 diabetes so this just isn't going to be a regular item on the menu.I don't know what it is about them because I don't feel this way about peanut butter cups or peanut butter M&M's or any other peanut butter candy I've had or even regular snickers which I like to don't have any problems doing without them. These are just creamy, yummy, good to me. I could probably have one or two of these squares a week and be okay but they're so good that I doubt I could stay out of them. Might buy a bag and have the hubs hide them....lol Do they make lock boxes with timers for candy??
May I just say.... WORTH EVERY PENNY SPENT!!!! BUT FROM EZ ELECTRONICS!!!!!!!

Argh......... Now lets see here....... I am going to give you guys a TRUE review of this game and hopefully I do not get hate for this review. I have played many JRPGs and this games COMPLETELY matches a JRPG. If you TRULY love JRPGs then BUY this game, I guarantee that you will LOVE it. I, on the other hand love the game!!! It has VERY CREATIVE and COLORFUL graphics NOT GREAT graphics. I seen on another review that this game had horrible graphics and they compared this game to zelda, uncharted, and some other NON NON NON NON NON NON JRPGs....... This game is made to have lower quality graphics, but they look and feel better than what zelda or uncharted has to offer. I am not going to review the story or gameplay because you can just go LOOK IT UP OR WATCH VIDEOS BEFORE YOU BUY THIS GAME!!  I give this game a solid 4/5. it is not a perfect 5 stars because I have played better JRPGs. But if you love JRPGs then BUY this game. It is a MUST have for your collection. If you are one of those (waaaaa!!! the graphics are too corny and unrealistic for me to be wasting my time playing) then you should not have bought this game and you should not have put a negative review towards this game. The hype on this game is legit. It is a WONDERFUL JRPG. But when you start comparing it to games like Skyrim, Persona, Uncharted, Zelda..... it does make this game look bad. All of those other games are DIFFERENT STYLED GAMES!!!!! They were intended to have better graphics with less color variations, while Wrath of The White Witch is intended to have lesser quality graphics but with extreme variation in colors. Comparing this game to Uncharted is like comparing Mortal Kombat X to Mario Party....... TWO COMPLETELY DIFFERENT STYLED GAMES!!!!!! Hopefully you wonderful people have read this review and will buy this game lol I honestly recommend it for everyone to try. This game is totally amazing!! and I recommend it to all gamers!!!!!!

First of all this deck is overpriced.Second of all this deck is JANK.Third of all these cards can be bought in the 6 dollar structure deck. (now the structure deck is even cheaper since it is old)Fourth I can buy all of this stuff with a 20 dollar bill.Fifth of all this is a HORRIBLE deck build.Sixth of all six samurais HAVE to have Naturia Beast and Naturia Barkion.(which this overpriced deck does not come with) Seventh f allSeventh of all both of the Naturia cards are around the 5 dollar range.........(if you buy the structure decks and the two naturias separate then you will save around 30 to 40 dollars........Eighth of all the structure deck called Samurai Warlords comes with EVERYTHING you need to make a really good six samurai deck.Ninth of all I have this deck and know what I am talking about.Tenth of all these are the Extra deck cards you need: Shi-En, Naturia Beast, Naturia Barkion, 3 or 4 of ANY level 4 rank monster, Crimson Blader, Stardust Dragon, Black Rose Dragon, Leo Keeper Of The Sacred Tree, Ally Of Justice Catastor, Armades, Keeper of Boundaries, and maybe a Mist Wurm. And whatever other cards you want in the extra deck.Eleventh of all Black Rose Dragon, Stardust Dragon, Armades, Keeper Of Boundaries, and Mist Wurm are pricey cards. BUT Black Rose Dragon is getting a reprint as a TIN PROMO in a few months.....so it will go from 20 dollars to a 2 dollar card. :D Stardust Dragon was a 20 dollar card but it got a reprint as a promo and is around 2 to 3 dollars........ but The Black Rose Dragon reprint will be coming in October. But you DO NOT HAVE TO USE IT TO WIN. It just helps you win.Twelfth of all if you want to use a level 7 Synchro instead of Black Rose Dragon then you can use a card called Scrap Archfiend. It has 2700 attack but it has no ability. But you can destroy almost any monster in the game with it. :D Scrap Archfiend is only like 1 or 2 dollars. It is better at times than Black Rose Dragon is. Armades, Keeper Of Boundaries is a 20 dollar card. And it WILL MOST LIKELY get a reprint in the yugioh MEGA-TINS. The tins are coming out on August 29, 2014 THIS YEAR!!!!!.Thirteenth of all is that the mega tins MIGHT reprint number 101 silent honors ark, dracossack, number 11 big eye, and exciton knight. The four cards I just mentioned are 30 dollars or higher.Fifteenth of all DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY ON THIS CRAPPY DECK. IT IS NO GOOD AND YOU WILL NEVER WIN ANY TOURNAMENT WITH IT........ JUST WAIT A LITTLE LONGER GUYS I PROMISE IT WILL BE WORTH YOUR TIME!!!!!!THANKS FOR READING THIS REALLY LONG REVIEW, BUT IF YOU DID READ IT, YOU LEARNED SOME VALUABLE THINGS. IF YOU JUST SKIPPED TO THE ENDING AND ARE READING THIS. YOU NEED TO GO BACK AND READ ALL OF THIS. :D ALSO THE MAIN DECK HE HAS IS ALL WRONG ALSO. LOOK ON YOU TUBE FOR A SIX SAMURAI DECK LIST.

Hello! I got this for my PSP 3000 and it fitted perfectly, below I'll explain what people want to know.It covers the ENTIRE PSP 3000, except for the L/R and other buttons of course.It has a flap for the Screen and the UMD Drive.It has a stand on the bottom so you can watch/play movies/games.Very durable, nice and is really clear so there is no problem with the light glaring into like some people have said.It's cheap at the cost of $4.70 (well when I bought it, that is).Just to make sure you get a legitimate one, buy from "Everydaysource", I bought one from them and it came in fast and was in a box. I don't think it will fit on the PSP 1000 or 2000 but it DOES fit the 3000 very nicely with no shaking or rattling. Highly recommended!

Okay, I played this game and with all my heart, tried to love it. I am a hardcore DBZ fan and I waited so long to play this, just to see:Bad Graphics (I know graphics don't mean everything, but this is the time for PS4s/XB1s/PS3/360s, it needs at least good graphics)Bad Gameplay (The story is terrible and yes I know, they had to change it but I do not like it. They can't write a story worth looking at)Bad Fighting Mechanics (All you do is press the Triangle (on the PS3) button and... You just hit three times and you teleport to where they are at.)Looks like play doughNot funBoring and blandOverall, please do not buy this game, I promise you it will be a total waste of money. If you would like to get a truly fun game, go and check out Dragon Ball: Raging Blast or Dragon Ball: Raging Blast 2. I have both of these games and they are fantastic. :)This game should not be worth the price it is at, if I was to sell my copy I'd sell it for around 10. Overall, my rating on this poor excuse for a Dragon Ball/Z/GT game an ultimate 1-10.

Hello! I just started playing Pokemon (TCG and Video Games) again after the ending of HeartGold and SoulSilver and kept on trying to find reviews on decks that would be good or not. So I decided to go and try them out myself just to be for sure. Please note that I like playing out fast combos and dealing massive damage but if you aren't that type of player, then you might want to try decks out yourself until you find one that you'll like. I only tried theme decks from Next Destinies and now to make sure they are all safe to use (because of the list, it says you must only play with cards from Next Destinies and up) so you do not worry if the deck is not able to be used competitively or not. I have found that this is the best theme deck for my liking since you are able to search the dragons you need (mainly Garchomp) with Gabite's Ability "Dragon Call". It's a pretty nice Ability to have and get the deck combo pieces going ASAP. I used this against people at my locals who play competitively and have topped, especially because of Gabite and Milotic being able to do so many searches and end the game pretty fast. This deck only come with one Milotic and two Feebas so I'd suggest three Feebas and 2 Milotic, I added those in for the upcoming tournament (this Saturday) and it has done even better. Also, for the cheap price of Emolga (full art from Legendary Treasures) you can get even more cards onto the Bench (well Basic Pokemon that is) but you are, for sure, then able to evolve ASAP without hoping for a top deck. Happy battling trainers!! :D
