The battery life is very decent as well, I've used this on numerous tasks in the garage and under the sink for long periods of time for my winterization prep without any issues.The order is shipped with a cable and USB charging port, both separate from the actual Nitecore headlamp by the seller.I received a discounted price on this in exchange for an unbiased review

This is an excellent all-in-one kit for sewing up small tears and popped buttons. Comes with everything you need bundled up into a tiny package. I've actually tossed out my jumbled sewing kit (massive box with random bits in it), as this includes thread splicer, scissors, multiple threads, measuring tapes, needles and other assortments of pins, loops and even a thimble. I already used this to patch up a small tear in the lower seams of a t-shirt that got caught in a zipper while hiking, and a popped button on a cheap pair of shorts that I like.Highly recommended kit for any place, as it can fit unobtrusively anywhere.I received this product in exchange for an unbiased review.

Great kitchen clean-up towels. A 13 pack will last me two weeks for constantly cleaning up in the kitchen for food prep, spills, general cleaning and wipe-down after a day's worth of cooking meals. The towels are no-frills, large towels that can wipe down and hold up to some serious use on a constant basis. I keep a small bin to toss the used towels in, and wash them on warm/cold cycles with bleach before drying on low heat for a half cycle and hanging for the rest to prevent shrinkage over time. This keeps them looking new (albeit the blue line is fading).An excellent addition for any kitchen enthusiast who loves a clean cooking space.I received these towels in exchange for an unbiased review.

I didn't use this for a SUP, but rather a wave cresting kayak design from the early 90's during a refit project.My kayak has no trekking fins, and so it tends to spin around if you're not paying careful attention to your strokes. To fix this, I purchased this single fin, and cut it down significantly (about 4 inches remaining) into a stubby fin. I added a connection platform to easily insert and remove the fin from the boat for transportation ease and the whole thing treks much more solidly now when in the water.This is good, dense and non-brittle plastic that can take a beating against rocks, sand and pebbles easily. I doubt it will ever crack prior to breaking, but rather just scuff along nicely while you pound and abuse it. Excellent product.I received this product in exchange for an unbiased review

Excellent batteries for the gopro. Fit in flush with no jiggling or shoving, and include the pull tab to pull the battery out of the housing quickly.They charge up fast and have a comparable capacity compared to the brand-name battery but at a fraction of the price.I keep both batteries sealed up in a zip-loc bag and toss them into a small case for when I'm out filming quad-footage, these two batteries give me more than enough battery life for flying 2-3 hours with the camera on at all times.Charging works well, I can either charge them inside the gopro, or use my dual-charger to charge both batteries at once. No overheating while charging, and the batteries stay fresh until use.I received these batteries at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.

This is an interesting pair of shears that we've been using to trim our apple trees before the winter.The premise is that you cut through chunk by chunk with a ratchet style shear, meaning each time it clicks and you reset the blade, you're getting more leverage out of the strength you put into the squeeze.Think of it like riding a single speed bike versus a bike with several gears. The bike with more gears is more versatile because it lets you bike up hills more easily. This is the same idea with these shears. It really did make things easier to cut, though getting used to the ratcheting portion took a while. After about a month of using them, they are still holding up well. The blades do dull quickly, so I've had to sharpen several times, but otherwise they work well for medium-duty pruning jobs, up to one inch in diameter.I received this product in exchange for an unbiased review.

This has been working flawlessly to replace the drum in our office's oki printer. Pages come out extremely crisp, toner is dark and beautiful looking. No issues with smudging or flaking of toner, no shadowing or leaks. Everything works as is and the printer had no problem accepting a third party drum.Just make sure you pull off all the tabs and wrappings before you start it up.You should also harvest the old toner from your old cartridge. I took paper and lined it up inside of the box the drum shipped in, then dumped the contents of the old drum onto the paper. There is a LOT of toner inside, I just poured it back into the toner cartridge before installing it all into the printer, and tossed the toner-filled box into the recycling.

This is a solid office mouse. I would NOT use it for gaming as sometimes the tracking jumps/lags for FPS games, however for office use, I have not had any issues at all. I had originally used it temporarily as a gaming mouse at home, but ended up bringing it to the office to replace my wired Logitech mouse that was starting to show its age. This has held up wonderfully, and after several weeks I have also noticed the clicking is softer and the wheel movement much more smooth.This is basically a logitech mouse design with a smaller profile, wireless and lightweight. The side buttons are great for going back/forward while browsing folders/the internet, and the wireless design is certainly a step up in keeping my desk clutter to a minimum. Battery life is good, I have not yet replaced it after 8+ hours five days a week for quite some time.I received this for free in exchange for an unbiased review.

This is a simple, nearly universal and robust design that can fit nearly any toilet in just a few minutes. Make sure you have a wrench to unscrew the nuts, and secure it properly again after installing.The anchor point that goes below the seat is much thicker than I had anticipated, as a result my toilet seat sits at a slightly obtrusive angle. I may purchase mounts so it sits evenly again, but for now it's not too bad.The spray is activated by the knob on the side, working like a spigot. Turn it to open and the water comes through and does its job. When you're satisfied with the care, you shut it off again and the spray springs back into its closure. Very hygienic and very easy to use.While I do like this unit and think it works admirably well, I did have to remove a star due to the thick mounting plate. Other models I have seen have used thinner mount plates with no ill effects except to be more streamlined.I received a unit at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.

The cables received did not look anything like what was shown in the pictures. The ones I got look like any ordinary old fashioned cable, squarish and blocky. They did arrive safely in a plastic bag, and the one foot length was what I was looking for to run some items in my computer cubby, but I just wanted to make it clear to people purchasing that currently you are going to receive an older style looking cable, not the ones you see in the photos. So think twice before you commit to purchasing!I received these cables for free in exchange for an unbiased review.

I think the blacklight is a little misleading, but it does do the job correctly in that you are able to detect stains, more or less. The previous owner of my house owned a cat, and we found old stains related to her cat vomiting or other random oddities. While gross, we used bacterial cleansers on those areas (and to our horror saw they were completely ineffective).I did have a dog at one point, and the areas he peed by accident definitely get picked up by this light. So it does work, but not as well as a true blacklight would, which if you're looking for stains for removal, may be overkill. This flashlight will suffice, is energy efficient and durable.I received this product in exchange for an unbiased review.

I received the Cutting A style. The scissors arrive in a cheap (but handy) case capable of holding two scissors, with cloth that folds over one to protect them from hitting one another and causing abrasions.I've begun cutting my own hair, and I use a Wahl electric trimmer to do my back and sides, and these scissors for the front, tops and around the ears when I need to cut precisely. The cutting action is SMOOTH. Scissors are razor sharp, and you can adjust the speed they cut at with a turning knob on the side. Right means more pressure and slower cut, left opens it up for quick snips.I wipe down with a damp towel, then buff with a clean towel after to keep it in good shape. Haven't had to do it yet but a drop of oil in the rivet will keep the scissors running super smooth for years to come. Really great looking scissors.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for my unbiased feedback.

So during the summer we did use this to grill once. Took a moment for it to heat up and start grilling, which it did. The mat helps keep the moisture in, prevents things from blackening too much and prevents stuff such as thinner veggies from falling through the grate. I was concerned about the seeping of material into the food but we could not tell the difference.I took one unused mat and cut it to the size of my toaster oven. This protects it from scuffs when we place trays on top of it for storage. The outside heats up a lot, and this is the perfect item to put on top to prevent further abrasions.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for my unbiased feedback.

Good, musky beard oil that comes with a dropper. I can't tell you how important it is to have a dropper when it comes to oil products! Everything is so much cleaner, and you can be precise with your usage.This bottle will last you a long time, depending on how big your beard is. The dropper lets you limit your use, and that's good because the oil IS scented, and you don't want to to be overpowering to yourself and others. I think it works well, it does not gum up like some other oils, and lasts the full day, washes out well and is generally very little hassle. Having tried other beard oils so far, I would say this ties in terms of quality against the Gentleman's Beard Oil, which I also gave a positive review to. If you like scents though, go with this one.I received this product in exchange for an unbiased review.

I'm not going to say I "LOVE" it, however I can't give this product less than 5 stars, because while it is lackluster in shape and design, it performs exactly as intended. This is one of the few chargers I've charged using a USB charge meter that gets within 95% of its capacity from a zero charge. I used it to charge up my OnePlus One and a Fire Phone from zero charge and it still had some charge remaining.There is a small flashlight integrated into the unit, which on a full charge should probably outlast even you in a survival situation, though I doubt the unit is waterproof (in fact, don't even try it, I know that it isn't)The battery is lightweight, a little larger than I would have expected from an 8,400mah battery (2x bigger than Anker's 6000mAh slim battery), but completely serviceable as a day pack battery kit to carry around with you on a commute or day hike. Charges fine, runs cool, and the backup battery isn't a bad touch when you're in a pinch.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.

This bag is super cool. It's thick, has a strap and hardpoints, all excellent for kayaking or attaching to any craft. You can even store food in this and hoist it up in the air to protect from wildlife. I have a similar bag by Sea to Summit that is nearly the exact same quality, but you can bet the price was much higher, with the difference of only a few hard sealed hardpoints for attachments.The bag rolls up via friction clamping, so air leaks out a little over time, but it is hard for water to leak in. This bag can easily take on rain, is submersible at times and will float indefinitely, the seams are sealed tight, and the bag is THICK. You can throw tools in this thing without buffers and it wouldn't mind (though I don't recommend it due to longevity fears). The yellow is great for locating in the dark. The TITAN text is pretty cool, too. As a note, the more you roll it up, the better the waterproof capability is, but the less storage you actually get.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.

Installation was easy. Would have liked if there had been a leveling bar available on the unit, but I had one myself so getting the unit straight was good. You should make sure that the angle is exactly at 90 degrees, mine was a little off so I put a small wooden shim to get the it put into position.Once installed, the light is discreet during the day at the entrance to my house, but shines brightly enough at night to illuminate the entire entryway. The light is bright white, which I don't particularly enjoy (I prefer warm whites, easier on the eyes) but it's still better than nothing, and I don't need to leave the front light open now if I go out, since this will turn on when I use my keys, or when visitors arrive to ring the doorbell.I live in Seattle, and so far the light has operated each day. Granted, it does not turn on often, however I'm sure at least the solar panel on top is able to top it off easily as a result.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.

I was ecstatic to be able to purchase this for my friend, who is just about five months pregnant. She had originally purchased a tiny one since she has a petite frame, however it quickly became obvious that it was not good enough for her - it was literally a kid's sized pillow. This one is full size, capable of probably comfortably fitting someone up to 5'10" comfortably on it with its many uses.The pillow DOES come with a case, a zipper style that opens up a very large opening, which is perfect for those who will bother washing the outside for the drool and oils that deposit themselves each night. Not sure why they decided to make the pillows white, but whatever.The pillows DO arrive completely smashed into a tiny box- open it up, fluff it up and pay special attention to the center, where it's completely crushed in. After a few hours of rest the pillow should be at its full size.My friend really does like this, she sleeps with her head in one of the nooks, her back to the long portion (to keep her from shifting onto her back, this was a huge issue for her) and the bottom loop between her legs for support.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.

I'm disappointed in the knife, and Kershaw in general. The photos are not particularly accurate - the handle is more brightly teal in person than compared to the photos, and feels very brittle and cheaply molded. My knife had a substantial burr of plastic sticking out on the locking mechanism that I had to shave away before I could even close the knife without it cutting into my finger. I would have liked this better if the handles were slightly rubberized.The blade itself is okay - it's sharp, but nothing stunningly so. Paper does not slice cleanly out of the box, and so to achieve the razor sharpness, a run through another sharpener would be required.I decided to return the knife back after only a day; this knife is not up to par with Kershaw's usual quality. I have a Ken Onion and Skyline to my name, and they are much better quality than the Shuffle. Then again, this blade is under $20, so I understand that corners had to be cut. But I'd much rather had paid a bit more money for better scales than to be disappointed in this.

I gave this set to my parents to use as they've gone almost a full decade without a decent paring knife, and their peelers are laughably ancient. The difference it makes for their food prep is astonishing. I no longer have to worry that they'll cut themselves doing fine work on their food prep with large and dull, unwieldy stamped knives, compared to the sharpness of ceramic knives.A quick warning about ceramic wares, NEVER use the flat side of the blade (eg crushing garlic), NEVER reuse the knife if it drops to the floor, even if it looks okay. Microfractures can occur, and a catastrophic failure in the knife can happen at any time while in use, causing the knife to shatter. That's the last thing you want to happen while cutting veggies.The quality of both knife and peeler are good. The handles are cheapish plastic, but the ceramic blades are sharp, well polished and sell formed. The knife cuts through vegetables and fruits cleanly and effortlessly, and the fruit peeler can get through apples and potatoes really fast. Both are easy to wash, even in the dishwasher (but rinse them first to remove solid residues, those tend to like to stick to ceramic)I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.

I've used Shibari, or better yet, Liquid Silk in the past but was offered to try out the Luxx Beauty lubricant.The immediate difference between this is that it is more 'runny' initially compared to Shibari, which has a more silky, grippy texture. This changes quickly as it goes from liquidy to tacky after just a few minutes, as though it is absorbing and just leaving behind the rest of the ingredients. No reapplication was required, however I felt more friction than I was accustomed to compared to LS or Shibari.While LS is unavailable cheaply in the US still, I think I still prefer Shibari over the Luxxx.One nice thing to note, while Shibari always arrives leaking, this one arrived completely dry with no issues. It is also more discrete than shibari or LS, so I'm not as concerned with its storage.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.

This is a decent product. It's hard to switch back between one or another quickly, as the entry-ways close up quick. In terms of lubrication retention, the ribbed interrior does help keep lube in place, but near the entrance starts to get clingy only after a few minutes, requiring re-lube which takes away from the act.In terms of comfort, I would say this is average or below, I am still a fan of the Tenga flips, as nothing else so far has compared to them so far. The smell of this product is also very strong, and requires several washes before it comes down to a less noticeable odor. Hard to dry out the interior, so let it sit somewhere unobtrusively before storing to let out all the moisture.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.

Used this in my trip to Alaska over a weekend. Kept my head warm overnight without being overbearing or too hot. During the day it did get warm (driving and hiking) to wear so I removed it then. The 'neff' label is a little loose but hasn't drooped or come off, and does go back when the beanie is stretched over your head.I machine wash in a garment bag and air-dry on a clothesline. I've done this three times so far and the beanie still looks brand new. Smoke smell from fires are easily washed away.

This is a very cheap and disappointing product. The design and concept is great - a joystick and pad that can switch from game mode to regular pointer mode. However, there is no support for anything other than a camera, directions are vague and poorly phrased, and the buttons only correspond to physical buttons on your phone, if you should even be so lucky.I could not get this to work on anything. Apparently there is a secondary appstore where some minor homebrew apps can use the controller, but I am not going to do that, I would prefer being able to use my own apps, thank you.

I received the queen sized gray sheets, and holy crap. Out of the bag they were incredibly soft, but I still went ahead to wash them on cold, and tumble dry on low heat for 40 minutes with wool balls. When they came out, they were even softer and a little "fluffy" feeling. The fit was fine (I have a 6 inch mattress with a 2 inch memory foam pad) with the fitted sheet, my pillows (bamboo covered shredded foam) are standard size, so they actually were a little dwarfed by the pillow case. As a reminder, you only get TWO pillow cases. Not sure why the photo shows four. You will get a fitted sheet, standard sheet and two pillow cases in the package.Sleeping in this is crazy luxurious. I did not have super high expectations, so this was beyond what I was expecting. My previous sheets are from Target, and now I'm considering getting a second one two swap around with. These are cool initially, but become appreciably warm after you've settled in, which will be much enjoyed during the winter. I think the gray color looks really urban and modern. If I do purchase another one it'll be the red color.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.

It's taken me a while (a long while) but I've finally found an external battery pack that actually charges to full capacity in a reasonable amount of time.Most other external batteries do NOT charge fully, and their charging indicators flash for hours at a time. The EasyAcc battery here arrived full, and after discharging it across my devices (simultaneously charging a OnePlus One, Nexus 7 2nd Gen and Fire Phone!) it charged up in a few hours to full capacity again. Not bad at all.The batteries in this are flat pack li-ions, a higher quality than stuffing in several 18650 cells into an enclosure with a board and calling it a day, this is an actual quality external battery pack.There is only one button to press, which shows the charge on a very small set of LED lights. Apart from that, the entire thing is just smooth plastic (which scuffs easily, mind you, and I doubt if it has ANY IPX rating) which is sleek new, but has gathered quite a bit of minor scuffing from going in and out of my backpack and one overnight trip so far. This will replace my Sentey 20800mah battery, as it is lighter by about 30% and has a smaller footprint, with a still-respectable battery capacity, which will easily last a weekend of hiking. I have added two silicon wrist-bands to keep it elevated off surfaces and prevent further scuffing.I received this device at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.

Everyone already knows the pro's to this monitor. I know them very well, as I am using it right now. It's a beautiful monitor, and while I was hesitant about the price, what with all prices falling quickly for non-freesync variants, I think it is well worth it.That said, let me outline issues people may/will encounter using this monitor. For reference, I am on Windows 10, Radeon HD7950 (upgrading to R9 390 for freesync!)1 - If you have a 79xx GPU, freesync will NOT work. You will need to either downgrade or upgrade to a compatible card. Freesync is only compatible with those cards for video playback, gaming will not work. Learned this the hard way, to read better.2 - When my computer goes to sleep, all the windows resize to around 800x600 resolution and get jammed up into the top left. Not sure why this happens. The monitor also starts searching for an active input, which could explain the issues. I have not yet looked to see if I can disable auto-scan functions.3 - Loud humming noise in game mode, or other variants. The monitor makes a concerning humming noise when I switch into game mode. I switched out quickly, and will troubleshoot this further to see if it's just a glitch or a defect.4 - The stand is huge. I have almost 10 inches of space between the back of the monitor and my wall. My desk is shallow, so it takes up a lot of my available space.5 - If you don't sit at a perfect distance, the edge pixels actually overlay the bezel, from the curve. It's a weird and disorienting sensation.That said, I absolutely LOVE this monitor in spite of all the imperfections. I am coming from 3x 26.5" 1200p monitors, and this feels so much cleaner on my desk. It's an absolute beauty, and the real estate is fantastic. Gaming has never been as beautiful to me as it is using this monitor. I used my 3x monitor setup since 2008, who knows how long I'll keep this one? It's certainly the holy grail of monitors right now, unless you're an nvidia card user, in which case you should look at the ROG G-sync tech instead.

I purchased this for my first aid kit to keep in my car. We tested it out several times on ourselves with decent results. The build quality itself is nothing particularly special- in fact, the unit feels incredibly cheap, and opening the clamp makes me worried the whole thing will fall apart. That said, it did NOT fall apart, and the readings were accurate enough for the unit to qualify going into my car's med kit. It IS larger than I had anticipated, especially with the silicon cover, however I had the space, so there it goes.The LED screen is crisp, though the "waves" at the bottom almost seem gimmicky, I suppose it's more of just a visual cue for patterns than anything else. Data values update quickly, basically instantaneously, really. If the build quality had been better (higher grade plastic?) then I would've found this item to be much more exceptional than it already is.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.

Solid oil diffuser. One common misconception is that the steam is all oil - this is untrue, and if you think otherwise, make sure you read the instructions prior to use, or you'll likely destroy your diffuser in one go.The light diffuser stands out from others in that it can change colors, is aesthetically pleasing to the eye, and has a built in timer, letting you control how long it should run for, and what "mood" to set with the lights. I thought it would be gimmicky, but being able to switch from soft yellow to cool blue (I don't care much for the other colors) is really nice. The aroma was able to waft through an entire room (helped by people passing through the area to blow the scent around). The smell disappears quickly enough, though I make sure to air out the floor before the end of the day so there's no residue left.A BIG warning, do NOT use this on top of fabric or wood. You will damage it via moisture. Instead, elevate it on a plate, piece of tile, or put it on plastic/glass/tile counters. Do NOT use it near walls or under cabinets. This is constantly releasing steam with oil particulates. Don't be reckless!I received this product in exchange for an unbiased review.

KEEP MOIST!That's the key to keeping this towel working. I use it to pat down my car after washing, before I do my wax. This towel will become dry and brittle if you do not keep it lightly moistened. For storing, I highly suggest wringing it out gently, then folding it back up and inserting into the storage container and closing it tightly. This will prevent the towel from drying out, and will lock in the moisture.I am able to pat down my entire car (Audi Q5) with only one stop to wring the towel. This thing can soak up a ridiculous mount of water. I don't use it for any other purpose than to PAT down my car, so it stays relatively clean, and does not require any cleaning. This also prevents the fabric from eventually coming apart due to excessive use.Know that this towel will not be like your standard cotton towel, it is not as durable, but it is much more absorbent for the size and thickness.I received this product for free in exchange for an unbiased review.

First things first - this is nothing more than an air spray with a hissing adapter stuffed into the nozzle. Yes, the hissing is loud, but it's nothing particularly special, and sounds nothing like what an animal would do to hiss. If anything, it's the high pitched and suddenly loud noise that gets the animal's attention, coupled by the knowledge that it was caught that will prevent the animal from continuing its behavior.That said, this was completely ineffective against my sister's British shorthair, one year of age. He jumped up onto the counter (a big no-no in their house) so they tried the hissing noise - he looked up briefly, bored, before resuming his adventure on the table. We were eventually forced to get up and forcibly remove him by hand. We tried twice more, spaced out in intervals, and the last one he hardly even looked back at us with the hisser.This product seems to have worked for a lot of people, but it did not work at all for me. If your pet is jumpy or easily startled, I guess it might work for you, otherwise don't bother. On the other hand, I have removed the hissing nozzle and am using the can as just a regular duster for my computer.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.

The pictures for these things don't show just how versatile these nanogrids are. I purchased my set from REI during a garage sale, and am absolutely blown away at how useful they are. Granted, I have  plenty of misgivings, but the product itself is really great, and I'm surprised there aren't as many reviews for this product right now. I will break it up into a review about the lantern, and then a review about the puck lights.LANTERN:This is a good, solid lantern with full 360 degree lighting capability, hanging, and a dual-LED flashlight beam. The color is slightly warmer (not as warm as SnowPeak's lanterns but still pleasant to sit under at night) and extremely bright. You can control the brightness by pressing and holding the proper button. There are several buttons you can use to control it - lantern, flashlight, auxiliary lights, and toggle all. The toggle also acts as a full-stop and lock button, you can turn off everything by pressing it, and lock the lamp by holding for several seconds to conserve battery and prevent accidentally turning the light on.The flaps that cover the USB and auxiliary power ports have issues. Over time, the port cover for the auxiliary lights comes loose, and does not close over the port properly. It also is at great risk of short circuiting if it rains, so make sure you take it down if clouds start coming up, and beware of condensation if you plan to leave it up overnight while camping.THE PUCKS:You receive two pucks, that close up together using magnets and anchor points. Each puck comes with 20 feet of cable, and you can string them out. There is a little wire clip attached to the wires where you can build anchor points and loop points. the puck also comes with a cut-out to insert the wire, allowing you to hang them like ceiling lights, either at an angle or straight down (there are cutouts showing you where to insert the wire to to achieve these effects). They're really well thought-out. You can add up to four pucks without degrading the battery life of the lantern, which is really impressive as the light output is significant. My only gripe about these is that the light is much colder, pure white than the original lamp. Would have liked consistent lighting across all three lights.OVERALL:The battery life is really great. There's a 4,200mah capacity within this lamp (I'm assuming by the shape it's 2x 18650 batteries inside the lamp), and I am able to run all three lights concurrently at 18 hours nonstop, which is more than enough charge to last you a weekend of camping. You can even charge the lamp with an external battery concurrently, at approximately 225mAh per hour runtime. So say if you have a standard 6,000mah external battery plugged into this thing at max charge, you could potentially get 18 hours internal + 26 additional hours from the external battery. That's a LOT of light.The lamp is compact, against my Rayovac, my black diamonds and colemans, my chinese generics and so forth, but is easily more versatile than any of them put together. Hopefully BioLite will continue the development of this system and come out with a more polished product in the near future. This is a great start to a really interesting product, but should by no means be considered the zenith of its capability.

Bought this to replace our ailing 7 year old water boiler. Zojirushi water heaters are the best in terms of performance and longevity, with due care of course. This model brings water up to 208 degrees in just a few minutes after pouting in 3 liters of water. It announces that it is complete with a quick song, which can be disabled (we disabled it after the first day..)You have two methods of pouring. One is regular, the other is slow. This lets you get out a pot of hot water in seconds, or just enough to measure out specific amounts. You can also change the temperature on the fly, or temporarily turn off the heating elements (Eg overnight) to save power.This is truly a staple in my household now, as I've had one since my early college days.Just a note, make sure you keep the unit filled at all times when it's on. You can damage the interior tank if there is not enough water inside, it's how our last one ended up dying.

Decent dry bag kit. Feels overpriced for what you get, it would not be difficult to create your own with a trip to home depot, or even animal crackers.Dry bag itself is deep, your actual limit will be how much space you have in the kayak hollow. Make sure you use sealant on the sides to prevent water from entering the chasis.

This seat cushion brings new life to my office chair. It's ridiculously plush yet firm, and after settling down in it, I find myself perfectly comfortable at my desk. I also no longer slide along the seat into a horrible slouching position over time, which is a good bonus (though now I just slouch towards the screen in a slow hunching motion). I chose not to get the lighter color, so it would last longer against messes and be easier to clean/maintain, and when I'm not at my desk it's hard to notice it's even there.This is my second seat cushion. The first one I did not maintain as well, and so the foam finally gave up the ghost and began sagging into oblivion. To improve the lifespan of memory foam, be sure to fluff it up every few days to push fresh air into the foam again, otherwise the internal structure begins to collapse and stick to one another, losing the fluffiness of the foam. I am 140lb and still make a decent impression on this seat, so it will be important for maintaining the integrity.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.

Excellent sunshade, privacy screen and heat/light reflector all in one.The sunshade fits my Audi Q5 easily. It comes packed in a tiny carry sack, and instantly unfurls into a double circle reflector. It is black on the other side. The top corners tend to sag, so you have to press the material into the glass and push into the corners. Takes a little work and you'll need to have someone in the passenger side do theirs, or go there yourself. The material does not harm my leather dash, though after a full day in the sun the car can use some airing out. Not a big deal, as the smell does not stick.Folding up is also easy, and the carry sack not so ridiculously small that you can't put the folded up screen back in.This is much more preferable than the accordian style sunshades. For one thing, those ones do not fit flush up against the windshield, take up a lot of space, and are hard to secure. This one uses tension from the windshield border to stay held up against the car, is super light and can even fit in larger glove boxes if need be. The light and heat reflection efficiency is great. I just need to also remember to close my panoramic roof...I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.

This is a thick, heavy duty mat meant to protect your seats from pets. I use it to haul my camping supplies in my car without scuffing up my seats or the back of them. It works perfectly inside of my Q5 with the back seats down. There is enough mat to strap to the back of the seats (see the photo of the dog, the mat connects to the headrests) and run along the back of the rear seats into the cargo bay.This keeps my dirty camping supplies off my seats, and any dirt/sand/mud off my seats as well. Since I kayak/camp often, this will save me many headaches of having to clean and vacuum the car each time I come back, rather than just pulling the mat out and giving it a good shake.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.

Not sure if I received a dud or what, but my case print was very low quality. Slight blur across the whole surface, as though either the printer was not very good, or the ink minutely spread a little. The top gloss is either too thin a coat or was packaged poorly, causing a blemish in the gloss (very visible in daylight).In terms of fit, can't complain. It fits the 5s like a glove, and securely. The plastic seems rather thin however, I don't think it would survive more than one drop. We will only be using this case on game-days, and swapping out immediately after, so the case is good enough for that, at least.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.

After an unfortunate incident of losing my gym bag, I was forced to pick up another one of these jump ropes. I was offered another for free in exchange for a review, and was excited to take them up on the offer. Up to date, the gyrating portion of the handle was always plastic, and this one appeared to be made of steel, which is more durable and would offer less resistance while spinning.Performance ended up being the same upon arrival - quick successive double-unders with no issues. This one came with a very nice carry bag that I could wind up the cabling and toss into here without it unspooling all over the inside of my bag. Handles continue to be small, but it's not an issue since not much grip is necessary given how smoothly the cable rotates in the bearings.Out of all the ropes I have reviewed, this one is likely my favorite. The build quality and attention to detail is great, the bag is just the perfect fit (though you have to make sure you know the coil size or it'll end up not fitting well) and the included cable is generous enough to let taller people use it (and is easily cut down for shorter people to use).I received this product for free in exchange for an unbiased review.

This is a good, solid shemagh scarf. I wouldn't say that it's on the edge of 'tactical' in terms of durability, but for every day use or light camping, it will do well.I'm only giving this scarf four stars, as several of the knots on mine arrived undone, and the scarf had frayed at the edges as a result. I had to cut off the excess and retie it all. This is not such a big deal if you're a patient person, but can be irksome nonetheless.The color I got was Black/Tan, and it looked exactly like the photo. It's VERY large sheet you receive - over 40 inches to a side. Other reviewers confirm the same thing, this is fairly large, and lightweight to boot.Another thing, if you're using this with a tactical backpack with lots of velcro, be careful as this scarf will stick to the adhesive side and pull threads unless you're very careful.I used this for camping, both to keep mosquitoes off my head, and then lightly over my face to keep it warm while I was in my sleeping bag. Because it's such a thin cloth, there was no condensation, but it kept in warm air from my breath while I slept, without being cloying like a blanket or ruining my hair like a beanie. Was a good experience being able to utilize something with so many functions.I may also use this as a simple ground cover on grass next spring, but I am not yet sure how well it will hold up to a wash.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an unbiased review.
Fun puzzle to work with vibrant colors and pieces that fit nicely together. A winner for us.
Arrived cool from the chilled expedited shipping fresh and delicious!  These are so much better than the regular size reeses cups because the chocolate to peanut butter has a better ratio.  Love 'em!

I thought I was saving money by buying the store brand lens cleaner for years.  After all they have the same active ingredients...right?  Wrong!  After a case of blepharitis, I decided to do some research.  All cleaners are NOT created equal.  After switching to this brand, not only did my blepharitis clear up quickly, but I haven't had any other issues in 2 years.  Not worth trying to save a few bucks with those cheap brands.  Do you eyes a favor and use the good stuff!

I have usually used wallpaper to line my cupboards but it can be tricky to custom cut each strip.  Didn't feel like doing that this time so I ordered this.  Absolutely love it!  So easy to measure, cut and place in cupboards.  i ended up buying enough to line my dresser drawers as well.  Stays in place and keeps everything you put on it in place as well.  Love it.

I did not get what is pictured for the burgundy but it didn't really matter because I found these huge! I wear an 8 so ordered the M which should have been perfect and a little roomy, which I wanted.  Not so.  The waist was bulky and I found the fabric also uncomfortable.  A total loser for me and they went back.
This stuff has large granules and my cat did not like the feel of them even though I mixed it with her current litter.  Plus it is so dusty!

I just bought another of these condos and was so impressed that I ordered another.  Was disappointed right away when we took it out of the box because the carpet is totally different than the other one I got.  My cat noticed too and doesn't want anything to do with it.  That's OK with me too because the second stair is defective in the front and carpet doesn't meet together right.  If she liked it I would probably have cut it off but was hesitant to do that for fear of ruining it because it would have also needing some gluing involved.  Anyway, Abby did fit on the top stair the one time she checked it out but she is small at only 6# 11 oz's.  Not sure about a big cat? I wish the carpet would have been the same type though because she goes to the other tree and immediately starts scratching it...not this one.

I do have to admit that I am super picky, almost as much as my diva kitty, when it comes to pet supplies.  This tree meets my expectations.  It is solid and well made and Abigail started checking it out as soon as I pulled it out of the box.  By the way, also loved that it was completely assembled!  The carpet isn't as thick as ones I had bought previously from Dr. Foster and Smith, but those ones are double the price too.  Also it is the perfect window height for my fur baby to watch the birds at our many birdhouses in our backyard.  A total winner here.  I ordered another one with a little different configuration that is coming tomorrow for our living room.  Yes, it looks that nice. Yea!!!  She is scratching the carpet on the posts!!!!  Up til now, it has been our carpet or the furniture.  She let me know she was not going to scratch cardboard or even sisel so this is perfect.  Love it and worth every penny!  OMG! I just looked at her and she is on one of the cradles.  How cute is that?!UPDATE: I had to come back and change my review.  Initially I had given this 5 stars but it is 8-31-15 now and the posts are falling apart with only one little kitty that doesn't scratch nearly as powerful as other cats we have had.  Never have we had one fall apart like this!  Never.  I contacted the company and heard back from Robert right away, at first but now nothing.  Very disappointed in this tree and would definitely not recommend it.  Go to Drs Foster and smith and get a better one that lasts for years.UPDATE: 9-2 I heard back from Robert again and they are sending me a replacement tree so I was happy with that.  Hopefully the new one will wear better than this last one.  Just in the week or so since I have written to the company, there are more holes in the carpet and exposed wood.  I did up the stars to 3 since the customer service is good.

While it is a good idea I guess, it is just too small for my little petite, less than 7# cat.  The top has the holes in it so she would not be able to sit on it and scratch without her leg going through.  The cat in the picture isn't on the top, but I can't imagine this would stay put while they scratched like in the picture.  Wish there weren't the holes on top, but even still it is very small.

These are sturdy and well made, but unfortunately comfort is not a quality they possess.  Extremely stiff and rigid does not translate into comfort for me and I find myself avoiding them when I go to pick out a pair of shorts for the day.  Too late to return, but I would not buy them again or add to my collection of shorts that can actually stand on their own!

I ordered this based on the product information and was disappointed when it came.  The product does not match the description and the ingredients are not the same either.  I wanted a tuna that does not contain menedione sodium bisulfate, the synthetic vitamin K that is a controversial item and banned from human food in the US and Europe.  It is not included on the label online.  It IS however in the new formula with the new label that I received.  I will not be using it and Amazon was wonderful to credit me for it.

My cat loves these!  Every time I walk by the cabinet where I keep them, she lets me know she wants at least one.  I wish they were cheaper though!!  Oh well, she can't have many treats because of allergies and if these make her happy so be it. FYI It did seem like she was having a hard time swallowing these sometimes because they are so dry so I dip the treat in water before giving it to her and that helps.

I ordered this food having some confidence in this brand and then had to cancel my order after reading the ingredient list.  I couldn't believe this company who claims to better a pets health with their fare, would include vegetable gums.  I mean really...guar gum, locust bean and carrageenan!  Unbelievable.  Check out guar gum in a google search and you will be amazed at all the problems it is causing in our pets.  My kitty gets no food with it's inclusion nor do we trust any company who uses it.

I ordered this and then had to cancel it.  I didn't read the ingredients before I ordered and then when I did was shocked to find all the plant gums included.  I mean really - guar gum, locust bean and carageenan!  OMG!  Couldn't believe it and was very happy that I could cancel my order.  I will not give foods to my furry baby that include any of those.

Very happy with this shower cream.  I have tried several of the Nivea washes...touch of happiness, smoothness and cashmere.  Then this one was on sale so I picked it up.  It has to be the creamiest of all of them!  I have very dry skin and live near Cleveland, OH where we are in the midst of an awful winter.  Today I used this for the first time and I almost forgot to use lotion after my shower!  Plus, I have used other soaps or gels that seem creamy, although not like this, but left a film in the shower which means it did on my skin as well.  This one did not plus even as creamy as it is, it rinses off easily and well. Just what we needed especially this time of year.

This is a lovely puzzle but I think it's worth noting that there were way too many pieces that weren't cut all the way through.  I had to take them apart by hand but wan't even able to do that to about half a dozen.  Those weren't even cut enough to take them apart at all.  Not a huge deal but I've never had a puzzle like this in over 50 years of working puzzles. Also there was a strange gravel in the bag of pieces as well and I've never seen that before either.  Still, I gave it 4 stars because it is such a charming picture and we will enjoy working it...after it was all cleaned up and pieces separated.  Honestly though, I would still buy it again.

After watching the first season, we had to get the second.  Too funny and well preformed by Tim Allen and Nancy Travis.  I love his editorial like comments that he makes in every show without fear of feedback.
This show is so funny!  Tim Allen is at his best trying to make it in a house full of women.  His bold comments at times are well done bringing humor to an age of conflict.  Excellent.
This turned out to be one of my favorite Wysocki puzzles.  The picture is so much more vivid than you see on line and it was easy to work too making it a total winner for us.

This was actually a fun puzzle to work, although a little tricky at times.  Still very nice and the quality is good as well.  The pieces are a nice thickness  and fit well in place and stay there until you're ready to take it apart.

This was not at all what I thought it would be or was advertised to be.  It is NOT soft to the touch and least of all to the paws of my kitty.  I mixed it with her regular litter and gave her a chance to try it.  She did not like the feel of it as evident by her not burying her waste.  In the plus 8 years we have had her, she has always used her litter box and I will not force her to use something she doesn't like.  Even if there would be an adjustment time for her to accept it, not worth it to me to put her through that.  Another huge deterrent for me was the fact that this is not light weight.  Think of how heavy a newspaper gets when it gets rained on and you'll get the idea.  All in all there are just too many negatives for me to buy this again or even use the bag I have now.
These are a good value and my cat loves them!  There are many pieces in the container and I like that they are different sizes.  Will definitely buy these again.

These chunks of lamb are all different sizes which wouldn't be a problem so much if it was for a dog. Honestly I was going to throw these away but decided to give them a try because of my cats extensive allergies.  Even though they look nothing like the picture and are not thin like the typical jerky treats we have purchased from Wellness, my cat enjoys chewing on these.  They give her jaws and teeth a good workout so I'm OK with it if she is.  I just ordered more. I only give it 4 stars though because I wish they were thinner so I could break up the bigger pieces.  With these that is impossible.

Not as big as advertised.  It holds a 13 gallon bag alright, but most of it is on the outside of the can plus you can't even fill that all the way or the goofy swing top runs in to it.  I put it in the garage.

This was a nice quality puzzle but I would never buy it again.  I'm not even sure we would put it together again!  I blame myself for this tortuous venture.  I didn't read the product information close enough to see that this is NOT an interlocking puzzle.  Even though there are only 1000 pieces, it felt at times like there were a million because there are some that are so small it was hard to work with.  The border was not even easy to find and that alone took us a few days.  Once we got that going though, the rest kind of it kind of fell in place and only took us another few days to finish it.  It was frustrating at times when the pieces were just sitting next to each other and moved whenever you would add any new ones but we found that as we worked it, it did become more stable.  All in all, even though we found it difficult and frustrating at first, we would work it again and actually enjoyed it.  The picture is beautiful and it was fun finding the "12 days of Christmas" when it was completed.

This body wash made no difference for my skin PLUS it smells horrible...very medicinal to me.  I'll go back to my Nivea creamy body washes.  One thing I can say about it though is that it lathers up well and you need very little.UPDATE 1-27-2015 My husband always gets very dry in the winter and doesn't want to fool around using a cream after his shower.  While this body wash did not work for me, he loves it.  It has completely stopped his itchy skin plus he doesn't mind the smell.  With this all in mind, I had to upgrade my review from 2 stars to 5!
This brand of melt a ways are wonderful!  They last for days longer than others I have tried, including Yankee.  One square usually lasts me about 4 days which I think make this a great deal.

This sheet is so soft!  I opened the package and threw it right in the washer so it would be ready for use on Friday which is when I change my linen.  It came out of the dryer perfect!  I love that I only had to buy the sheet I needed rather than a whole set too.  Totally happy with this purchase.

I was expecting some really good tea based on the reviews I read but that is not what I got.  First of all, it came without any manufacturers seal on the tea bags.  They came in a ziplock bag.  That should have been my first clue to pitch them.  I opened the bag and was greeted by a rancid smell that had nothing coconut about it.  Very disappointed.  Amazon made it right for me and I tossed the whole ziplock of bags.  I will never order this brand of tea again.

We just got this and started it yesterday.  You simply can't go wrong with a Wysocki puzzle.  Always quality and pictures are fun to work.  Nice thickness in pieces that stay together and lay flat until you are ready to take it apart.  Love it!
